sources.full: 5th Edition D&D x Final Fantasy XIV - Classes and Races Compendium
Gods of the Dawn of War
The Wonderous Shop of Cursed Items

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ancient platinum dragon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (2/Day)
entries: The dragon can magically heal a creature it touches for {@dice 1d10 + 4} healing.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Radiant Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a beam of radiant energy in a 5 foot wide 15-foot long line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Healing Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a vaporous breath that mends the wounds of wounded creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area is healed {@dice 2d8} hit points.

s.name: Shape Acid
entries: You choose an area of acid that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the acid as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage and the acid being manipulated loses its damaging properties until released, which when released it deals {@damage 1d6} acid damage to a creature it is dropped on.
You cause the acid to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the acid’s color or opacity. The acid must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

default: (a) 1 simple weapon and leather armor or (b) 1 medium armor
(a) simple ranged weapon or (b) 1 simple melee weapon
(a) tinker's tools, crowbar, set of magitech tools worth 50 gp

classFeatures.name: Magitech Energy
entries: Starting at 1st level, magitechnicians are people who have discovered the border between technology and magic and tore it down. By calling upon magic from the weave, they store that as raw energy that can be used to fuel their magitech devices.
At 1st level, a magitechnician can have a number of magitech energy stored at a time equal to twice their level, regaining all expended energy after a long rest.

A magitechnician stores this energy within themselves, as a spellcaster would with their spell slots, but most do not fully understand the fundamentals of spellcasting. As such, they channel that magical energy within themselves into their devices, using their bodies as a conduit for this power. Most prestigious magitechnicians find ways to store this magical energy into batteries to use for future use when they run out of energy within themselves. This raw magic is also chaotic on its own, and not as delicately drawn from the weave as most spellcasters achieve. Hence why most magitechnicians do not attempt to use spells, as it would likely result in wild magic.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Energy Options
entries: A magitechnician can expend magitech energy in the following ways starting at 1st level:

entries.name: Magical Surge
entries: You can expend 2 magitech energy to unleash a burst of magical energy. Roll a d6, on an even number you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the result. On an odd number, you deal damage to each creature within 5 ft of yourself, including you, an amount of force damage equal to the result.

entries.name: Magical Tools
entries: You can expend 1 magitech energy to empower your tools with raw magic to temporarily improve their quality. When you make an ability check using any tool, roll a d6 and add the number rolled to your result. You must choose to do so before the result is determined.

classFeatures.name: Tinker's Tools Improvement
entries: Starting at 1st level you become very proficient with your tinkers tools, adding a +1 to your Tinkers Tools. You gain this benefit again at 5th, 9th, 13th and 17th levels.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 1st level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Magitech Gear
entries: Starting at 2nd level your expertise in inventing has allowed you to create your very own set of Magitech Gear. Magitech Gear is essentially both your armor, and your workstation. The armor itself has a lot of compartments that store your various items and tools.You can don and doff the armor as a bonus action. While doffed, your armor can transform into a workstation that you can use to craft your various different magitech devices, although a lab would still be nicer to have.

The armor is crafted using various lightweight materials, and has defense systems to help you avoid immediate danger. While wearing the armor, your AC becomes 11 + your Intelligence modifier to simulate the complexity of its self defense systems. In addition, you can spend magitech energy to enhance the armor’s defences temporarily. As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend magitech energy to do one of  the following:

items: You can spend 2 magitech energy to generate an arcane barrier. Your armor class increases by 2 and you take half damage from the magic missile spell. This bonus lasts until the start of your next turn.
You can spend 1 magitech energy to increase the effectiveness of your weapons. You add a +1 bonus to your next attack and damage roll made using a magitech device.

You can spend 1 or 2 magitech energy to increase your armor’s defenses temporarily. The next time you take damage, you reduce that damage by 1d6 per magitech energy spent in this way. This effect lasts until the start of your next turn.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Weapons
entries: Starting at 2nd Level your creativeness and knowledge of mechanics allows you to create unique magitech weapons. You can create up to two magitech weapons when you gain this feature, creating more will require a gold cost determined by the DM. When you craft a magitech weapon, you use the following guidelines:

items: Choose any non-magical martial or simple melee weapon, you use the statistics for that weapon when determining its damage dice and damage type. You can also choose a firearm found in the DMG if your DM uses them.
You use your Intelligence modifier for the attack and damage rolls of the weapon.

The appearance of the weapon is ultimately up to you, but often should resemble the base weapon you chose to use for its statistics with some added modification, like tubes extending into your magitech gear or pulsating arcane energy in the blade for example.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Energy Weapon Options
entries: You can also spend magitech energy to do one of the following:

items: You can spend 1 magitech energy to increase your weapon’s damage output. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack using a magitech weapon, you can add an additional 1d10 force damage.
As a bonus action you can spend 2 magitech energy to improve the efficiency of your magitech weapons. You gain advantage on your next attack roll using a magitech weapon.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Research
entries: As a Magitechnician you are capable of doing many things. From crafting complex constructs to making mundane gadgets. Your limit is your imagination, however you must also do the necessary research to accomplish what you wish.

Beginning at 3rd level, you start with 3 Magitech Research options. You gain additional Magitech Research options when you gain levels in this class as shown in the Magitechnician Table. Some Magitech Research options will have prerequisites that must be met before taking them.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Weapon Improvement
entries: At 5th level your weapon deals 1d6 extra damage of the weapon’s type. Additionally, you can change the weapon’s damage to be slashing, bludgeoning, piercing, or force damage. At 10th level the extra damage die becomes a d8 and at 15th level it becomes a d10.

Also at 5th level your magitech weapons become magical for the purposes of overcoming magical resistance. At 10th level they receive a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls. At 15th level, this bonus becomes +2.

classFeatures.name: Additional Magitech Energy Weapon Options
entries: In addition, you gain the following options to use magitech energy using your magitech weapons:

items: When you make an attack roll using a magitech weapon, you can spend 5 magitech to cause the attack to automatically hit, however when you do so you do the minimal possible damage with your weapon. If it is a ranged weapon, it must be within the normal range of the weapon.
As a bonus action on your turn, you can spend 5 magitech energy to make a rapid attack using a magitech weapon. You make one attack using a magitech weapon as part of this bonus action.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Gear Improvement
entries: Upon reaching 6th Level, you have improved your armor with your constant tinkering. Your magitech gear’s armor class becomes 12 + Intelligence Modifier and wearing the improved armor stimulates your body, granting you a slight boost to your movement speed. Your movement speed increases by 10 ft.
At 11th level the armor class becomes 13 + Intelligence Modifier and at 16th level it becomes 14 + Intelligence Modifier.

classFeatures.name: Additional Magitech Energy Gear Options
entries: You also gain the following options to use your Magitech Energy while wearing your magitech gear:

list: When you make a Strength or Dexterity saving throw, you can spend 5 magitech energy to roll a d6 and add it to the result.
Whenever you make an ability check to grapple a creature or try to avoid being grappled, you can spend 5 magitech energy to roll a d6 and add it to the result.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Invention Improvement
entries: At 7th level, your magitech invention becomes significantly more complex and versatile. As an action, you can magically transform your invention into any set of tools on the artisans tools list. In addition, the range of complexity your invention can be capable of increases. Work with the DM on how you want to approach these improvements.
Regardless of the changes, the invention’s armor class increases by your proficiency bonus and gains an amount of temporary hit points at the start of your turns equal to your Intelligence modifier.

An example of the complex tasks the invention can do can be using a temporal fluctuation to turn back time for a specific creature, allowing them to re-roll an ability check using magitech energy or allow you to teleport from one space to another nearby space using magitech energy.
You receive another improvement at 13th and 19th levels.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 7th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Tinker's Tools Improvement
entries: See 1st level Tinker's Tools Improvement Feature

classFeatures.name: Magitech Weapon Improvement
entries: See 5th level Magitech Weapon Improvement Feature

classFeatures.name: Magitech Gear Improvement
entries: See 6th level Magitech Gear Improvement Feature

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Invention Improvement
entries: See 7th level Magitech Invention Improvement

classFeatures.name: Tinker's Tool Improvement
entries: See 1st level Tinker's Tool Improvement Feature

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Magitech Weapon Improvement
entries: See 5th level Magitech Weapon Improvement

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Gear Improvement
entries: See 6th level Magitech Gear Improvement

classFeatures.name: Tinker's Tool Improvement
entries: See 1st level Tinker's Tool Improvement

classFeatures.name: Magitech Specialization Feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Magitech Specialization

classFeatures.name: Magitech Invention Improvement
entries: See 7th level Magitech Invention Improvement Feature

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Rejuvenation
entries: At 20th level, your magitech energy becomes more efficient and more reliable for everyday use. When you roll initiative while you have 0 magitech energy, you regain 10 magitech energy.

classFeatures.name: Magitech Mastery
entries: Also at 20th level, you have honed your skills as a Magitechnician and have placed contingency properties to your devices. Whenever you fail an ability check using your tinkers tools or miss an attack roll with a magitech weapon, you can spend 10 magitech energy to automatically succeed the roll instead. You can do this a number of times equal to your intelligence modifier, regaining expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Combat Specialization
entries: A combat specialist has focused entirely on the combat implications of magitech, solely creating magitech for combat purposes. It allows you to further improve your magitech weapons beyond their intended purposes and your gear can gain augmentations beyond what was initially imaginable. While every specialist has the capabilities for combat, none will be as prominent as this one.

subclassFeatures.name: Battle Mechanics
entries: Starting at 1st level, your mind has been geared more towards combat and defending yourself using your own wit. You gain proficiency with martial weapons, heavy armor, and shields. In addition, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills: acrobatics, athletics, insight, or stealth.
In addition, whenever you make an ability check using one of the listed skills, you can spend 2 magitech energy to gain advantage on that check.

subclassFeatures.name: Fighting Style
entries: Also at 1st level, pick one fighting style from the Fighter “Fighting Styles”.

subclassFeatures.name: Physical Augmentation
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can begin to make “Augmentors” which allows you to temporarily grant you bonuses to your physical capabilities. Whenever you make an ability check using strength or dexterity, as a bonus action you can use one of these Augmentors to add an amount to the roll equal to your Intelligence modifier.
When you finish a long rest, you create a number of these Augmentors equal to your intelligence modifier. Unused Augmentors lose their magic by the beginning of your next long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Energizing Shield
entries: Starting at 7th level you can spend an action to emit a veil of magitech energy around you. Spend up to half your hit dice to gain temporary hit points equal to what you roll. While you have these temporary hit points, you have resistance to all damage except force and psychic. Once your energizing shield is reduced to 0 you cannot use it again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Versatile Weaponry
entries: At 11th level, your magitech weapons become more versatile and ready to use in a pinch. Once per round, you can draw a stow away magitech weapons as a free action rather than a free item interaction and you can draw and stow away two weapons at the same time.

In addition, you can combine a ranged magitech weapon with a melee magitech weapon to make a hybrid weapon. When you do so, it becomes a two-handed weapon and you can use either ranged or melee however the range on the weapon is halved when made as a hybrid weapon.

subclassFeatures.name: Battle Scanner
entries: At 14th level you have learned how to create a headgear device that can detect combat capabilities of some creatures. As a bonus action you can spend 5 magitech energy to determine if the creature has any weaknesses, resistances, or immunities to certain damage types and its creature type, after reading the creature at least once, you gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and saving throws against that creature’s attacks, spells, and magical effects, and they have a -2 penalty to hit you. These properties only apply once, and end when you finish a long rest.

Also, as a bonus action by spending  5 magitech energy, you can learn 1 random property that you have not already learned or known about that creature. Example being if it has regeneration, spellcasting, etc.

subclassFeatures.name: Battle Mastery
entries: At 18th level you have become a master of combat with your technology. It costs half as much gold to repair any damaged weapons or craft new ones. You can also make an additional weapon attack during your Attack Action.
In addition, pick an additional fighting style from the Fighter “Fighting Styles”.

subclassFeatures.name: Mage Specialization
entries: Being a Mage Specialist, you have focused on becoming a spellcaster through technological means rather than unnatural means - much like the wizard who takes the studious direction when it comes to learning magic.

subclassFeatures.name: Magitech Focus
entries: Starting at 1st level you pick one of the following classes: Wizard, Sorcerer, Artificer. You gain the Spellcasting Feature from that class following their spell slots and regaining expended spell slots after a long rest, however the way you prepare spells and cantrips is different. Regardless of the class you always start with 2 cantrips and can prepare an amount of spells equal to your Magitechnician level + your Intelligence Modifier. Your spellcasting ability is always Intelligence regardless of the class you chose. You gain an additional cantrip at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

Your spell casting relies solely on a “Magitech Focus”, a device that can emulate the means of spellcasting of the class you chose. If the spell requires verbal or somatic components, faint whispers can be heard from the device that emulate the words spoken and small electrical sparks will emulate the motions required for the spell.

In order to cast a spell that requires a consumed material component, you can either have the material on hand or spend Magitech Energy equal to 2 per 10gp worth of the consumed item. If the required material component is worth less than 10 gp, it costs just 1 Magitech Energy. If your Magitech Focus is ever destroyed it costs 50 gp to craft a new one.

subclassFeatures.name: Technomage Apprentice
entries: Starting at 3rd level, you begin to learn the various different kinds of magic, how they work, and how to incorporate them into your various devices. You can create a new device similar to your Magitech Focus, a “Techno Focus”, the difference here is that it is dedicated to casting 1 spell in your possession.

You can spend some time during a short or long rest repreparing that spell into this device. While the spell is prepared in this device, you do not have to have the spell prepared in order to cast it. The spell’s level must be equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded up) in order to prepare it into your Techno Focus. magitech energy is required to cast spells from your Techno Focus, costing an amount of magitech energy equal to 2 x the spell’s level.

Spells cast using your Techno Focus can only be cast using their original spell level, and cannot be cast at a higher level. You can only have 1 spell prepared in your Techno Focus and you can only have 1 Techno Focus in your possession at a time. If your Techno Focus is ever destroyed, it costs 200 gp to craft a new one.

subclassFeatures.name: Empowered Magitech
entries: Starting at 7th level whenever you roll damage for a magitechnician spell, you add your Intelligence Modifier to the damage. Also, whenever you roll a 1 on a damage die you can reroll it but must use the new result even if it is a 1.

subclassFeatures.name: Magic Overload
entries: Starting at 11th level, you can cast 2 spells at the same time, either combining their effects or separately casting both. Doing so however has a 50% chance to damage your Magitech Focus which will require a DC 20 Tinkers Tools check to repair.
When your Magitech Focus becomes damaged, you cannot cast spells higher than 2nd level and each time you cast a spell, and the turn it was damaged, you take 2d10 force damage.
Once you use a Magic Overload, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Advanced Technomage
entries: Starting at 14th level you can now create two additional Techno Focuses to prepare spells into. Also, you can craft one additional Techno Focus that you can configure to be used by one ally of your choosing. When they use this specialized Techno Focus, instead of Magitech Energy they can spend hit points equal to 2 x the spell’s level.

subclassFeatures.name: Technomagic Mastery
entries: Starting 18th level, you have mastered the art of crafting magical devices. Crafting magical items costs half as much time and gold. In addition, you gain an additional attunement slot that you can use to attune to magical items, but you can only attune to a magic item you have crafted.
When you craft magic items, for flavor you generally want to incorporate them into some kind of device, having gears and electronics incorporated into them.

subclassFeatures.name: Inventor Specialization
entries: Whether you chose to never stop tinkering, or you wanted to really push how far you can go with magitech, the Inventor is by far the most experimental type of Magitechnician. You delve into things that shouldn’t ever work, your inventions go haywire at times which can either make or break a situation. You rely on your wit and dumb luck, sometimes that causes a breakthrough, but sometimes this may explode in your face. “Go big or go home” as you might say.

subclassFeatures.name: Mind of Creativity
entries: As your methods rely mostly on creating something new out of a theory, you have a masterfully creative mind. While not particularly good at one specific thing, you have managed to obtain a masterful mind when it comes to recalling knowledge.

Starting at 1st level, you can add half your proficiency bonus to Intelligence checks that do not already add your proficiency bonus to the roll. In addition you gain expertise in any 2 skills or tools that you are proficient with.

subclassFeatures.name: Tools of the Inventor
entries: Also at 1st level, you gain proficiency with two tools of your choice.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Magitech Research
entries: As an Inventor, your level of study is unmatched by other Magitechnicians. While you do not master one particular field of study, you have the uncanny ability to learn multiple fields at once.
At 3rd level, you gain 2 additional Magitech Research options. You also gain an additional Magitech Research Option at 9th and 15th levels.

subclassFeatures.name: Chaotic Theory
entries: Your creative mind leads you to ask questions no one else would think about. You ask the “What if?” kind of questions. As such, you’ve been able to adjust various things with your magitech.

Starting at 7th level, you gain the ability to alter the properties of your magitech devices. When you impose a saving throw using a Magitechnician spell or a Magitech Device, you can change the saving throw from one ability score to another. You can do so a number of times equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

In addition, when you deal acid, cold, fire, force, lightning, necrotic, radiant, or thunder damage using a Magitechnician spell or Magitech Device, you can substitute that damage type with one other type from that list (you can change only one damage type per casting of a spell or use of a Magitech Device). You replace one energy type for another by altering the spell's formula as you cast it or by substituting materials or energy outputs to the device.

While the Chaotic Theory feature offers increased versatility, at the table its effects can be difficult to spot by the other players. Take a moment to describe how you alter your spells magitech devices. Think of a signature change your character is particularly proud of. Be inventive, and make the game more fun for everyone by playing up the sudden, unexpected tricks your character can employ. For example, a fireball transformed to require a Strength save might become a sphere of burning rock that shatters and slams into its target. A charm person that requires a Constitution save might take the form of a vaporous narcotic that alters the target's mood.

subclassFeatures.name: Dedicated Ally
entries: As an Inventor you value what you have created, but it all goes back to your first ever creation. Your Magitech Invention. You’ve had it since the beginning of your travels, and it has stuck by your side since then. Perhaps it’s time to repay the favor.

Starting at 11th level you can give sentience to your Magitech Invention, allowing it to move around on its own. It can also speak, read, and write the languages of its creator. Use the Tiny Servant stat block for the purposes of its statistics, but use the invention’s hit points and AC instead of the Tiny Servant’s.
The construct can read at a slow place by scanning the words, at a rate of 100 words a minute. It can also write at the same pace, but with perfect script.

The construct follows your commands and acts after your turn has passed. You can command it as a bonus action on your turn to have it act early, but it loses its turn if you do so. Otherwise, commanding it is a free action, but it completes the action on its turn to the best of its ability.

Whenever you gain the ability score improvement feature, the construct gains it as well, and follows the same rules accordingly. It also gains any previous ability score improvements you’ve received as well. The abilities the construct increases do not have to be the same as yours.
On its turn, the construct can perform the help action as a bonus action and can do so at a range of 10 ft.

For the purposes of its own actions, the construct gains the effects that the invention was capable of, if there is no specified action or time mentioned as per using the effects it uses an action unless it specifically mentions no action is required.

subclassFeatures.name: Experimental Procedure
entries: You’ve always tinkered with things, but now you want to see how far you can really push it.

Starting at 14th level you can add “Experimental Features” to your magitech devices. A couple of examples will be provided, but work with the DM on creating your own features. A magitech device can only have 1 Experimental Feature at a time, any attempts to add another will automatically fail or cause irreparable damage to the device. An Experimental Feature has a success procedure and a failure procedure. When attempting to use an Experimental Feature roll an Intelligence Saving Throw against your Magitech Save DC. On a success the feature activates as normal. On a failure, you use the failure procedure instead. Multiple usages of the Experimental Feature causes the Save DC to be increased by 2 for each successful use and resets when you complete a long rest.
Some Examples are provided on the page below.

entries.name: Energetic Discharge
entries: Success Procedure: A wave of energy is dispersed, causing nearby creatures to be blown back. Creatures within 10 ft of the Magitech Device, or within 10ft of the target of a spell attack or magical effect originating from a Magitech Device, make a Strength Saving throw against your Magitech Save DC or be pushed back 20 ft. Regardless of the save, each creature affected takes 4d10 force damage.

Failure Procedure: The magitech device overheats and explodes, causing shrapnell to blow outward. Each creature within 60 ft of the Magitech Device must make a Dexterity Saving Throw against your Magitech Save DC or take 2d10 piercing damage and 2d10 fire damage on a failure, or half as much on a successful save. A creature holding the device has disadvantage on the save.

entries.name: Energy Drain
entries: Success Procedure: The Magitech Device absorbs energy from a creature affected by it. Whenever you hit with a Magitechnician Spell or Magitech Device, or a creature fails a saving throw imposed by a Magitechnician Spell or Magitech Device that deals damage, you regain Magitech Energy equal to half the damage dealt.

Failure Procedure: The Magitech Device drains Magitech Energy equal to twice the damage dealt. If you do not have enough magitech energy to drain, you cannot obtain Magitech Energy by any means until you complete a long rest.

entries.name: Improved Restoration
entries: Success Procedure: When the Magitech Device or Magitechnician gives a creature(s) healing, that creature(s) can also remove one of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, {@condition paralyzed}, or {@condition poisoned}.

Failure Procedure: The creature(s) being healed by the Magitech Device or Magitechnician spell has to make a Constitution Saving throw against your Magitech Save DC or is {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour.

As mentioned previously, you are more than welcome to create your own Experimental Features, so long as you make a Success and Failure Procedure for it, and the effect is moderately balanced out for a “high risk, high reward” mentality. Again, approval by the DM is most important.

subclassFeatures.name: Inventor's Prowess
entries: As you have made it this far, whether by sheer luck or big brain moments, you have mastered the art of invention to its highest degree.

Starting at 18th level, when you use your Experimental Procedure if you fail the saving throw, you can choose to succeed instead. Once you have done so, you cannot do so again until you have completed a short or long rest.
Also, it now costs half as much gp to craft and repair your Magitech Devices.

A Magictechnician is one who creates and tinkers with Magictech, powerful technology fused with and uses magic as a sort of power source. By creating a Magictechnician you need to make a relatively smart individual, one who's trained in the art of precision, and one who doesn’t fall asleep in class unless it’s way behind their level of comprehension. When creating a Magitechnician think about where their knowledge comes from, were they a natural born prodigy? Were they tutored by a prestigious teacher? Did they go to college or were they self taught? Think about all the role play aspects that the class could have and really think outside the box about the various magitech you could create and use within your arsenal.
fluff.name: Magitechnician

default: (a) any {@filter simple weapon|items|source=phb|category=basic|type=simple weapon} or (b) 1 {@item longsword|phb} OR {@item rapier|phb}

classFeatures.name: Blood Pool
entries: Starting at 1st level, you have a pool of blood magic that you can use as a buffer when you use your blood manipulation. These are represented by a number of d4s equal to your Hemomancer level. You’ll expend these “Blood Dice” to use your hemomancer abilities. Anytime you spend one of your Blood Dice, you roll them and take damage equal to the amount you rolled.

Additionally, as a bonus action you can expend one hit die to replenish 2 Blood Dice. When you do you roll your hit die as if you were restoring hit points during a short rest, but instead you take damage equal to the result.
At higher levels your Blood Dice increases in size, becoming a d6 at 5th level, a d8 at 11th level, and finally a d10 at 17th level.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation
entries: Also starting at 1st level, you have a certain control over the blood inside of you. You have access to the following abilities starting at 1st level :

entries.name: Blood Forge
entries: Whenever you roll initiative (or as a bonus action on your turn) you can spend one of your blood dice and manifest a weapon made of your own blood. This blood weapon can be any simple weapon that lacks the “special” property. The weapon uses your Blood Dice size to determine its damage die and you can either use the weapon’s damage type or necrotic damage. In addition, as part of the forging you create up to 10 pieces of ammunition for any ranged weapons. You can spend an additional Blood Die to increase the damage dice by 1. This weapon remains manifested for 1 hour, until you take a short or long rest, or you can dismiss it as a bonus action. You can use your wisdom modifier for the attack and damage rolls for this weapon instead of Strength or Dexterity. For every hour after you manifested this weapon,  you can spend an additional blood die and roll it to keep it manifested. At any time while your blood weapon is manifested, you can use a bonus action to reforge the weapon into a different one, without spending Blood Dice.

entries.name: Bloody Tendrils
entries: As a bonus action you spend a number of Blood Dice up to your Proficiency Bonus and can create a number of tendrils of blood equal to the amount of Blood Dice spent. Each of these tendrils deals necrotic damage equal to your blood die and has a reach of 10 ft. When you take the attack action, you can forgo your weapon attack to instead attack with your Tendrils, making 1 attack for each tendril you have when you take the attack action. Your Bloody Tendrils count as simple weapons and use your wisdom modifier to hit but does not add it to the damage. On a successful hit the target makes an opposed check against your Hemomancer Save DC or be grappled, the escape DC equals your Hemomancer Save DC. Once you have summoned your Bloody Tendrils you cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest. Alternatively, you can spend and roll a hit die to regain a usage of your Bloody Tendrils, taking damage equal to what you rolled.

entries.name: Blood Barrier
entries: As a reaction on your turn, you can spend 2 of your blood dice to add your Wisdom Modifier to your AC and take no damage from the Magic Missile spell. This benefit lasts until the start of your next turn. You cannot cast the shield spell while your blood barrier is active.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype Feature
entries: At 1st level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Blood Disciplines
entries: Blood Disciplines are additional extensions of your blood manipulation’s capabilities. These disciplines make every Hemomancer unique from the other, as some will master arts that others would not. You have 2 Blood Disciplines starting at 2nd level and gain more upon leveling up as shown in the Hemomancer Table

classFeatures.name: Bloody Restoration
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you gain the uncanny ability to heal after short instances of time. You restore one fourth of your hit point maximum after a short rest (rounded down), in addition when you spend a hit die to restore hit points you double the result.

classFeatures.name: Blood Bath
entries: As a bonus action on your turn you can enter a Blood Bath. While your Blood Bath is active you take 2 points of damage at the start of each of your turns. In addition you gain the following benefits :

items: You have resistance to slashing, bludgeoning, and piercing damage.
When you make an attack roll that uses Strength or Wisdom you gain a +2 bonus to the damage roll. This bonus increases by 1 at 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.
You have advantage on Wisdom and Constitution Saving Throws.

Once per round when you would take damage from a Hemomancer feature (except for this feature.), you can choose to not take damage. Doing so gives you vulnerability to the next damage roll you would suffer. This nullifies the resistance to slashing, bludgeoning, or piercing damage you would have otherwise been resistant to.
When you deal damage to a creature using a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril you replenish 1 Blood Die.

entries: Your Blood Bath remains active so long as you make an attack roll or prolong it as a bonus action. If by the end of your turn you do not do any of the following, your Blood Bath ends. Once your Blood Bath ends you cannot enter a Blood Bath again until you have finished a short or long rest. You gain an additional use of your Blood Bath at 9th and 15th levels.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 5th level you gain the following Blood Manipulation abilities :

As an action by spending a blood die, you can transmute up to 4 ounces of your blood into 4 ounces of any of the following liquids : Water, Oil, Ale, Beer, Vinegar, Wine, Basic poison, Acid, Honey, Mayonnaise. You can transmute it into other basic liquids under the GM’s discretion.

As a bonus action you can spend a blood die, when you do so you can take the dash or disengage actions as a bonus action for as many rounds equal to what you rolled. You can also dash or disengage the turn you use this feature.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Magic Infused Blood
entries: Starting at 7th level, your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils count as magical for the purposes of overcoming magical resistances.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Magic
entries: Starting at 10th level you gain the capabilities to cast magic through your control over blood. Pick three cantrips from the Wizard’s Spell list, you can now cast those cantrips using Wisdom as your Spellcasting Ability. You have 6 spells known from the Wizard’s Spell List, the maximum level spell you can learn is 3rd. You can cast each of these spells, using Wisdom as your Spellcasting Ability, by spending Blood Dice equal to the level of the spell and you can cast these spells at higher levels by spending 1 blood die per level above the original level of the spell, to a maximum of 3rd level. You do not require costly material components for the spell if it requires one, otherwise you follow all the general rules for spellcasting.
Once you have cast a spell using this feature you cannot cast that spell again until you have finished a short or long rest.

You learn 2 additional spells at 16th level and you can learn and cast spells up to 4th level. Each time you gain a level in this class, you can replace a spell learned with a different spell from the same list.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 11th level, you gain the following Blood Manipulation Abilities :

entries.name: Bloody Vitality
entries: As an action by spending a hit die you or an ally within 30ft of you can gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the result. If you give it to an ally you can roll a blood die to boost the temporary hit points by an amount equal to the result.

entries.name: Bloody Mary
entries: You can release outward  a burst of blood. Each creature, including yourself, within 30ft of you must make a Dexterity Saving Throw. You automatically fail this saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes necrotic damage equal to twice your Hemomancer level and their speed is reduced to 0. On a success they take damage equal to your Hemomancer level and their speed is not reduced.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Iron Blood
entries: Starting at 13th level, you have resistance to poison damage and advantage on saving throws against being poisoned. In addition you are immune to disease.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetyoe

classFeatures.name: Strong Blooded
entries: At 15th level choose Strength or Dexterity, you add half your proficiency bonus to ability checks and saving throws using the chosen ability score. In addition you add your proficiency bonus to Death Saving throws.

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Manipulation Improvement
entries: Starting at 17th level you gain the following Blood Manipulation Abilities :

entries.name: Bloody Curse
entries: As a bonus action choose 1 creature within 60 ft. That creature takes additional necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus when you hit them with a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril. In addition, when you reduce that creature to 0 hit points you restore 1 blood die. Also when the cursed creature falls to 0 hit points, as bonus action you can move the curse to another target within 60 ft.

entries.name: Bloody Demise
entries: As an action you can absorb blood from a corpse that has been dead for no longer than 4 hours within 10 ft of you. You gain an amount of Blood Dice into your Blood Pool equal to their CR. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

classFeatures.name: Bloody Archetype feature
entries: At 18th level, you gain a feature from your chosen Bloody Archetype

classFeatures.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a feat.

classFeatures.name: Blood Mastery
entries: At 20th level, you have attained the ultimate control over your Blood Manipulation. You gain the following abilities as a result:

items: When you would take damage from a Hemomancer feature, you can choose to take no damage instead. You can do this a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier.
When you roll initiative you regain an amount of Blood Dice equal to your Wisdom Modifier.
You can use your Blood Bath an unlimited amount of times.
Choose 1 of your 1st or 2nd level Blood Magic spells. You can cast that spell at its lowest level at will an unlimited amount of times.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bender
entries: The powers to bend and control blood, most would consider this act evil and chaotic, some would argue that it depends on the user and how they choose to use their power. As a Blood Bender you will have the powers to bend and weave the blood around you to your whim.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bending
entries: At 1st level, as an action you can spend a blood die and attempt to lock up a creature’s movements using your innate control over blood. Choose a creature no larger than one size larger than yourself within 60 ft of you, that target must make a Constitution saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, that creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn. This feature has no effect on aberrations, constructs, elementals, ooze, plants, or undead.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Manipulation Abilities
entries: Starting at 1st level, these abilities are added into your “Blood Manipulation” Feature.

entries.name: Blood Transfusion
entries: As a bonus action, by spending an amount of blood dice up to your proficiency bonus you can restore an amount of hit points to one ally, not including yourself, that you can see within 10 ft of you equal to the amount rolled by the dice. This healing has no effect on undead or constructs.

entries.name: Blood Absorption
entries: Once per round, whenever an ally or enemy within 5 ft of you takes 5 or more slashing, piercing, or necrotic damage you gain 5 temporary hit points. The amount of times per round this can be used increases by 1 at 5th level, 1 more at 11th level, and finally once again at 17th level. This effect can stack up to a maximum of 20 temp hp.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Bolstering
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can target a number of allies within 60 ft of you (not including yourself) equal to your Wisdom Modifier. You can expend 2 Blood Dice to grant them temporary hit points equal to the amount you rolled. In addition they gain advantage on their next saving throw. This feature is added to your “Blood Manipulation” feature.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Control
entries: Also at 6th level, your ability to bend the blood in your enemies has allowed you to take control of their movements. As part of your action when you use your Blood Bending, you can puppeteer them on a whim. On their turn, you can force them to do any combination of the following so long as they would have the actions to do so ignoring the stunned condition they suffered:

items: Use their action to take the attack action on a target of your choosing. Attacks made against their allies or themselves have disadvantage.
Use half their movement to move to an unoccupied space that you can see within that range. You can use their action to dash as part of this movement.
Use their action to attempt to grapple a creature, using your Hemomancer Save DC as the opposing check for the creature.
Using their action for an improvised action.
Use half their movement to drop prone, or stand up if they were already prone.
Use their Free Item Interaction.
Use their Action to doff their shield.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Magic
entries: At 14th level, the following spells are added to your spell list for your Blood Magic feature and do not count against your total known spells:

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Puppet
entries: Also at 14th level, your ability to magically control other creatures has become so potent it is almost second nature. When you use your Blood Control feature, they can instead be influenced by the Dominate Monster spell using the spell’s effects instead. If they are immune to being charmed, you instead use the Blood Control feature as per normal.
You can only use this feature once, regaining the ability to do so again after a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Overflowing Blood
entries: Starting at 18th level, whenever you enter your Blood Bath you lose 2 additional hit points at the start of each of your turns, but you restore conscious allies within 30 ft of you 4 hit points. In addition, whenever you deal damage using a Blood Manipulation feature you deal an additional 2 damage.

In addition, while in your Blood Bath when a creature would hit you or an ally within 30 ft of you with an attack, or when they would cast a spell in an area that would harm an ally, you can spend 4 Blood Dice to change the designated target to a point within range of the original weapon or spell.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Invoker
entries: Why bother trying to improve your feeble body with “Physical Labor” when you can do it when it matters and only when it matters. You fight for yourself, to keep yourself alive. If others get hurt, who cares? At least you’ll survive. That’s all that matters.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Invocation
entries: When you use your Blood Forge, you can instead infuse your blood magic into a weapon you are holding, that weapon becomes a Blood Weapon as per your blood forge feature, however it instead deals damage equal to the normal damage of the weapon plus necrotic damage equal to your blood die. You can spend an additional blood die to boost the damage by an additional die.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Manipulation Abilities
entries: Starting at 1st level, these abilities are added into your “Blood Manipulation” Feature.

entries.name: Blood Boost
entries: When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can spend a blood die and add what you rolled to the result.

entries.name: Blood Rite
entries: As a bonus action on your turn by spending 1 blood die you can call upon the powers of the elements. Choose fire, cold, lightning, radiant, or necrotic damage. Your weapon attacks deal an additional amount of damage of the chosen type equal to the size of your blood die for up to 1 minute. You can change the damage type of your rite as a bonus action, but you can only have one rite active at a time. You can end this effect early as a bonus action. You can boost the power of this rite for an extra damage die by spending an additional blood die. Once you boost the power of this rite, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Reserve
entries: Also at 1st level, you have a magical reserve that has a pool of hit points that can only be used for the cost of your Hemomancer features. Your Blood Reserve has a number of hit points equal to half your Hemomancer level plus your Constitution modifier (to a minimum of 1). Your Blood Reserve is replenished after a long rest or whenever you deal necrotic damage the reserve regains 1 hit point.

subclassFeatures.name: Bloody Reflexes
entries: At 6th level you add your Wisdom Modifier to your Initiative checks. In addition, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an ice storm spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you can spend a blood die to instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Magic
entries: At 14th level, the following spells are added to your spell list for your Blood Magic feature and do not count against your total known spells:

subclassFeatures.name: Improved Blood Arts
entries: At 14th level your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils become faster and deadlier. Whenever you take the attack action you can make up to two attacks with your blood weapons instead of one. In addition, your blood weapons and bloody tendrils score a critical hit on a 19 or 20.

subclassFeatures.name: Blood Rage
entries: Starting at 18th level when you use your Blood Bath, you can lash out at nearby creatures. When you take the attack action, before you attack you can spend any number of Blood Dice, each creature within 10 ft of you must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, they take necrotic damage equal to what you rolled and are knocked prone. On a success they take half damage and are not knocked prone. Then, until the end of your next turn you deal the maximum possible damage to creatures with your weapon attacks.

subclassFeatures.name: Lycanthropy
entries: Humanity is a small price to pay for power, let the madness overcome you so that your true power can flourish. Release the inner beast within you, unshackle the monster and let loose. Your enemies are your target, your allies an obstacle. Let no one get in your way, destroy anything that does. Lycanthropy comes in many forms. Each version of the curse is bound to a specific beast: wolf, bear, tiger, boar, and rat are a few of the more well-known variations.

subclassFeatures.name: Curse of the Lycan
entries: Beginning at 1st level, choose Wolf, Bear, Tiger, Boar, or Rat. You gain a hybrid transformation that varies based on what you choose. As an action for up to 10 minutes on your turn you can transform into your Lycan form, doing so will grant you effects depending on what beast you chose. Once your transformation ends you cannot transform again until you finish a short or long rest.

entries.name: Any
entries: You gain Bite and Claw attacks. They both use strength and deal 1d8 piercing or slashing damage of your choice. You gain vulnerability to damage from silvered weapons. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight and smell. You gain a darkvision for up to 60ft. You cannot discern color in this darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Wolf
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks. You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Bear
entries: Your creature size increases by 1 stage. In addition when you take damage you can reduce that damage by 1d4. You can only reduce damage in this way once per round. This damage reduction increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th, 11th, and 17th levels.

entries.name: Tiger
entries: Your movement speed increases by 10 ft. Your jump distance is doubled. If you move at least 20 ft. straight toward a creature and then hit it with a claw attack on the same turn, that target must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC: 8 + Proficiency + Strength) or be knocked prone. If the target is prone, you can make one bite attack against it as a bonus action.

entries.name: Boar
entries: You gain a tusk attack. (Uses the bite and claws stats) If you move at least 15 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with your tusks on the same turn, the target takes an extra 1d6 slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw (DC: 8 + Proficiency + Strength) or be knocked prone. Once per round if you would take damage equal to your Hemomancer level or less that would reduce you to 0 hit points, you instead remain at 1 hit point.

entries.name: Rat
entries: You have advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks. You have advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of your allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

entries.name: Raven
entries: You have a fly speed equal to your walking speed. You cannot fly if you are wearing medium or heavy armor. You have talons that you can use to attack at a reach of 15 ft. These talons do a d6 of piercing damage and use your Strength or Dexterity to attack.

subclassFeatures.name: Lycan Madness
entries: Starting at 6th level, when you enter your Blood Bath you can immediately enter your Lycan form. When you enter your Lycan form while under the effects of Blood Bath you gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom Modifier at the start of each of your turns unless you are hit by a silvered weapon. In addition your Lycan weapons (claws, bite, etc.) deal necrotic damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier and count as Blood Weapons. Whenever you take damage from an ally, whether it be from a spell - misfire - etc., make a Wisdom Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save you go into a frenzy, and you are under the effects of the Enemies Abound spell. The spell ends when your Blood Bath ends.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Magic
entries: At 14th level, the following spells are added to your spell list for your Blood Magic feature and do not count against your total known spells:

subclassFeatures.name: Dark Howl
entries: Starting at 14th level, as an action while in your Lycan form you can let out a howling roar. Each creature that can hear you must make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save they take 4d10 thunder damage and are stunned for 1d4 rounds. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are not stunned. You gain 1 blood die for each creature that took damage from this effect.

subclassFeatures.name: Mastered Lycan
entries: Starting at 18th level, you are always under the effects of your Lycan form, but can retain your regular appearance. In addition as an action by spending 2 Blood Dice you can transform into the true form of the beast you chose. When you transform you retain your class features, statistics, and skill proficiencies. You can transform into the following beasts depending on what you chose for your Curse of Lycan.

entries.name: Wolf
entries: Dire Wolf, Wolf, Winter Wolf

entries.name: Bear
entries: Brown Bear, Black Bear, Cave Bear, Polar Bear, Huge Polar Bear

entries.name: Tiger
entries: Tiger, Sabertooth Tiger

entries.name: Boar
entries: Boar, Giant Boar

entries.name: Rat
entries: Rat, Giant Rat

entries.name: Raven
entries: Raven, Giant Raven

subclassFeatures.name: Vampirism
entries: A cloaked man walks through the night, hides his face from the blinding sunlight, he gave his humanity to walk amongst the dead and achieved the immortality humanity has always sought after. He cared not for the cost, nor the lives he took. He merely watched as the pile of corpses grew and grew. His slow descent into insanity, one cannot call him a man any longer. He has befallen to a mere monster who lurks in the cold, dark, rainy night.

subclassFeatures.name: Vampiric Nature
entries: Starting at 1st level, you have begun to strip away your humanity in order to gain great power. Your creature type becomes both humanoid and undead and you no longer need to breathe. You also have a darkvision out to a range of 60 ft if you did not already have it.

In addition, at the start of each of your turns you regain 1 hit point provided you already had at least 1 hit point. You do not gain this benefit if you take any amount of radiant or fire damage, or if you are in direct sunlight.

You have a special bite attack that deals 1d6 piercing damage and uses your Strength or Dexterity modifiers to hit and to damage. You can spend a blood die when you hit with your bite to deal an extra amount of necrotic damage equal to what you rolled. You can only use this bite attack on a willing creature, or on a creature you are grappling if they are within 5ft of you.
You also have the following weaknesses, but as an action you can spend a blood die to subside one of them. You can only subside one weakness at a time:

items: You gain a vulnerability to sunlight, giving you disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks while in direct sunlight.
You can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
You have vulnerability to radiant damage from holy water.
You have vulnerability to piercing damage, which nullifies any immunities or resistances to it from other sources.

subclassFeatures.name: Vampiric Charm
entries: Also at 1st level, you can target one humanoid you can see within 30 ft. If they can see you, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC or be charmed by you. The charmed target regards you as a trusted friend to be heeded and protected. Although the target isn't under your control, it takes your requests or actions in the most favorable way it can. It is also a willing target for your bite attack.

Each time you or your companions do anything harmful to the target, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on itself on a success. Otherwise, the effect lasts 8 hours or until you’re killed, on a different plane of existence than the target, or take a bonus action to end the effect.

When your Vampiric Charm ends, the target knows it was charmed, but does not recall anything it did whilst charmed or the one who charmed it. It instead remembers a cold dark feeling and then nothingness.
You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Proficiency Bonus, regaining all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Vampiric Shapechanger
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can use an action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist. You count as a Shapechanger for the purposes of certain spell or magical effects.

While in bat form, you can't speak, your walking speed is 5 feet, and you have a flying speed of 30 feet. Your statistics, other than your size and speed, are unchanged. Anything you are wearing or carrying either transforms with you or you can have them drop to the ground beneath you. When your items transform with you, they merge with your new form becoming unusable. You revert to your true form if you die.

While in mist form, you can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. You are weightless, have a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. Anything you are wearing or carrying either transforms with you or you can have them drop to the ground beneath you. When your items transform with you, they merge with your new form becoming unusable. In addition, if air can pass through a space, you can do so without squeezing, and you can't pass through water. You have advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and are immune to all nonmagical damage, except radiant damage from holy water.

Each of your forms lasts for an hour, after which you revert to your true form. You can also end them as a bonus action on your turn. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier, regaining all expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeatures.name: Vampiric Coffin
entries: Also at 6th level, you have an extra dimensional resting place that is always with you. You can carry a tiny mundane container, such as a tiny replica coffin, or a full-sized object of similar nature as a doorway to this resting place. As an action, you can magically teleport into this demiplane so long as the object is on your person or leave it as a bonus action. Whenever you take a long rest, you can do so in this resting place. When you do so, you can regain all of your hit dice instead of half at the end of your long rest and you receive an amount of temporary hit points equal to your Hemomancer level.

You can invite a number of creatures up to your Wisdom modifier into your resting place, creatures who are charmed by you are not included in the maximum number of creatures you can have in your resting place. Creatures who rest in your Coffin gain the same benefits as you do.

When you use this feature, your gateway object remains in the material plane. If it is ever destroyed, or when you leave your resting place, you and each creature inside your resting place reappear in unoccupied adjacent spaces within 5ft of the destroyed object, or the nearest unoccupied adjacent spaces if one is not within 5 ft.
Your resting place can take any appearance you like, so long as it fits within a 30 ft by 30 ft cube.

Creatures cannot remain in your resting place if you are not there, unless you grant them permission to do so. You always know if there is a creature inside of your resting place, and you always know the exact location of the object you use for your resting place.

subclassFeatures.name: Additional Blood Magic
entries: At 14th level, the following spells are added to your spell list for your Blood Magic feature and do not count against your total known spells:

subclassFeatures.name: Greater Vampirism
entries: At 14th level, you have matured into a full vampire, and have gained a stronger understanding of your abilities. You gain the following improvements:

items: Your regeneration now regenerates 2 hit points instead of 1 while you have at least 1 hit point.
You can subside an additional weakness from your Vampiric Nature.
You gain resistance to necrotic damage.
Your darkvision range increases by 60 ft.
Your Vampiric Charm now lasts for 24 hours instead of 8.

subclassFeatures.name: Vampire Spawn
entries: Also at 14th level, when you kill a humanoid using your bite, you can raise that creature for a short time. That creature becomes a Vampire Spawn and uses its stat block. The vampire spawn remains for an amount of days equal to your Wisdom modifier, or until it is reduced to 0 hit points. When it is reduced to 0 hit points, it is destroyed along with any non-magical items it was wearing or carrying. You can only have 1 vampire spawn at a time. You can also subside one of the vampire spawn’s Vampire Weaknesses if you only subside one of your own.

subclassFeatures.name: True Vampirism
entries: At 18th level, your creature type is no longer humanoid, and only counts as undead. You no longer need to drink or eat and you are immune to poison damage and being poisoned. You no longer suffer the effects of old age and cannot be aged magically.
In addition, you gain 1 Legendary Resistance per day, which can be used to automatically succeed a saving throw if you were to fail one.
You can use your Vampiric Charm and your Vampiric Shapechanger an unlimited amount of times.

Shattered pieces of what remains of his humanity, his sacrifices his own vitality to conjure powerful weapons of destruction made from his own blood. Ripping and tearing his foes to pieces, absorbing their own essence into his being. With a maniacle grin, he chuckles in the face of blood and death, knowing full well he is on borrowed time.
fluff.name: Hemomancer

default: (a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}
(a) a grimoire which acts as your {@item spellbook|phb} and spellcasting focus.

fluff.name: Arcanist
entries: A lightly armoured Hyur maneuvers through the battlefield alongside his carbuncle companion. The carbuncle dashes ahead and lets out a burst of magical energy, dazing their foes and creating an opening for their allies, swaying the battle in their favour.

A quiet Miqo'te woman carefully scratches notes into her research tome. After a long times passes, she wipes the sweat from her brow as a shining avian figure bursts forth from another plane, ready to heed her every command.
A carefully launched arrow catches the the Lalafell's ally. Invoking a few words and raising their grimoire to the sky, healing magics close the wound, allowing their friend to fight on.

These skillful magic users take on many roles on the battlefield, be it a commander of their allies, a medic or a destructive force. Through careful planning and preparation an Arcanist becomes an indomitable force to stand against.

entries.name: Magic Through Research
entries: Arcanists work hard to explore the secrets of magic, only through deep understanding of formulas and geometrical figures can they produce magical effects. Their tomes and grimoires are filled with fascinating formulas and diagrams, which when fed magical energy from the arcanist's body burst forth into powerful spells. Ever thirsty for greater knowledge, an Arcanist seeks knowledge and then puts it to the test.

entries.name: Borrowed Power
entries: One thing which sets the Arcanist apart from other spell casters is their usage of summoning companions. Early in their studies an Arcanist learns to summon forth a magical servant. This is the first major task of an Arcanist and helps to sharpen their powers. The companion borrows some of the arcanist's power and in return gives the caster an unwavering ally on the field of battle.

entries.name: Creating an Arcanist
entries: An arcanist's path begins with a few formulas scrawled in a tome and a large amount of time practicing their craft, researching to unlock greater power to have at their disposal. You must consider what was your arcanist's call to action? Perhaps their thirst for knowledge couldn't be satisfied at their desk, or they saw that their abilities could help the world in another way. Perhaps they uncovered some information that they must investigate or acted upon.
Whatever the cause which brought the arcanist out into the world, they do so with their research in hand and companion by their side.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Arcanist quickly by following these suggestions. First make Intelligence your highest ability score, following with Wisdom. Second take the Sage background. Third, take the {@spell Acid Splash}, Mage Hand and Prestidigitation cantrips.

default: (a) a {@item scholar's pack|phb} or (b) an {@item explorer's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Astrologist
entries: A slender Elezen woman draped in fine robes sits in a dark room across from a man who feels he has lost his way. Smiling she releases her Planisphere and a flurry of arcana cards into the air. From the squall of cards she draws and divines the man's fate, instilling in the lost soul a sense of peace and hope for the future.

A Roegadyn man stands behind his allies on the battlefield. He raises his Star Globe to the sky and begins to channel energy into his trusty tool. Using the power of the stars above, soothing energy radiates outwards, enveloping his allies, bringing them succor in the heat of the battle.

A well versed Auri Astrologian stands before a congregation of people. She has come to spread the word of her rare new art, offering understanding of the future through the power of the stars. It has become her sacred duty to bring the stars into view for the common people.

Whether they stand behind their allies granting them the blessing of the stars and moons of the universe, or standing alongside them on the front line, Astrologians manipulate the fates of both friends and foe to find success.

entries.name: Wielders of Fate
entries: The first task of all Astrologians is to gain a mastery over using the deck of sixty. To them, fortunetelling is a tool which allows them to interpret the stars themselves. Their deck is based on the constellations that they study. The Astrologians are gidted a divining deck when they begin their study from their master. They act as a conduit for the magic energy gathered by their star globes, passing the empowering magic from the stars to their allies.

entries.name: An Elegant Tool
entries: THe Star Globe is a tool used by Astrologians which allows them to locate and draw in power from the stars. The globes are formed by large rings of precious metal and lenses. The rings are marked using a large spread of precise markings and which allows the user to find and map the stars in order to draw power without a view of the sky.

entries.name: Creating an Astrologian
entries: Astrologians hail from a faraway island where knowledge is viewed as the greatest virtue. Astrologians are usually scholars by trade, and specialized in the study of astromancy. Often they find themselves born into the scholar's life or into highborn families. Sometimes low born apprentices find themselves working beneath a master of astromancy and learn how to tap into the magic of the stars. Astrologians are blessed with the ability to read the future. Through the use of the deck of sixty and the stars they are capable of tapping into the future, though the farther they look, the less clear things become. Some Astrologians travel the land to share this gift of foresight with everyone, while others seek out opportunities to spread their young order of magic around the realm. Others track down allies and adventure, as the stars had mandated that the Astrologian set out on a quest for a task which they cannot see the end of. Astrologians borrow power from the cosmos, and in return seeks to see that the will of the stars is done.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make an Astrologian quickly by following these suggestions. First make Wisdom your highest ability score, following with Constitution. Second, take the {@background sage} background. Third, take the {@spell Dancing Lights}, {@spell Sacred Flame}, {@spell Guidance} and {@spell True Strike} cantrips and the first level spells {@spell Cure Wounds} and {@spell Divine Favor}.

default: a spellcasting focus (a cane, staff, wand or smiliar object)
(a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b) a {@item scholar's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Black Mage
entries: A Lalafell stands before a horde of kobolds, bloodthirsty they dash towards him. With a few skillful waves of his staff, a lrage fire ball erupts from the gen inlaid at the en of the staff, causing massive fiery explorsion, leaving nothing but ash.

A woman wearing dark robes grins as she waves her hand before a guard refusing her entry. With a few choice of words and a spell, the guard happily steps aside, unlocking the passage bowing to her as she passes.
An Elezen laughs at the umbral hue of his magics as he unleashes a fireball empowered by dark magics upon his foes, his demonic servant chuckling at his side watching the dust settle.
A black mage is a powerful ally who wields forbidden magic. This raw energy manifests itself into devastating spells and effects. Their power is only rivaled by their thirst to increase their power.

entries.name: A Dark Past
entries: In days long past, There existed a powerful clan of mages and their arcane art known as black magic—a potent magic of pure destructive force born forth by a sorceress of unparalelled power. Those who learned to wield this instrument of ruin came to be called black mages, out of both fear and respect for their gift. Yet great power served to corrupt the judgement of mortal man, an so he unknowingly set upon the path of ruin.
Adventurers who take the black will become agents of devastation, capable of annihilating those who oppose them through little more than the force of their will.

entries.name: Ties to the Void
entries: In order for a mage to don the black, they must extensively what they call the void. This is another plane of existence from which Black Mages draw knowledge from in order to unlock power within themselves. Most black mages are able to explore the knowledge gained from the void through tomes and texts now, but some who thirst for new power may attempt to tap into the void directly. Black Mages continue to grow within their craft through continuing their study of the dark arts.

entries.name: Creating a Black Mage
entries: Black Mages are earnest in their desires and reasons for taking the black. More often than not it is in the pursuit of power or out of sheer curiousity. You must know whay you are pursuing this power or why you are curious about the dark arts. You must also decide where you began to dip your toes into the world of black magic. Did you join a cult of mages who studied the art? Perhaps a proper school which provides the proper materials to explore black mage. maybe you were taken under the wing of a mentor who has mastered the art.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a black mage quickly by following these suggestions. First, Intelligence should be your highest ability score, followed by Constitution and Dexterity. Second, choose the {@background sage} background. Third, choose the {@spell mage hand}, {@spell light} and {@spell ray of frost} cantrips, along with the following 1st-level spells for your spellbook: {@spell burning hand}, {@spell charm person}, {@spell feather fall}, {@spell mage armor}, and {@spell sleep}

default: (a) an {@item explorer's pack|phb} or (b)a {@item scholar's pack|phb}

fluff.name: Blue Mage
entries: After careful preparation and intensive study, a man wearing blue robes makes careful notes of a dangerous beast just outside of the reach of an arrow. When their study is complete they make the call and their allies strike out against the beast, listening to the insights the researcher had found.

A woman wearing tough leather armor mixed with long following lengths of blue fabric skillfully strikes out with the scimitar. With grace and power, the woman unleashes one of the many monstrous souls she's absorbed, shrouding their foe in flames.

The Blue Mage is a curious soul who has entwined their life with that of the monsters and beasts who roam the world. Whether writing a chronical of all the monsters in the world, or stealing their powers to defend their homes from the beasts, Blue Mages make for clever, vicious and dependable allies who can find a place of comfort anywhere on the battlefield.

entries.name: Ode to Monsters
entries: The Blue Mage's trademark ability is their uncanny master over the souls of monsters. Lore Keepers craft their magic to mimic the skills of monsters, while Fell Guards and Masked Carnevallians go a step forward and absorb the life force of monsters and use it to fuel their magic. Regardless of approach, Blue Mages are renowned for fighting like monsters, unsettling their enemies and at times even their allies.

entries.name: Gift of the Whalaqee
entries: Blue Magic finds its roots in the New World, a sacred form of magic practiced by the Whalaqee tribe. They consider the powers of monsters to be that of nature and absorb their powers. They've also learned to store monster magic in totems to pass power on to other Blue Mages easily.

entries.name: Creating a Blue Mage
entries: When creating a Blue Mage one must consider how you came to know of Blue Magic. Did you meet a strange wanderer who assisted you in their studies? Perhaps you encountered a legendary beast when at a young age, affecting you in unforeseen ways. You must also consider the role that you will serve in the world in relation to monsters. Are your pursuits scholarly or are they of a more protective nature? Perhaps you seek out rare monsters to better yourself as a warrior.

entries.name: Quick Build
entries: You can make a Blue Mage quickly by following these suggestions. First make Intelligence your highest ability score, following with Dexterity or Constitutiton.
