entries: Beginning at the 9th level when you use the {@action Dash} action, you may make a melee weapon attack as a bonus action. You deal bonus damage on the attack equal to your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Archetype feature.

classFeature.name: Revenge
entries: Beginning at the 11th level, when a creature resolves an melee weapon attack action against you, as a reaction you may make one weapon attack against that creature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Shake it Off
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, while under the effects of Berserk, when you make a saving throw to resist a condition (excluding: {@condition Exhaustion}, {@condition Grappled}, {@condition Incapacitated}, {@condition Prone}, {@condition Restrained}, {@condition Stunned} and {@condition Unconscious}) you may choose to end your Berserk state to automatically succeed on the saving throw. You may do this after your roll but before the outcome of the resist has been declared.

classFeature.name: Warrior Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Warrior Archetype feature.

classFeature.name: Upheaval
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, while you are under the effects of Berserk, you are able to unleash a powerful blow fueled by your vigor. You make an unarmed strike, if you hit, you may declare you are using Upheaval. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw (DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Constitution modifier). On a failure your unarmed strike deals xd12 force damage, where x is equal to your Constitution modifier with a minimum of {@dice 1d12} force damage and half as much damage on a success. Your Berserk state immediately ends after delivering the blow.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Beastly Reflexes
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, while you are under the effects of Berserk you are able to make two reactions per round.

classFeature.name: Holmgang
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, while under the effects of Berserk, as a bonus action you are able to enter an indomitable state known as Holmgang. For a number of rounds equal to half your Constitution modifier, rounded down, your hit points can not fall below 1. Additionally, you may attempt to link yourself to a creature within 10ft. of you. If the creature is Large sized or smaller the target creature must make a Strength saving throw against your Berserk DC or be dragged to a space within 5 ft. of you. The creature cannot leave the 5ft. radius around you and your movement speed becomes 0ft. for the duration of Holmgang. You may only use Holmgang once and must complete a long rest before you may use it again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Infuriate
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, if you have no uses of Berserk left when you roll for initiative, you recover 2 uses of Berserk instantly.

classFeature.name: Artful Combat
entries: Beginning at 1st level, when wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, while you are not wearing any annor, your Armor Class equals 10 + your Strength modifier + your Wisdom modifier. You can not use a shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Sen
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you are capable of building Sen within your body. You may only hold four charges of Sen in your body at a time. During battle, when you use the {@action Attack} action you gain 1 charge of Sen. You may only gain one charge in a round of combat. If you choose to spend a stack of Sen during your action, you may not gain Sen in this way during that round. 5 minutes after battle, your Sen charges fade.

classFeature.name: Higanbana
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, as an action, you may spend one Sen charge to use Higanbana. Make a melee weapon attack against your target, if you hit, the target creature makes a Constitution saving throw.

On a failure, the creature is grieviously wounded by your attack and at the start of each of their turns for the next minute, they take {@dice 1d4} slashing damage. As an action they may attempt to stop the bleeding by attempting the Constitution saving throw again.
If Higanbana is used alongside the Hissatsu: Kaiten feature, double the bleeding damage instead of adding the standard additional damage.

classFeature.name: Code of Honor
entries: At 2nd level, when performing Charisma ability checks on intelligent creatures which you know have an organized martial background, you have advantage on the check.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select a way of the blade. The Iaijutsu focuses on delivering incredibly powerful attacks, the Blademaster, who lures and traps his opponents in counterattacks and the Ronin, who drifts about the battlefield, dancing through the fray.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a {@spell fireball} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Studied Disciple
entries: At 9th level, you have balanced your might with your mind. You may learn any two skills which fall under Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Forceful Meditation
entries: At 11th level, during battle you may forcibly draw Sen into your body. Using your action, you may spend a number of hit die equal to the number Sen charges you wish to recover up to 3 charges. You may only perform Forceful Meditation once, becoming capable of doing so again after a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Whispers of the Kami
entries: At 13th level, you have learned to attune yourself to the world around you and listen to the spirits which surround you. Select two of the following spells: {@spell augury}, {@spell detect evil and good}, {@spell speak with dead}, or {@spell speak with plants}. You may cast either spell once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Samurai Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Samurai Archetype.

classFeature.name: Effective Meditation
entries: At 15th level, if you recover hit points during a short rest, you begin the next battle with one Sen charge.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Artisan of Combat
entries: Starting at 17th level, while wielding a versatile weapon with two hands, your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 18-20.

classFeature.name: Midare Setsugekka
entries: At 18th level, you may spend 3 Sen charges to deliver a series of devestating slashes in an instant. As an action you make four attack rolls against a target creature.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Meikyo Shisui
entries: At 20th level, as a bonus action you turn your body into a conductor for Sen energy. You may freely use Sen charges for 1 minute. You may not use more than 3 Sen charges for one action. You may only use Meikyo Shisui once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of this document for the {@filter Red Mage spell list|spells|class=Red Mage (FFXIV)}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level you know 4 cantrips of your choice from the Red Mage spell list. You learn additional Red Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Red Mage table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Red Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: You know 2 1st-level spells of your choice from the Red Mage spell list. The Spells Known column of the Red Mage table shows when you learn more Red Mage spells of your choice. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For instance, when you reach 5th level in this class, you can learn one new spell of 1st, 2nd or 3rd level Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the Red Mage spells you know and replace it with another spell from the Red Mage spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Red Mage spells. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Red Mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast any Red mage spell you know as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag.

classFeature.name: Flair Points
entries: At 1st level you gain access to Flair Points. Certain Red Mage abilities require you to spend flair points from your pool. All expended flair points are recovered after a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Dual Cast
entries: At 1st level when you cast a spell that has a casting time of 1 action, you can spend 1 flair point to change the casting time to 1 bonus action for this casting. You may not do so with a spell greater than 4th level.

entries.name: Bonus Action Casting
entries: A spell cast with a bonus action is especially swift. You must use a bonus action on your turn to cast the spell, provided that you haven't already taken a bonus action this turn. You can't cast another spell during the same turn, except for a cantrip with a casting time of l action. {@book (PHB 202)|PHB|10|Casting Time|1}.

classFeature.name: Combat Style
entries: At 2nd level, you choose a style as a Red Mage. Sword Dancer, Spell Slinger or Battle Rose, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your archetype choice grants you features at the 2nd, 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Combat Style Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Combat Style Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Combat Style Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Combat Style.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Battle Flourish
entries: At 18th level, when you roll initiative, you recover {@dice 1d4} flair points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Acceleration
entries: At the 20th level, you may cast two spells using Dual Cast, rather than one spell and one cantrip. You may only do this once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Suppressive Fire
entries: Beginning at level 1, when you use {@action Ready} action to prepare to attack a target creature, you are able to disable your target temporarily. If your attack hits, the target grature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Machinist save DC. On a failed save the creature is knocked {@condition prone} and their speed becomes 0ft. until the end of their turn.

classFeature.name: Technical Support
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you are able to use your artisan's tools to disarm mechanical traps.

classFeature.name: Sounding Sentry
entries: Also at the 2nd level, you have developed a tiny device which casts the {@spell alarm} spell. You can affix it to a door or window, or have it monitor an area around itself in a 20ft. cube. You may use the device once before needing to charge it during a long rest.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype
entries: At 3rd level you choose which area of inventing you wish to pursue. You choose the Marksman, Tinkerer or Grenadier archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Reload
entries: Beginning at the 5th level, ranged weapons you use lose their loading property.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Peloton
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, your mental stamina allows you to push your body further. Your base movement increases by 5ft. and you may use your Intelligence modifer for Initiative rolls.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Eye For Design
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, when assessing mechanical systems and intentional designs, you gain advantage on {@skill Investigation} checks to understand how a mechanical system works and advantage on {@skill Survival} checks to track a creature within a building, village, town or city.

classFeature.name: Graze
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, you are able to target your ranged attacks to cause negative effects on your target. Using your bonus action, you can empower your next shot to target a limb causing different effects. If your attack lands, your target must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Machinist save DC or fall under the targetted effect. This effect lasts until your next action where applicable.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Combat Roll
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, during battle you are able to perform a combat roll. When you are targeted by an attack, you may use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack and move 5ft. to an open space without provoking an attack of opportunity. You may do so a number of times equal to your Dexterity modifier before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ricochet
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, you may spend your reaction to perform a ricochet shot if you are attacking with a firearm. Upon landing a successful attack, you make a second attack against a creature within 5ft. of the first targeted creature. This second attack does not consume ammunition.

classFeature.name: Emergency Rescue
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, you have developed a life saving device which casts {@spell cure wounds} on creatures with 0 hit points on contact. Intelligence is your spell casting ability for this device.

As an action you can throw the palm sized spherical device at a creature within 20ft. of you. If you have 0 hit points at the start of your turn and the device in your possession, it will automatically activate and heal you as a free action.
The device can cast {@spell cure wounds} once before requiring charging during a short rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Machinist Archetype Feature
entries: At 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Machinist Archetype.

classFeature.name: Cloaking Device
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, you've developed a cane sized device which turns you and all creatures within 5ft. of you {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. All creatures must remain within 5ft. of the device to retain invisibility. You can use the cane once before you need to recharge it during a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Midas Touch
entries: Beginning at the 20th level as a bonus action you can complete maintenance on an invention in an instant once before requiring a long rest.

entries.name: Firearms and Creations
entries: The cost of firearms and to rebuild lost, destroyed or stolen accessory equipment granted by features can be found in the {@table Machinist Equipment|FFXIV|Machinist Appendix D on page 106}.

classFeature.name: Arms Smith
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you have learned how to modify weaponry to incorporate a gunfire into their function. You spend 1 day of time working on your weapon to complete the conversion process.

entries.name: Gun Weapons
entries: Arms Smith is used to convert a weapon into a gun weapon such that it works with your abilities. The most common and obvious is to use a longsword or greatsword for this sort of thing but if your DM approves, you could turn any kind of weapon into a gunweapon. Magic weapons may also require extra time to convert or assistance to complete the modifications at your DM's discretion.
All weapons that have undergone this process will be referred to as Gunblades in this document.

classFeature.name: Munitions
entries: Beginning at 1st level, you've learned how to create cells which draw in magical energy from your body to charge themselves called Munitions. You have a number of munition charges your body can support, indicated on the class table above. You load up to 6 Munitions charges into your gunblade at a time. When you use Munition charges on attack rolls you expend a loaded charge. You may load more charges as an action.
When using abilities triggered through using your munitions that require the enemy to make a saving throw, the saving throw is calculated as follows:
When using features which require you to make a ranged attack, your modifier is calculated as follows:
Half of your expended Munitions, rounded up, are recharged, after completing a short rest and all of your Munitions after a long rest.

classFeature.name: Burst Strike
entries: When you make a successful melee weapon attack with a Gunblade, you may expend 1 Munitions charge to pull your weapon's trigger and attempt to launch your enemy backwards. The creature makes a Constitution saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. On a failure they take {@dice 1d10} thunder damage and are knocked back 10ft. from your position. They take half the damage and are not knocked back on a success. You may use Burst Strike once per round of combat.
This damage increases to {@dice 2d10} at the 6th level, {@dice 3d10} at the 12th level and {@dice 4d10} at the 18th level.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Gunner Shot
entries: Beginning at 2nd level, you gain a new attack option that you can use with the Attack action. This special attack is a ranged weapon attack with a range of 60 feet which you may only use while wielding a gunblade. You are proficient with it, and you add your Dexterity modifier to its attack and damage rolls. Its damage is thunder, and its damage die is a {@dice d10}. You expend one Munitions charge when you use this attack option.
When you gain the Extra Attack feature, this special attack can be used for any of the attacks you make as part of the Attack action.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select select your Gunbreaker style. The Breaker style focuses on weakening foes with special Munitions, the Lionhart style which focuses on enhancing the damage dealt with the weapon's blows and the Revolver style which focuses on ranged combat.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Heart of Stone
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, when you are attacked by a melee weapon while wielding a gunblade, as a reaction you may expend one Munition to gain a +3 bonus to your AC against the attack roll. You must make this declaration before the attack roll result has been confirmed.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Diplomatic Enforcer
entries: Beginning at the 9th level, while you are within 10ft. of an ally and visible to the target creature, they double their proficiency bonus when making {@skill Persuasion}, {@skill Deception} and {@skill Intimidation} checks.
If a medium or smaller creature is missing hit points, you gain advantage on {@skill Intimidation} checks against that creature.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Blasting Zone
entries: Beginning at the 11th level, when you make a successful melee weapon attack with a gunblade, you may expend three Munitions charges to cause a conal explosion behind the target creature. All creatures in a 15ft. cone behind the target creature, including the targeted creature, must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. They take {@dice 4d10} fire damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. This damage increases to {@dice 5d10} at the 17th level. You may only use this feature once per round.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Heart of the Vanguard
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, you have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened}. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Intimidation} skill, if you already have this skill you gain expertise in it.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Quick Hand
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, you are able to load Munitions to your gunblade as a bonus action. You may load up to 8 Munitions charges to your gunblade.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Sonic Breaker
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, when you make a successful melee weapon attack with a gunblade, you may expend four Munitions charges to cause a massive shockwave behind the target creature in a line. All creatures in a 40ft. line behind the target creature, including the targeted creature, must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Gunbreaker Save DC. They take {@dice 5d10} thunder damage on a failure, and half as much on a success. You may only use this feature once per round.

classFeature.name: Blood Fest
entries: Beginning at 18th level, as a bonus action you may recover half your munitions. You may do so once before requiring a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Gunbreaker Archetype Feature
entries: At 20th level, you gain a feature granted by your Gunbreaker Archetype.

classFeature.name: Dragoon's Trance
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you are able to fall into a special trance as a bonus action. Your soul is filled with power from your Dragoon forebears. While under the effects of this trance, your jump height becomes a minimum of 30ft. and your jump distance becomes a minimum of 15ft.

Your trance lasts for 1 minute. It ends early if you are knocked unconscious or you may end your trance as a bonus action. Some Dragoon abilities may cause your trance to end early. The number of uses of Dragoon's Trance are listed on the class table above. Your uses of Dragoon's Trance refresh after completing a long rest.

classFeature.name: Jump
entries: Also beginning at the 1st level as an action you are able to perform a jump attack. Through the power of your Dragoon Trance you leap up to 30ft. into the air and land on a creature within 15ft. of your starting position. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Dive DC as calculated below, taking your weapon damage and bonus damage equal to {@dice 1d6} on a failure, and half as much on a success. This bonus damage is increased to {@dice 2d6} at the 5th level {@dice 3d6} at the 11th level and {@dice 4d6} at the 18th level.

You may not use Jump on a creature who is higher than 30ft. nor does not have at least 5ft. of space above their head. After finishing your Jump, select an empty space adjacent to the target creature to land on. If the creature's size is Huge or larger, you may choose to attempt to land on the creature instead by making a Dexterity saving throw of a difficulty decided by the DM. You do not take fall damage as a result of using the Jump ability.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Lancet
entries: Also beginning at 2nd level, while under the effects of Dragoon's Trance, as an action you may make a melee weapon attack that drains your target's vitality. You recover hit points equal to half the damage of your weapon attack rounded up. You may use the Lancet feature a number of times equal to your Strength modifier. Uses of Lancet refresh after completing a short rest.

classFeature.name: Dragoon Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you select the focus of your training as a dragoon. Some Dragoon's stick to their roots and fight as Dragon Slayers, while some attempt to harness the power of Dragons and combine it with their unique martial abilities becoming Dragon Hearts. Some Dragoon's decide to break away from their dragon hunting roots and attempt to master the skies as Valkyries.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Heavy Thrust
entries: Beginning at the 5th level, as an action you make a melee weapon attack. This attack deals additional damage equal to the weapon die and the relevant ability modifier. You may choose to reroll the result of the additional damage die, but must use the new result. Critical hits only apply to the weapon attack, not the bonus damage.

classFeature.name: True Thrust
entries: Also beginning at the 5th level as an action you make a melee weapon attack, doubling the proficiency bonus of the attack roll.

classFeature.name: Stall
entries: Beginning at the 6th, level while under the effects of Dragoon Trance, as a bonus action when you reach the peak of any jump, you may pause in place for a moment. At the end of your next turn you continue your fall allowing you to perform an action while suspended in the air.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 7th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: High Jump
entries: Beginning at the 9th level while under the effects of Dragoon Trance, as an action you leap up to 80ft. into the air. At the start of your next turn, you land on a creature within 30ft. of your starting position. The creature makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Dive DC, taking twice your weapon damage and bonus damage equal to {@dice 4d6}.
This bonus damage is increased to {@dice 6d6} at the 11th level and {@dice 8d6} at the 18th level.

You may not use Jump on a creature who is higher than 80ft. nor has at least 5ft. of space above their head After finishing your Jump, select an empty space adjacent to the target creature to land on. If the creature's size is Huge or larger, you may choose to attempt to land on the creature instead by making a Dexterity saving throw of a difficulty decided by the DM. You do not take fall damage as a result of the High Jump ability.

classFeature.name: Crash Landing
entries: Beginning at the 10th level when you complete a successful Spineshatter Dive or High Jump, if the target creature has a flying speed, it is reduced to Oft. for a number of rounds equal to your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Chaos Thrust
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, as an action you make a melee weapon attack. If your attack is successful the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your Dive DC, beginning to bleed on a failure, taking {@dice ld8} piercing damage at the start of their turn. As an action, the creature may reattempt to pass the saving throw to stop the bleeding. A creature will bleed for a number of rounds equal to your Strength modifier.

classFeature.name: Invigorate
entries: Beginning at the 14th level when you fail a saving throw you may choose to reroll the saving throw. You must use the new number. You may use this feature twice, use refreshing after completing a long rest.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 15th level, you gain a feature granted by your Dragoon Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Dragonfire Dive
entries: Beginning at the 17th level, when you use your Jump or High Jump action, you can empower the attack with fiery fury. The bonus damage on the dive is increased to {@dice 8d8} fire damage. All creatures within 20ft. of the target creature take this bonus damage and must make a Dexterity saving throw against the Dive DC, taking the full bonus damage on a failure and half as much on a success. Your Dragoon Trance ends after performing a Dragonfire Dive.

classFeature.name: Battle Litany
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, while you are under the effects of Dragoon's Trance, as a bonus action you can inspire the ferocity of yourself and your allies. Your melee weapon attacks and those of your allies who are within 1 Oft. of you land critical hits on die results 19 or 20 for a number of rounds equal to half your Strength modifier. This does not overwrite or add to already present critical hit range increases. This effect may be activated once each time you enter a new Dragoon's Trance.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: One with the Sky
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, when you roll initiative, you gain two uses of Dragoon's Trance.

classFeature.name: Well of Darkness
entries: Beginning at the 1st level, you are able to draw on the darkness in your heart and use it as power. This pool of energy is known as the Well of Darkness and is represented by your Well of Darkness points indicated on the class table above. All expended uses of your Well of Darkness points refresh upon completing a long rest.
Certain features make use of your Well of Darkness and require your target to make a saving throw, the saving throw is calculated as follows:
When using spells which require you to make a ranged spell attack, your spell attack modifier is calculated as follows:

classFeature.name: Darkside
entries: Also beginning at 1st level, as a bonus action you may spend one Well of Darkness point to fill your weapon with power for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma Modifier. When you make a melee weapon attack while under the effect of Darkside, you deal additional necrotic damage as indicated on the Class Table.

classFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: Beginning at the 2nd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty, Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

classFeature.name: Burning Blood
entries: Also beginning at the 2nd level, as a bonus action you may expend one of your hit die and roll it. You recover Well of Darkness points equal to the result. You cannot exceed your maximum number of Well of Darkness points.

classFeature.name: Dark Knight Archetype
entries: At 3rd level you choose which path of the dark knight to follow. The Blackblood focuses on martial ability, relying on powerful swordplay over magical arts. The Abyss Knight lets the dark powers within themselves flow freely, letting them become more powerful the more dire their situation is, and the Dark Magus uses that inner darkness to cast powerful magical spells alongside their stellar sword skill.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Extra Attack
entries: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: The Blackest Night
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, as a bonus action you may expend one Hit Die to create a barrier which protects you or a creature within 30ft. of you. Roll the expended hit die, the target gains temporary hit points equal to the die result + your Charisma modifier.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Fight or Flight
entries: Beginning at the 9th level you are able to spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast the {@spell cause fear|XGE} or {@spell compelled duel} spells.

classFeature.name: Curse of the Abyss
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, on your turn you may use a bonus action to curse a creature. The curse lasts for 1 minute. The curse ends when the creature dies, you die or are {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, you gain the following benefits:

items: You gain a bonus to damage rolls against the cursed target. The bonus equals your proficiency bonus.
Any attack roll you make against the cursed target is a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20 on the d20.
If the cursed target dies, you regain hit points equal to your Dark Knight level + your Charisma modifier (minimum of 1 hit point) and 1 Well of Darkness point.

entries: You can't use this feature again until you finish a short or long rest.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 11th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Abyssal Communion
entries: Beginning at 13th level, you may spend 6 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell Rary's telepathic bond}.

classFeature.name: Quietus
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, you strike with a swirl of dark energy. As an action, you may spend 2 Well of Darkness points to make a melee weapon attack to all creatures within 10ft. of you. You may expend one hit die and roll it to deal additional necrotic damage equal to the result to all creatures attacked.

classFeature.name: Dark Mind
entries: Beginning at the 15th level, you gain proficiency in Wisdom saving throws.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Archetype Feature
entries: At the 17th level, you gain a feature granted by your Archetype.

classFeature.name: Stalwart Soul
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, your body becomes fueled by your inner darkness. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 5 + your Constitution modifier if you have no more than half of your hit points left. You don't gain this benefit if you have 0 hit points.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Living Dead
entries: Beginning at the 20th level when you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, instead of becoming {@condition unconscious}, you may expend one hit die and recover hit points equal to the result + your Constitution modifier.

classFeature.name: Dazzling Dance
entries: At 1st level, as you fight you build towards empowering your movements further. When you use the {@action Attack} action against a hostile creature, you gain a charge of Dazzling Dance. You may hold a number of Dazling Dance charges equal to your Charisma modififer. Your charges dissipate one minute after combat ends.
Additionally, you may spend 1 Dazzling Dance charge to take the {@action Dash} or {@action Disengage} action as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Flourish
entries: Also beginning at the 1st level, once per turn, you can deal an extra {@dice 1d6} damage ot one creature you hit with a ranged weapon attack if you have advantage on the attack roll. The attack must use a finesse weapon.
You don't need advantage on the attack roll if another enemy of the target is within 5 feet of it, that enemy isn't {@condition incapacitated}, and you don't have disadvantage on the attack roll.
The amount of the extra damage increases as you gain levels in this class, as shown in the Flourish Damage column of the Dancer table.

classFeature.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While you are not wearing any armor, your armor class equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Charisma modifier. You can use a shield and still gain this benefit.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: By 2nd level, you have learned to draw on in latent magical energies around you into your bangles and use it to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and end of this document for the {@filter Dancer spell list|spells|class=Dancer (FFXIV5E)}.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Dancer table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your Dancer spells. to cast one of your dancer spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of Dancer spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the dancer spell list. when you do so, choose a number of spells equal to your Charisma modifier + half your Dancer level, rounded down (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots. For example, if you are a 5th-level Dancer, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Charisma of 14, your list of prepared spells can include 1 spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell cure wounds}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or a 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of Dancer spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: At least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Dance Magic
entries: As a Dancer, when you cast a Dancer spell you do not have to fulfill the verbal component of the spell. you must spend 10ft. of movement alongside your spell slot to cast a spell or to maintain a spell.

entries.name: What about Silence?
entries: Most spellcasters shudder at the thought of being silenced as their spells require a verbal component nearly every time. As a Dancer you are able to forego the verbal component, but that does not mean you are free from having your spells blocked. Instead, any effects which would drop your movement speed to 0ft. will instead cause your spells to be blocked.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Charisma is your spellcasting ability for your Dancer spells, since their power derives from the strength of your convictions. You use your Charisma whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Charisma modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a Dancer spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use bangles, anklets or other jewelry inlaid with gem stones (see the {@book Adventuring Gear|PHB|5} section) as a spellcasting focus for your Dancer Spells.

classFeature.name: Whirling Steel
entries: Also at 2nd level, you can spend 1 hour attuning your recently discovered magics with up to two finesse throwing weapons. When you throw a weapon you are attuned with, it returns to your hand after the attack is resolved.

classFeature.name: Dancer Archetype
entries: At 3rd level, you choose a style which dictates your growth as a dancer. The Paragon focuses on mastering and pushing the limits of dance as an art. The Exotic Wonder mixes bladework into their dance moves, mixing martial prowess with grace. The Peace Bringer seeks to bring succor and support to their allies in the heat of battle.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: Starting at the 5th level, when an attacker that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to halve the attack's damage against you.

classFeature.name: Dancer Archetype Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Dancer Archetype.

classFeature.name: Evasion
entries: Beginning at the 7th level, you can nimbly dodge out of the way of certain area aeffects, such as a red dragon's fiery breath or an {@spell ice storm} spell. When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Motivating Mambo
entries: Beginning at the 10th level, you've learned how to empower your allies in the heat of battle via your dances. When you use the {@action Help} action you can expend one Dazzling Dance charge to add your Charisma modifier to their roll.
Additionally, you may spend 1 Dazzling Dance charge to use the help action as a bonus action.

classFeature.name: Dancer Archetype Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Dancer Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Bewildering Grace
entries: Beginning at the 13th level, as an action you perform a mysterious dance whose effects you cannot predict. Roll a d20 die and resolve the effect. You may make use of Bewildering Grace a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier. Spells cast with Bewildering grace do not consume spell slots. Non-spell effects from Bewildering Grace last one hour. uses of Bewildering Grace refresh after you complete a long rest.

entries.caption: Bewildering Grace Effects
rows: You cast the {@spell banishment} spell on yourself. You cannot end the spell early, but return to where you were at the end of the spell duration.
You become {@condition petrified} for one round of combat.
Lights and small magical explosions surround you in a magical effect. Nothing happens.
All creatures within a 20ft. radius centered on you make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or are knocked [@condition prone}. You are excluded from this effect.

All creatures within a 20ft. radius centered on you make a Wisdom saving throw aainst your spell save DC or become {@condition blinded}. The creature may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns. You are excluded from this effect.

All creatures within a 20ft. radius centered on you make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC or become {@condition poisoned}. The creature may repeat the save at the end of each of their turns. You are excluded from this effect.
You cast the {@spell faerie fire} spell centered on you. You are excluded from this effect.
You cast the {@spell cause fear|XGE} spell on an ally within range.
You cast the {@spell hold person} spell.
You cast the {@spell magic weapon} spell
You cast the {@spell mass healing word} spell.
You select a creature within 30ft. That creatrue must make a Constitution saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure they gain a level of {@conditon exhaustion}.
You now have the maximum number of Dazzling Dance charges possible.
You cast the {@spell insect plague} spell.
You cast the {@spell mass cure wounds} spell.
You cast the {@spell Otto's irresistable dance} spell.
You cast the {@spell Mordenkainen's sword} spell.
You cast the {@spell reverse gravity} spell.

classFeature.name: Spell Dancer
entries: Beginning at the 14th level, when you cast a spell you gain a number of Dazzling Dance charges equal to half the level (rounded down) of the expended spell slot. You do not gain Dazzling Dance charges from Bewildering Grace.

classFeature.name: Dancer Archetype Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Dancer Archetype.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Stage Presence
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, you've become so accustomed to performing both for crowds and amogst the chaos of the battlefield, you are rarely caught unaware of your surroundings and can protect yourself from the trics of assailants. Attackers cannot attack you with advantage unless you are under the conditions: {@condition grappled}, {@condition incapacitated}, {@condition paralyzed} or {@condition petrified}. Additionally when knocked prone, it only costs 5ft. of movement to get back up.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Rhythmic Heart
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, when you roll initiative you gain 2 Dazzling Dance charges.

classFeature.name: Azure Lore
entries: Your research and experience with monsters and magic has granted you spellcasting abilities. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of this document for the {@filter Blue Mage spell list|spells|class=Blue Mage (FFXIV5E)}

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You know two cantrips of your choice from the blue mage spell list. you learn additional blue mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Blue Mage table.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Blue Mage table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one fo your blue mage spells of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 5th level, you have two level 3 spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell {@spell thunderwave}, you must expend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 3rd-level spell.

entries.name: Monster Links
entries: As a Blue Mage, you develop your spellcasting based on the abilities of monsters. A Monster Link is research linking the traits and abilities of creatures to pairs of spells to emulate their magical properties.

Each monster link you develop grants you two spells while you are accessing them. When you gain a Blue Mage level, you take the opportunity to further develop your research and may create a new monster link, adding another pairing of spells from the blue mage spell list to your research journal as a pair. You may have any number of monster links in your research journal but may only access a number of monster links per the Monster Link Capacity column of the Blue Mage table, knowing the spells associated with the links you are currently accessing.
At the end of a long rest of which you spent two hours focused on studying, you may exchange one of your monster links you are accessing for another.

entries.name: Optional Rule
entries: One of the key elements of the Blue Mage is seeking out and gaining power from beasts out in the world. I recommend using monster links as an additonal reward for hard fought battles with rare enemies. If the Blue Mage uses its Libra feature below or after a battle with such a creature, the DM may decide they are feeling particularly inspired by their findings and grant them a bonus monster link to add to their research journal, perhaps even using spells outside the Blue Mage spell list.

entries.name: Research Journal
entries: At first level, you have a research journal with two monster links created by you.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: The number of spells you are able to cast is dependent on the number of Monster Links you are currently accessing. While accessing a monster link, you gain access to both spells that make up the monster link. At first level you are able to access one of your monster links, your ability to access more monster links at once grows as you gain levels in Blue Mage.

entries.name: Your Research Journal
entries: The monster links you've discovered are kept in your research journal. As you further your research alone, you may encounter the works of another blue mages or peers who share their findings.

entries.name: Copying a Monster Link into the Book
entries: When you find the research notes of a peer, or a tome with well detailed monster links, you can copy the pair of spells into your research journal if you have the spell slots of appropriate level and the spare time to decipher and copy the notation. Copying a spell involves reproducing the basic form of spells, then understanding the unique style of the blue mage who wrote it. For each level of the spells, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50gp. The cost represents the material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can access the monster link just like your own monster links.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a monster link from your research journal into another book-for eaxmple, if you want to make a backup copy of your research. This is just like copying a new monster link into your journal, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spells. You need to spend only 1 hour and 1 gp for each leve lof the copied spells in order to copy a monster link you are currently accessing. Filling out the remainder of your research journal requires you to find new monster links to do so, as normal. For this reason, many blue mages keep back up copies of their research in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your research journal may take any style of tome you wish. A Lore Keeper like has a well kept tome used for taking notes in the field, while the Fell guard may carry a durable grimoire to record their experiences.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Your spell casting ability for your blue mage spells changes depending on which blue mage calling you select. As a Lore Keeper, Intelligence is your spellcasting ability, as a Fell Guard Wisdom is your spellcasting ability and as a Carnevallian your spellcasting ability is Charisma. You use the associated ability whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use the ability modifier for the associated ability when setting the saving throw DC for a blue mage spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a cane adorned with some kind of {@item arcane focus|PHB} at its handle as your spellcasting focus.

classFeature.name: Blue Mage Calling
entries: At 1st level, you choose the type of Blue Mage you'll become: the Lore Keeper, Fell Guard or Masked Carnevallian. All of them are detailed in the next section of the class description. Your choice grants you features at the 3rd, 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Libra
entries: Also at 1st level, as an expert on monsters and beasts, you are able to discern certain traits about monsters you encounter. If you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the following characteristics of your choice:

items: Strength score
Dexterity score
Constitution score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Total class levels (if any)

entries: Additionally, you may spend 1 minute after combat studying a creature's corpse to ascertain the same information.

classFeature.name: Monster Mimicries
entries: As your research into monsters continues, you learn how to use your magics to mimic their abilities.

At 2nd level, you gain two Monster Mimicries. Your {@filter Monster Mimicry options|optionalfeatures|feature type=bm:mm} are detailed at the end of the class description. When you gain certain blue mage levels, you gain mimicries of your choice as shown in the Monster Mimicries Developed column of the Blue Mage table.
Additionally, when you gain a level in this class, you can choose one of the mimicries you have developed and retool your knowledge, replacing it with another mimicry you could learn at that level.

classFeature.name: Blue Mage Calling Feature
entries: At 3rd level, you gain a feature granted by your Blue Mage Calling.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Blue Mage Calling Feature
entries: At 6th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blue Mage Calling.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Blue Mage Calling Feature
entries: At 10th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blue Mage Calling.

classFeature.name: Elite Monster Link (6th Level)
entries: At 11th level, you have made a major breakthrough in emulating creatures of legend. You theorize an Elite Monster Link that you commit to memory. Choose one {@filter 6th-level spell from the blue mage spell list|spells|level=6|class=Blue Mage (FFXIV5E)} as this Elite Monster Link.
You can cast your elite monster link spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

At higher levels, you gain more blue mage spells of your choice that can be cast in this way: one 7th-level spell at the 13th level, one 8th-level spell at the 15th level, and one 9th level spell at the 17th level. You regain all uses of your Elite Monster Links when you finish a long rest.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elite Monster Link (7th Level)
entries: You have achieved yet another major breaktrough. Choose one {@filter 7th-level spell from the  blue mage spell list|spells|level=7|class=Blue Mage (FFXIV5E)} as this Elite Monster Link.
You can cast your elite monster link spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Blue Mage Calling Feature
entries: At 14th level, you gain a feature granted by your Blue Mage Calling.

classFeature.name: Elite Monster Link (8th Level)
entries: You have achieved yet another major breaktrough. Choose one {@filter 8th-level spell from the  blue mage spell list|spells|level=8|class=Blue Mage (FFXIV5E)} as this Elite Monster Link.
You can cast your elite monster link spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Elite Monster Link (9th Level)
entries: You have achieved yet another major breaktrough. Choose one {@filter 9th-level spell from the  blue mage spell list|spells|level=9|class=Blue Mage (FFXIV5E)} as this Elite Monster Link.
You can cast your elite monster link spell once without expending a spell slot. You must finish a long rest before you can do so again.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Deep Azure
entries: At 20th level, you may exchange your monster links when you complete a short rest. Additionally, you can spend 1 minute of highly intensive meditation, regaining all of your expended spell slots from your Azure Lore feature. Once you regain your spell slots with this feature, you must complete a long rest before you may do so again.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a student of arcane magic, you have a spellbook containing spells that show the first glimmerings of your true power. see {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spell casting and the end of this document for the {@filter Black Mage spell list|spells|class=Black Mage (FFXIV5E)}

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Black Mage spell list. You learn additional Black Mage cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Black Mage table.

entries.name: Spellbook
entries: At 1st level, you have a spellbook containing six 1st-level Black Mage spells of your choice.

entries.name: Your Spellbook
entries: The spells that you add to your spellbook as you gain levels reflect the arcane research you conduct on your own, as well as intellectual breakthroughs you have had about the nature of the multiverse. You might find other spells during your adventures. You could discover a spell recorded on a scroll in an evil Wizards's chest, for example, or in a dusty tome in an ancient library

entries.name: Copying a Spell into the Book
entries: When you find an arcanist spell of 1st level or higher, you can add it to your spellbook if it is of a spell level you can prepare and if you can spare the time to decipher and copy it.

Copying that spell into your spellbook involves reproducing the basic form of the spell, then deciphering the unique system of notation used by the person who wrote it. You must practice the spell until you understand the sounds or gestures required, then transcribe it into your spellbook using your own notation.

For each level of the spell, the process takes 2 hours and costs 50 gp. The cost represents material components you expend as you experiment with the spell to master it, as well as the fine inks you need to record it. Once you have spent this time and money, you can prepare the spell just like your other spells.

entries.name: Replacing the Book
entries: You can copy a spell from your own spellbook into another book—for example, if you want to make a backup copy of your spellbook. This is just like copying a new spell into your spellbook, but faster and easier, since you understand your own notation and already know how to cast the spell. You need spend only 1 hour and 10 gp for each level of the copied spell.

If you lose your spellbook, you can use the same procedure to transcribe the spells that you have prepared into a new spellbook. Filling out the remainder of your spellbook requires you to find new spells to do so, as normal. For this reason, many mages keep backup spellbooks in a safe place.

entries.name: The Book's Appearance
entries: Your spellbook is a unique compilation of spells, with its own decorative flourishes and margin notes. It might be a plain, functional leather volume that you received as a gift from your master, a finely bound gilt-edged tome you found in an ancient library, or even a loose collection of notes scrounged together after you lost your previous spellbook in a mishap.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
entries: The Black Mage table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of black mage spells that are available for you to cast, To do so, choose a number of black mage spells from your spellbook equal to your Intelligence modifier + your black mage level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd level black mage, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With an Intelligence of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell {@spell magic missile}, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of black mage spells requires time spent studying your spellbook and memorizing the incantations and gestures you must make to cast the spell: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for your black mage spells, since you learn your spells through dedicated study and memorization. You use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a arcanist spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

entries.name: Ritual Casting
entries: You can cast a black mage spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell in your spellbook. You don't need to have the spell prepared.

entries.name: Spellcasting Focus
entries: You can use a rod, cane, wand or other similar equipment as a spellcasting focus for your black mage spells.

entries.name: Learning Spells of 1st Level and Higher
entries: Each time you gain a black mage level, you can add two black mage spells of your choice to your spellbook for free. Each of these spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots, as shown on the black mage table. On your adventures, you might find other spells that you can add to your spellbook (see "Your Spellbook").

classFeature.name: Manafont
entries: At 1st level, you have unlocked the secrets of storing magical energy in your body and utilizing it to assist your spell casting.

entries.name: Mana Points
entries: You have one Mana point, and you gain more as you reach higher levels, as shown in the Mana Points column of the Black Mage table. You can never have more mana points than shown on the table for your level. You regain all spent mana points when you finish a long rest.

entries.name: Leylines
entries: When you cast a spell, the residual mana from your spell temporarily creates a leyline, which can be manipulated with your manafont. If you cast a spell last turn and have not moved or taken any other actions during your turn, you may spend a number of mana points equal to that spell's level to cast an evocation spell equal to or lower than that level without expending a spell slot. Your turn immediately ends after casting the spell.

classFeature.name: Magical Discipline
entries: At 2nd level, you choose the discipline you belong to as a Black Mage: Destroyer, Inflictor, or Void Soul, all detailed at the end of the class description. Your archetype choice grants you features at the 2nd, 6th, 10th and 14th level.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 4th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Magical Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Magical Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 8th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Magical Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Magical Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 12th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Magical Discipline Feature
entries: You gain a feature granted by your Magical Discipline.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 16th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Surecaster
entries: Beginning at the 18th level, you may expend 5 mana points to achieve an impregnable state of mind. You pass all concentration checks automatically for the next 10 minutes.

classFeature.name: Ability Score Improvement
entries: When you reach 19th level, you can increase one ability score of your choice by 2, or you can increase two ability scores of your choice by 1. As normal, you can't increase an ability score above 20 using this feature.
If your DM allows the use of feats, you may instead take a {@5etools feat|feats.html}.

classFeature.name: Resonating Aether
entries: Beginning at the 20th level, you regain half your missing mana points when you roll initiative.

classFeature.name: Spellcasting
entries: As a student of astrology, you can cast Astrologian spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the PHB for the general rules of spellcasting and the end of this document for the {@filter Astrologian spell list|spells|class=Astrologian (FFXIV5E)}

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the Astrologian spell list. You learn additional Astrologian cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the astrologian table.

entries.name: Preparing and Casting Spells
