Beginning at the 7th level you have gained a wealth of knowledge about dragons. You have proficiency in {@skill History}, {@skill Nature} and {@skill Perception} checks when the check involves dragons, and you add the {@language Draconic} language to your known languages.

subclassFeature.name: Drachenlance
entries: {@i 11th-level Dragon Slayer feature}
Beginning at the 11th level, as an action you make a special lance attack which focuses on piercing tough defenses. Your attack roll is contested by 10 + the target's Dexterity modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon's Bane
entries: {@i 15th-level Dragon Slayer feature}

Beginning at the 15th level, your expertise at battling dragons has provided you with greater techniques to battle them. When you are subjected to an effect that requires you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail. Additionally your attacks against dragons deals {@dice 3d6} extra damage as you are able to pin point their most vulnerable areas. Against non-dragon creatures your blows still carry extra precision, dealing an additonal {@dice 1d6} damage.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Heart
entries: Dragon Hearts are dragoons who've leaned into the draconic origins of their foes and leanred how to manipulate the magics latent in their bodies to become more like dragons. These fierce warriors use the breath of a dragon to attack large swaths of foes, while using their training as a Dragoon in combination to emulate a dragon in battle.

subclassFeature.name: Breath of the Dragon
entries: {@i 3rd-level Dragon Heart feature}

Beginning at the 3rd level, as a bonus action, you may expand a use of your Dragoon's Trance in order to cast the {@spell dragon's breath|XGE} spell on yourself at the 2nd level. At 9th level you cast this spell at the 3rd level, and at the 17th level you cast this spell at the 4th level. Strength is your spell casting ability for this spell.

subclassFeature.name: Dragon Sense
entries: {@i 7th-level Dragon Heart feature}

Beginning at the 7th level, you've gained the senses which are akin to a dragon. You've gained 30ft. of blindsight and 60ft. of darkvision. Additionally during battle as a bonus action you may make a {@skill Perception} check.

subclassFeature.name: Blood of the Dragon
entries: {@i 11th-level Dragon Heart feature}

Beginning at the 11th level, you fight with the ferocity of a dragon now. When you use your Dragoon's Trance ability, you gain 10 temporary hit points and the spell casting and concentration restriction of Dragoon's Trance is lifted from the Dragon's Breath spell. The temporary hit points fade when your trance ends.

subclassFeature.name: Life of the Dragon
entries: {@i 15th-level Dragon Heart feature}

Beginning at the 15th level, while you are under the effect of both {@classFeature Dragoon's Trance|Dragoon|FFXIV|1} and {@subclassFeature Breath of the Dragon|Dragoon|FFXIV|Dragon Heart|FFXIV|3}, you are able to combine these powers to fight like a legendary dragon. You may use the effect of the {@spell dragon's breath|XGE} spell as a bonus action on your turn.

subclassFeature.name: Valkyrie
entries: Valkyries have chosen to distance themselves from the Dragoon's roots and instead seek to be masters of the skies themselves. Using swift movements and the power of flight, Valkyires are able to move quickly in and out of battle with power and a certain grace.

subclassFeature.name: Crescent Moon Strikes
entries: {@i 3rd-level Valkyrie feature}

Beginning at the 3rd level when you make the {@action Attack} action, if there is a creature directly beside your target, you may roll a second attack roll against that creature as a bonus action. You do not receive an ability modifier bonus on the damage roll for this attack.

subclassFeature.name: Flight of the Dragon
entries: {@i 7th-level Valkyrie feature}

Beginning at the 7th level, you are able to expend two uses of {@classFeature Dragoon's Trance|Dragoon|FFXIV|1} to gain 60ft. of flying speed for the duration of the Trance. When you do so, an ethereal pair of dragon's wings sprout from your back. You may use your {@classFeature Jump|Dragoon|FFXIV|1} and {@classFeature High Jump|Dragoon|FFXIV|9} features while in flight, using your place in the air as your starting position.

subclassFeature.name: Valkyrie Strike
entries: {@i 11th-level Valkyrie feature}
Beginning at the 11th level, you don't provoke opportunity attacks when you fly out of enemies reach.

subclassFeature.name: Stardiver
entries: {@i 15th-level Valkyrie feature}

Beginning at the 15th level while under the effects of {@subclassFeature Flight of the Dragon|Dragoon|FFXIV|Valkyrie|FFXIV|7}, as an action you use your {@classFeature High Jump|Dragoon|FFXIV|9|FFXIV} feature, but may complete the attack in the same turn you start your dive. If you do so, you expend one use of Dragoon's Trance.

subclassFeature.name: Blackblood
entries: Blackbloods are Dark Knights who seek great power and presence on the battlefield They spend their time perfecting their martial abilities, and then infusing their peerless skill with power drawn from the darkness which resides in their hearts.

subclassFeature.name: Plunge
entries: {@i 3rd-level Blackblood feature}

Beginning at 3rd level, as an action you may move to a space beside a creature within a 15ft. radius. You then make a melee weapon attack against that creature, dealing an additional {@dice 2d6} damage of the weapon die's type. This damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 11th level and {@dice 5d6} at 17th level. You may use the Plunge feature a number of times equal to half your Strength modifier (rounded up). Uses of Plunge refresh after completing a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Piercing Intimidation
entries: {@i 6th-level Blackblood feature}

Beginning at 6th level, when making an {@skill Intimidation} skill check, you may spend 1 Well of Darkness point to gain assistance from your inner darkness. Roll your Darkside damage die and add the result to the result of your check.

subclassFeature.name: Soul Eater
entries: {@i 11th-level Blackblood feature}
Beginning at 11th level, once per turn when you make a melee weapon attack, you may choose to recover hit points equal to half the damage dealt by your Darkside feature's bonus damage, rounded up.

subclassFeature.name: Ravaging Darkness
entries: {@i 17th-level Blackblood feature}
Beginning at the 17th level, you add your Charisma modifier to the bonus damage of your Darkside feature.

subclassFeature.name: Abyss Knight
entries: Abyss Knights are warriors who sneer in the face of suffering, using techniques which injure themselves in order to deliver devestating damage to their opponents.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Burst
entries: {@i 3rd-level Abyss Knight feature}

Beginning at 3rd level, you are able to weaponize your own life energy to unleash a burst of dark energy against your foes. While under the effect of Darkside, you may spend {@dice 2d4} hit points to cast the {@spell burning hands} spell. When cast in this way, the spell deals necrotic damage instead of fire, and does not ignite flammable objects. Use the Well of Darkness DC when casting the spell.

You are able to cast the spell at higher levels by increasing the damage you take by {@dice 1d4} for each increase in casting level You may only increase the spell level up to a number of levels equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Adversity
entries: {@i 6th-level Abyss Knight feature}

Beginning at 6th level, you become fueled by the suffering you endure in battle. For every 20 hit points you are missing, you gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls up to a maximum equal to your Charisma modifier.
Additionally you gain resistance to necrotic damage.

subclassFeature.name: Supernatural Sense
entries: {@i 11th-level Abyss Knight feature}

Beginning at 11th level, you may cast the {@spell detect evil and good} spell at will. You may also cast {@spell detect thoughts} at will on a willing creature or spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast it on an unwilling creature.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Star
entries: {@i 17th-level Abyss Knight feature}

Beginning at 17th level, damage from all sources is reduced by your current Adversity bonus. When you cast {@spell burning hands} using the Dark Burst feature, you deal bonus damage equal to your Charisma Modifier + your Adversity bonus. Additionally, you may change the range from a 15ft. cone to a 30ft. line. You reference the Adversity bonus after spending your hit points to use {@subclassFeature Dark Burst|Dark Knight|FFXIV|Abyss Knight|FFXIV|3|FFXIV} feature.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Magus
entries: As a Dark Magus, you have decided to focus on manipulating your Well of Darkness. Doing so allows you to convert your own life force into powerful Dark Arts.

You know two Dark Arts at 3rd level detailed in the Dark Arts section below. You learn one additional Dark Art of your choice at the 6th, 11th and 17th level Additionally you know the {@spell toll the dead|XGE} cantrip. Also, your maximum number of Well of Darkness points is increased by a number equal to your Charisma modifier.

entries.name: Casting Dark Arts
entries: Using the dark magical energy from within, you are able to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} for the general rules of spell casting. To cast one of these spells you use its casting time and other rules, but you don't need to provide material components for it.

Once you reach the 6th level in this class, you can spend additional Well of Darkness point to increase the level of a Dark Art that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional Well of Darkness hit die you spend The default casting level of these spells is at the lowest possible level.

The maximum number of Well of Darkness point you can spend in this way (including the base cost and the additional points you spend to increase the level) is determined by your Dark Knight level as shown in the Spells and Well of Darkness Points table.

entries.caption: Spells and Well of Darkness Points

subclassFeature.name: Dark Arts
entries: {@i 3rd-level Dark Magus feature}
The Dark Arts list is presented in alphabetical order. If the magic requires a level, you must be that level in this class to learn the spell.

entries.name: Abyssal Drain (17th Level)
entries: You can spend 6 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell contagion}.

entries.name: Creeping Darkness
entries: You can spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell darkness}.

entries.name: Damning Curse
entries: You can spend 1 Well of Darkness point to cast {@spell bane}.

entries.name: Dark Dance
entries: You can spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell mirror image}.

entries.name: Dark Passenger (11th Level)
entries: You can spend 3 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell lightning bolt}. The spell deals necrotic damage.

entries.name: Delirium
entries: You can spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell suggestion}.

entries.name: Edge of Shadow
entries: You can spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell shatter}.

entries.name: Flood of Darkness (17th Level)
entries: You can spend 6 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell negative energy flood|XGE}.

entries.name: Helter Skelter (11th Level)
entries: You can spend 4 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell hypnotic pattern}.

entries.name: Power Slash (6th Level)
entries: You can spend 3 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell elemental weapon}.

entries.name: Reprisal
entries: You can spend 2 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell hellish rebuke}.

entries.name: Salted Earth (6th Level)
entries: You can spend 3 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell hunger of Hadar}.

entries.name: Scourge
entries: ou can spend 1 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell hex}.

entries.name: Shadow Skin (11th Level)
entries: You can spend 4 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell shadow of Moil|XGE}.

entries.name: Shadow Wall (17th Level)
entries: You can spend 6 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell wall of force}.

entries.name: Syphon Touch (6th Level)
entries: You can spend 3 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell vampiric touch}.

entries.name: Unleash
entries: You can spend 1 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell arms of Hadar.

entries.name: Unmend
entries: You can spend 1 Well of Darkness points to cast {@spell magic Missile}.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Dark Arts
entries: {@i 6th-level Dark Magus feature}
At 6th level, you learn one additional {@filter Dark Art|optionalfeatures|feature type=dk:da} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Dark Arts
entries: {@i 11th-level Dark Magus feature}
At 11th level, you learn one additional {@filter Dark Art|optionalfeatures|feature type=dk:da} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Additional Dark Arts
entries: {@i 17th-level Dark Magus feature}
At 17th level, you learn one additional {@filter Dark Art|optionalfeatures|feature type=dk:da} of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Paragon
entries: You've devoted your training to dance as an art form itself, staying a purist of dance. Your singular focus will allow you to teach mastery few ever hope to achieve in your discipline.

subclassFeature.name: Inspiring Salsa
entries: {@i 3rd-level Paragon feature}

Beginning at the 3rd level, as a bonus action you can spend up to 2 Dazzling Dance charges to inspire an ally within 5ft. of you. Your ally may add a bonus to any attack roll, saving throw or ability check they make equal to twice the number of charges used to inspire them one time. At 10th level you may spend any number of Dazzling Dance charges in the same way.

subclassFeature.name: Magic of Movement
entries: {@i 6th-level Paragon feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, when you cast a spell you may spend a number of Dazzling Dance charges equal to the spell level instead of spending a spell slot. Spells cast using this feature do not generate Dazzling Dance charges.

subclassFeature.name: Improvised Flow
entries: {@i 11th-level Paragon feature}
Beginning at the 11th level, when you make a concentration check you may spend a Dazzling Dance charge to roll with advantage.

subclassFeature.name: Forte Fusion
entries: {@i 15th-level Paragon feature}

Beginning at the 15th level, you have learned how to mix known dances into new exciting combinations. You are able to cast a second spell which requires concentration without ending the first. To do so you use your action to spend 1 Dazzling Dance charge to cast the second spell alongside the required spell slot. Each turn you concentrate on the second spell you must use your action to spend once Dazzling Dance charge and spend 10ft. of movement per spell.

subclassFeature.name: Peace Bringer
entries: You've learned to effectively wield restorative spells while dancing across the battlefield, offering relief and joy in even the worst situations.

subclassFeature.name: Succor Swing
entries: {@i 3rd-level Peace Bringer feature}

Beginning at 3rd level, your magical dances are capable of healing wounds. You have a pool of healing power that replenishes when you take a long rest. With that pool you can restore a total number of hit points equal to your Dancer level x 5.
As an action, you can perform for a creature within 5ft. of you and draw power from the pool to restore a number of hit points to that creature, up to the maximum amount remaining in your pool.

subclassFeature.name: Refreshing Round
entries: {@i 6th-level Peace Bringer feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, you've further developed your healing abilities. When you use your Succor Swing feature, you may target any number of creatures within 1Oft. of you.

subclassFeature.name: Safe Haven Hop
entries: {@i 11th-level Peace Bringer feature}

Beginning at the 11th level, you may select {@spell aura of life}, {@spell aura of purity} or {@spell aura of vitality} and cast it without spending a spell slot. You may do so a number of times equal to half your Charisma modifier rounded down, these uses refresh after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: The Solace Swing
entries: {@i 15th-level Peace Bringer feature}
Beginning at the 15th level you may spend Dazzling Dance charges to restore your pool of healing power. For each point spent you recover points to your pool equal to your Charisma modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Exotic Wonder
entries: You've trained in an exotic dancing style which incorporates weapons into your routines. You mix martial knowledge with graceful steps to create an awe inspiring dance which devestates your foes.

subclassFeature.name: Flourishing Swing
entries: {@i 3rd-level Exotic Wonder feature}
Beginning at 3rd level, your melee weapon attacks with finesse weapons activate your Flourish feature.

subclassFeature.name: Fighting Style
entries: {@i 3rd-level Exotic Wonder feature}

Beginning at the 3rd level, you adopt a particular style of fighting as your specialty. Choose one of the following options. You can't take a Fighting Style option more than once, even if you later get to choose again.

subclassFeature.name: Double Step
entries: {@i 6th-level Exotic Wonder feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, when making a melee weapon attack on your turn, you may spend 1 Dazzling Dance charge to make two melee weapon attacks.

subclassFeature.name: Flawless Flow
entries: {@i 11th-level Exotic Wonder feature}
Beginning at the 11th level, you may make a melee weapon attack as a bonus action after casting a spell.

subclassFeature.name: Lamia Bite
entries: {@i 15th-level Exotic Wonder feature}

Beginning at the 15th level, you may spend 4 Dazzling Dance charges prior to making a weapon attack. Doing so increases the critical hit range of your attack rolls for the remainder of the turn, lowering the threshold by 4.

subclassFeature.name: Lore Keeper
entries: You have taken on the duty of becoming a Lore Keeper, researchers who seek out and chronicle the monsters of the world to the finest details possible. In doing so you've learned to create magical bonds which allow you to borrow their power or emulate their magical effects. Be it the fiery breath of a drake or the clibing ability of a spider, you know how to cast spells which pay homage to the beasts you've dedicated yourself to.

subclassFeature.name: Azure Knowledge
entries: {@i 1st-level Lore Keeper feature}

Beginning at 1st level, you may select an additional two cantrips from the blue mage spell list and add them to your cantrips known list. These do not count against the Cantrips Known in the blue mage class table.

subclassFeature.name: Focused Assessment
entries: {@i 3rd-level Lore Keeper feature}
Starting at 3rd level, you gain proficiency in the {@skill Investigation} skill. If you already have proficiency in the skill, you gain expertise in it, doubling your proficiency bonus.
Additionally, you may use Libra as an action on a creature. You also have gained an eye for spotting weaknesses and strengths, allowing you to learn additional types of information:

items: Damage resistances
Damage vulnerabilities
Damage immunities

subclassFeature.name: Quick Assessment
entries: {@i 6th-level Lore Keeper feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, as a bonus action you are able to use Libra during combat on a creature that is within 30ft. of you.

subclassFeature.name: Extracurricular Studies
entries: {@i 10th-level Lore Keeper feature}

Beginning at the 10th level, you may learn two spells of your choice from any class. a spell you choose must be of 5th level or lower, or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as blue mage spells for you.

subclassFeature.name: Ace Tutor
entries: {@i 14th-level Lore Keeper feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, you are able to read the subtle movements of monsters and beasts from afar. As an action you can offer advice on how to approach a beast or monster within 30ft. of you, that you have used Libra on.
Choose an ally within 60ft. of you, until your next turn they have advantage on attack rolls against that creature.

subclassFeature.name: Fell Guard
entries: Fell Guard Blue Mages are adventurers who travel the world battling monsters and beasts, bathing in their essence to absorb their power and use it to further defend the world from those same beasts. The exposure to this monstrous power, sometimes referred to as fell energy, comes at a risk. Fell Guard must balance the number of monsters whose energy they tap into or else they'll lose themselves to the power. Walking the line between monster and man, these magical warriors take major risks to protect the world.

subclassFeature.name: Azure Guard
entries: {@i 1st-level Fell Guard feature}
Beginning at 1st level, you may use one handed melee weapons as spellcasting focus for your blue mage spells.
Additionally, you gain proficiency with medium armor and martial weapons. When you level up you gain an additional two hit points.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Vanguard
entries: {@i 3rd-level Fell Guard feature}
Beginning at 3rd level, you choose a fighting style focus to assist you in the type of monster you prefer to hunt.

entries.name: Colossus Slayer
entries: Your tenacity can wear down the most potent foes. When you hit a creature with a weapon attack, the creature takes an extra {@damage 1d8} damage if it's below its hit point maximum. You can deal this extra damage only once per turn.

entries.name: Giant Killer
entries: When a Large or larger creature within 5 feet of you hits or misses you with an attack, you can use your reaction to attack that creature immediately after its attack, provided that you can see the creature.

entries.name: Horde Breaker
entries: Once on each of your turns when you make a weapon attack, you can make another attack with the same weapon against a different creature that is within 5 feet of the original target and within range of your weapon.

subclassFeature.name: Survival Tactics
entries: {@i 6th-level Fell Guard feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, you gain one of the following features of your choice.

entries.name: Escape the Horde
entries: Opportunity attacks against you are made with disadvantage.

entries.name: Multiattack Defense
entries: When a creature hits you with an attack, you gain a +4 bonus to AC against all subsequent attacks made by that creature for the rest of the turn.

entries.name: Steel Will
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

subclassFeature.name: Azure Corruption
entries: {@i 10th-level Fell Guard feature}

Beginning at the 10th level, you've learned to influence your body using monstrous magics, When you create a monster link, you may substitute one of your spells learned with one of the following damage resistances: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison or thunder. You may only gain two resistences from your monster links at one time, and may only include one resistance within a single monster link.

subclassFeature.name: Absorb Ability
entries: {@i 14th-level Fell Guard feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, you have learned to drain the natural abilities of your prey. As an action, you draw energy out of a creature you touch. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC or receive a -2 reduction to an ability score of your choice on a failed save. on a success, the creautre becomes immune to this effect for 1 minute. You gain a +2 bonus in the reduced ability socre. This change in ability socre lasts 10 minutes and may only be used once a day. Failed attempts do not expend the use of this ability.
Use of this feature refreshes after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Masked Carnevallian
entries: The powerful and outlandish magics of the Blue Mage provide their practitioners with a large variety of magic few have seen before. As such, some Blue Mages mix their monstrous magic with showmanship, becoming a Masked Carnevallian.

subclassFeature.name: Monster Carnival
entries: {@i 1st-level Masked Carnevallian feature}

Beginning at 1st level, you can inspire others through perfoming with monstrouc magics. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can see and hear you. That creature gains one Carnevallian Inspiration die, a {@dice d6}.

Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Carnevallian Inspiration die, but must decide before the DM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Carnevallian Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can only have one Carnevallian Inspiration die at a time.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (a minimum of once). You regain any expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Your Carnevallian Inspiration die changes when you reach certain levels in this class. The die becomes a {@dice d8} at 5th level, a {@dice d10} at 10th level, and a {@dice d12} at 15th level.

subclassFeature.name: Dramatic Recovery
entries: {@i 3rd-level Masked Carnevallian feature}

Beginning at 3rd level, when you are hit by a melee attack, you may use your reaction and spend one Carnevallian Inspiration die to move 5ft. backwards away from the attacker and roll the Carnevallian Inspiration die, reducing the damage you take by the result.

subclassFeature.name: Entertainer's Intuition
entries: {@i 6th-level Masked Carnevallian feature}
Beginning at 6th level, when making a Charisma related skill check on a creature you have used the Libra feature on, you have advantage on the check.

subclassFeature.name: Traveling Troupe
entries: {@i 10th-level Masked Carnevallian feature}
Beginning at 10th level, a creature who has one of your Carnevallian Inspiration die may spend it when they take damage. The damage taken is reduced by the die's result.

subclassFeature.name: Monstrous Confidence
entries: {@i 14th-level Masked Carnevallian feature}
Beginning at 14th level, creatures who use your Carnevallian Inspiration die add your Charisma modifier to the die result.

subclassFeature.name: Enchanter
entries: While many Black Mages focus their studies on the destructive arts, the Enchanter has shifted their study to empower their allies and weaken their enemies through the use of powerful magics.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: {@i 2nd-level Enchanter feature}
Your specialization as an Enchanter lets you choose from an expanded spell list when you learn a black mage spell. The following spells are added to the black mage spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Point of Influence
entries: {@i 2nd-level Enchanter feature}
Beginning at the 2nd level, you are able to use your Leylines feature for both enchantment and evocation spells.

subclassFeature.name: Silvered Tongue
entries: {@i 6th-level Enchanter feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, your focus on enchantment magic has improved your speech. You gain proficiency in one of the following skills: {@skill Deception}, {@skill Intimidation} or {@skill Persuasion}. If you are already proficient in that skill, you gain expertise with it. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses the chosen skill. Additionally, you may use Intelligence as your ability score for the selected skill.

subclassFeature.name: Unshaken Will
entries: {@i 10th-level Enchanter feature}
Beginning at the 10th level, when you must make a Wisdom saving throw, you may spend 1 mana point to gain advantage on the saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Deep Influence
entries: {@i 14th-level Enchanter feature}
Beginning at the 14th level, when you cast an enchantment spell, you may spend 1 mana point to cause the target to have disadvantage on their saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: Void Mage
entries: A Void Mage is a Black Mage who has focused their research on harnessing the power of The Void and the dark creatures who live within it. This has granted the Black Mage proficiency over dark magic which they wield with authority.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: {@i 2nd-level Void Mage feature}
Your specialization as a Void Mage lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a black mage spell. The following spells are added to the black mage spell list for you.

entries.caption: Expanded Spell List
rows: {@spell armor of Agathys}, {@spell arms of Hadar}
{@spell hunger of Hadar}, {@spell summon lesser demons|XGE}
{@spell contact other plane||contact other plane (ritual)}, {@spell negative energy flood|XGE}

subclassFeature.name: Void Casting
entries: {@i 2nd-level Void Mage feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, when you cast a spell, you may spend one mana point to change the damage type of the spell to necrotic. When you change the damage type of your spell this way it does additional damage equal to your Intelligence ability modifier. This bonus applies to your spell once.

subclassFeature.name: Void Sense
entries: {@i 6th-level Void Mage feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, you have learned to borrow power from the void to improve your senses and causing your eyes to glow with dim red light. You may spend 1 mana point to gain darkvision out to 60ft. for one hour. If you already have darkvision, the range is increased by 60ft. Additionally, you gain advantage on {@skill Perception} checks that use your eyes while under this effect.

subclassFeature.name: Ebony Offense
entries: {@i 10th-level Void Mage feature}
At 10th level, necrotic damage you deal is unaffected by resistances. As a bonus action, you may spend a mana point to overcome necrotic damage immunity for your next spell.

subclassFeature.name: Bloody Veil
entries: {@i 14th-level Void Mage feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, when you kill a creature with a spell of first level or higher with necrotic damage, you gain temporary hit points equal to the spell's level multiplied by your Intelligence ability modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Thaumaturge
entries: A thaumaturge is a mage who specializes in the destructive arts. Though not all Thaumaturges are known as Black Mages, all Black Mages are Thaumaturges at heart. Through deep introspection, they've learned to use their manafont to increase their destructive power.

subclassFeature.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: {@i 2nd-level Thaumaturge feature}
Your specialization as a Thaumaturge lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn a black mage spell. The following spells are added to the black mage spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Unstable Aether
entries: {@i 2nd-level Thaumaturge feature}
Beginning at the 2nd level, when you cast a spell, you may spend one Manafont to reroll any damage die which resulted in a 1 or 2. You must use the resulting rolls.

subclassFeature.name: Polyglot
entries: {@i 6th-level Thaumaturge feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, your magical studies have warped your mind and understanding of the world. You can read all writing.

subclassFeature.name: Aetherial Manipulation
entries: {@i 10th-level Thaumaturge feature}

Beginning at the 10th level, you are able to more effectively manipulate your Leylines. your movement is no longer restricted when making use of your Leylines feature. Casting a spell with the effect of Leylines still immediately ends your turn.

Additionally, if you expended a spell slot during your last turn, as  a bonus action, you may spend one mana point to magically teleport back to the location you were standing in when you cast the spell if the space is unoccupied.

subclassFeature.name: Devastating Force
entries: {@i 14th-level Thaumaturge feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, when you roll damage for a spell and roll the highest possible on any of the dice, choose one of those dice, roll it again and add that roll to the damage. You can use the feature a number of times equal to your Intellifence modifier. Uses of this feature refresh when you complete a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: College of the Skysinger
entries: Members of the College of the Skysinger are adventurers who travel the world acting not only as entertainers but as agents of remembrance and soothesayers for souls who've not yet moved on.

Members of the college are tasked with the mission of travelling the world to record history through poetry and verse, ensuring the harsh truths of history are not swept away. At the same time these bards must help lost souls, who've suffered the tragedies of the past find peace.

The college of the Skysinger was the dream of a famed archer who inadvertently caused the deaths of his comrades. To cope with his grief he turned to the poetic arts and traveled the world trying to atone for his sins by delivering restless spirits to a peaceful slumber. He hoped to one day return to the place where his friends were lost, and lay their souls to rest.
To honour this legendary bard and archer, members of the College often take up the bow alongside their instruments.

subclassFeature.name: Bonus Proficiencies
entries: {@i 3rd-level College of the Skysinger feature}
Beginning at the 3rd level, you gain proficiency with longbows, the {@skill History} skill and one other skill of your choice.

subclassFeature.name: Troubadour's Paean
entries: {@i 3rd-level College of the Skysinger feature}

Beginning at the 3rd level, you learn to protect your allies with your songs. A creature that has a Bardic Inspiration die from you can roll that die to gain temporary hit points equal to the result when an attack or spell targets the creature. While those temporary hit points are protecting the creature, they gain advantage against Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma based saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Scars of History
entries: {@i 6th-level College of the Skysinger feature}
Beginning at the 6th level, you gain advantage on checks regarding the history of battles and tragedies.

You are able to channel your intuitive knowledge of tragedy into song. When you cast a spell, you may expend a Bardic Inspiration die to cause the creature to strike with hesitation. Select a creature within 60 feet of you that can hear you. That creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failed save, the creature's mind is wrought with sorrow causing it to hold back. Until your next turn, when the creature makes a damage roll their damage is reduced by an amount to the Bardic Inspiration die + your Charisma ability modifier. The creature becomes immune to this effect for one hour afterwards. If successful, they are unaffected by your performance and become immune to the effect for one hour.

subclassFeature.name: Wanderer's Ballad
entries: {@i 14th-level College of the Skysinger feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, when you cast a spell you may expend one Bardic Inspiration die to further inspire your allies. Select an allied creature within 60 feet of you that can hear you. Their critical hit range increases by 1 for a number of rounds equal to your Charisma ability modifier. If the creature is under another effect which increases their crit range prior to the effects of Wanderer's Ballad, simply add the next lowest number to your crit range. For example, a Fighter with a crit range of 19 or 20 affected by this ability has a crit range of 18, 19 or 20

subclassFeature.name: Diurnal Sect
entries: Your study of astrology has led you to studying under the Diurnal Sect. Students of this sect focus on developing their understanding of the stars and their fortune telling in reference to the sun. Reflective of the life the sun provides those of the land, students of the Diurnal Sect focus on improving their ability to heal and support their allies.

subclassFeature.name: Fortunate Healing
entries: {@i 2nd-level Diurnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, you may expend an available draw to further empower the heal. The creature regains additional hitpoints equal to {@dice 1d6} + your Wisdom modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Eyes of Azeyma
entries: {@i 2nd-level Diurnal Sect feature}

Also beginning at the 2nd level, you may expend an available draw to assist you in revealing dangers of the area, as an action you may do a quick reading to scan for traps in the area, giving you advantage on {@skill Perception} checks for 1 minute.

subclassFeature.name: Diurnal Benefic
entries: {@i 6th-level Diurnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 6th level you are able to empower your healing spells with the power of the sun. When you cast the spell of the 1st-level or higher restores hit points of an ally, you may leave a regenerative effect on all affected allies. After the spell is cast, the affected creatures recover {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of their turn for a number of rounds equal to your Wisdom ability modifier. You may do this once, use of this feature recovering after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Lightspeed
entries: {@i 10th-level Diurnal Sect feature}
Beginning at the 10th level, you may cast a 1st, 2nd or 3rd-level spell as a bonus action by spending a number of available draws equal to the level of the spell you wish to cast.

subclassFeature.name: Sun's Fortune
entries: {@i 14th-level Diurnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, when you use the Fortunate Healing feature, the additional healing becomes 6 + your Wisdom Modifier. Additionally, you may roll {@dice 1d6} and apply the appropriate effect as if you had used the draw action.

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Sect
entries: Students of the Nocturnal Sect have chosen to unravel the mysteries of the night sky and how the moon influences the world and fate. As seekers of knowledge, the Nocturnal Sect tries to unravel the unknown, akin to chasin the dark side of the moon. In their efforts, students of this sect have taken to focusing on preventative measures and offensive magics.

subclassFeature.name: Mage of Menphina
entries: {@i 2nd-level Nocturnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, you have trained your body alongside your mind, gaining prowess in the martial arts to survive on the battlefield. You have proficiency with one hand handed simple and martial weapons, light and medium armor. You gain 1 extra hit point when you level up.
As a bonus action you may spend one draw to help you predict how your enemy will react to your presence. You do not provoke attacks of opportunity until your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Spell List
entries: {@i 2nd-level Nocturnal Sect feature}
Your spell list is expanded with the following spells.

subclassFeature.name: Nocturnal Benefic
entries: {@i 6th-level Nocturnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 6th level you can empower your spells with the magic of the moon. When you cast a spell of 1st-level or higher that restores hit points of an ally, you may leave a shielding effect on all affected creatures. After the spell is cast, your all affected creatures gain temporary hit points equal to #d4 where # is equal to your Wisdom ability modifier. You may only empower your spells once before requiring a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Malefic Attunement
entries: {@i 10th-level Nocturnal Sect feature}
Beginning at the 10th when you make a melee weapon attack, you may cast a spell as a bonus action. You do not have disadvantage on attack rolls if a hostile creature is within 5ft. of you.

subclassFeature.name: Lunar Rage
entries: {@i 14th-level Nocturnal Sect feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, you touch a willing creature or yourself and bless them with the power of the Nocturnal Sect. Weapon attacks made by the selected creature deal an additional {@dice 2d6} force damage for 1 minute. At the start of each of the affected creature's turns, they roll {@dice 2d6} + your Wisdom modifier and gain that many temporary hit points. You may only bestow this blessing once, use of the blessing refreshing after completing a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fortuneteller
entries: Some Astrologians turn away from the study of the cosmos and instead turn their attention to fate and the Deck of Sixty. Such Astrologians are known as Fortunetellers and develop innovative ways to make use of the tarot, even bending fate to their will.

subclassFeature.name: Minor Arcana
entries: {@i 2nd-level Fortuneteller feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, you have learned to take advantage of the minor arcana of your tarot deck. When you use the Draw feature, on a die result of 1, 3 or 5 you may use the card to deal {@dice 1d6} force damage to a creature within 30ft. of you that you can see. On a die result 2, 4 or 6 you may use the card to heal {@dice 1d6} hit points to a creature within 30ft. of you that you can see. The potency of this effect increases to {@dice 2d6} at 6th level, {@dice 3d6} at 10th level and {@dice 4d6} at the 14th level.

subclassFeature.name: Skillful Readings
entries: {@i 6th-level Fortuneteller feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, you are able to use your arcana cards to more effectively tell the future. When casting a divination spell, you may spend a number of available draws equal to spell's level in place of expending a spell slot.

subclassFeature.name: Stacked Deck
entries: {@i 10th-level Fortuneteller feature}

Beginning at the 10th level, you have learned how to bend the results of your fortune telling. When you use the Draw ability, you may roll {@dice 2d6} and select which die is the true result of the card.

subclassFeature.name: Sleeve Draw
entries: {@i 14th-level Fortuneteller feature}

Beginning at 14th level, as an action you may make use of each of your card drawing effects. Roll {@dice 6d6} and select 3 results. Two are added to your Spread and one may be used for the Draw or Minor Arcana effect. This expends three uses of your Draw action. You may only use Sleeve Draw once, use of this feature refreshing after completing a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Tactician
entries: Most arcanists walk the path of the Tactician, highly intelligent spell casters who assist their allies by organizing their forces and swaying battle with tactical maneuvers. In the tradition of arcanists, the tactician who brings forth a carbuncle, to help dictate the pace of battle.

subclassFeature.name: Field Commander
entries: {@i 2nd-level Tactician feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, you have opted to take up the blade alongside the book to protect yourself on the battle field. You gain proficiency in light armor, shields, simple and martial weapons. You may use your weapon as a casting focus to satisfy the somantic component. You gain one extra hitpoint when you level up, including reaching the 2nd level.
Additionally, beginning at 2nd level, when you select a new tactic according to the Tactics feature, you select two tactics.

subclassFeature.name: Tactical Eye
entries: {@i 2nd-level Tactician feature}

Also beginning at 2nd when you use the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, the target of that attack can be within 30 feet of you, rather than 5 feet of you, if the target can see or hear you.

subclassFeature.name: Strategic Preparation
entries: {@i 6th-level Tactician feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, if you spend at least 1 minute observing or interacting with another creature outside combat, you can learn certain information about its capabilities compared to your own. The DM tells you if the creature is your equal, superior, or inferior in regard to two of the follow characteristics of your choice.

items: Strength score
Dexterity score
Constitution score
Intelligence score
Wisdom score
Charisma score
Armor Class
Current hit points
Class levels (if any)

entries: At the DM's discretion, you might also realize you know a piece of the creature's history or one of its personality traits, if it has any.

subclassFeature.name: Chain Stratagem
entries: {@i 10th-level Tactician feature}
Beginning at the 10th level, when an ally is attacking a creature whom is affected by your Help action, their attack lands a critical hit on a die result 19 or 20.

subclassFeature.name: Carbuncle's Sacrifice
entries: {@i 14th-level Tactician feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, you are able to sacrifice your carbuncle to recall the magic energy which makes up its body and calm your mind. Your carbuncle is unsummoned and you recover half the expended uses of your Tactics feature.

subclassFeature.name: Summoner
entries: A summoner has directed their studies towards harnessing the powers of raging elementals of another plane, summoning elementals known as Egis, and act as servants to their summoner.

subclassFeature.name: Egi's Boon
entries: {@i 2nd-level Summoner feature}

Beginning at the 2nd level, while you have your Ifrit Egi summoned you know the {@spell firebolt} cantrip and have resistance against fire damage. While you have your Garuda Egi summoned you know the {@spell thunderclap|XGE} cantrip and have resistance against thunder damage. While you have your Titan Egi summoned you know the {@spell magic stone} cantrip and have resistance against bludgeoning damage.

subclassFeature.name: Channeled Casting
entries: {@i 6th-level Summoner feature}

Beginning at the 6th level, when you cast a spell you may cast the spell as if you were standing where your egi is. Spells which use you as their point of origin may instead use your Egi as the point of origin. These spells do not cause damage to your egi. You may use Channeled Casting 3 times, uses of this feature recovering after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Fester
entries: {@i 10th-level Summoner feature}

Beginning at the 10th level, when you cast a spell that deals damage and requires a target creature to make a saving throw, if it fails you may deal additional necrotic damage to the target creature equal to #d8, where # is equal to your Intelligence modifier. You may do so three times, uses of this feature recovering after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Enkindle
entries: {@i 14th-level Summoner feature}

Beginning at the 14th level, as an action you are able to call on your Egi to release the great power hidden within it, unleashing a devastating attack. You may unleash the power of your Egi once, this use refreshing after completing a long rest. The power is described in the creature description in appendix B.

subclassFeature.name: Nymian Scholar
entries: Some arcanists decide to research the use of their magic in the medical arts. These arcanists come to be known as nymian scholars, specializing in the lost healing magic of nym. They call on the fey of this lost city, summoning them to assist them on the field of battle.

entries.name: Expanded Spell List
entries: Your specialization as a scholar lets you choose from an expanded list of spells when you learn an arcanist spell. The following spells are added to the arcanist spell list for you.

subclassFeature.name: Critical Heal
entries: {@i 2nd-level Nymian Scholar feature}

Starting at the 2nd level, your healing spells have the potential to cause a critical heal. When you cast a healing spell and one of the die results in its highest possible result. Roll another die of the same value and add that number to the amount of hit points recovered. A critical heal may only occur once per healing spell.

subclassFeature.name: Nymian Healer
entries: {@i 6th-level Nymian Scholar feature}

Starting at 6th level, your healing spells are more effective. Whenever you use a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 5 + the spell's level.

subclassFeature.name: Adloquiem
entries: {@i 10th-level Nymian Scholar feature}

Starting at the 10th level, when you cast a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, you may expend one us of tactics to empower the heal. Your healing spell creates a protective ward on the creature, granting them temporary hit equal to the hit points recovered for 10 minutes. If a critical heal occurred, the target gains additional temporary points equal to half of the amount of hit points recovered.

subclassFeature.name: Nymian Savior
entries: {@i 14th-level Nymian Scholar feature}
Starting at the 14th level, when you cast a healing spell which not grant temporary hit points, that creature gains 1d10 hitpoints.

subclassFeature.name: School of Blood Magic
entries: Shrouded by curiosity and insidious methods, you have sacrificed a portion of your mortality to gain greater arcane power. You’ll do anything to get an edge over your opponents, even at the cost of your own strength.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Magic
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have a pool of magic that you can call upon at the expense of your vitality. These are represented by a number of d4s equal to your Wizard level. When you spend one of these dice, you roll it and take damage equal to what you rolled. These blood magic dice increase in size as you gain levels in this class, becoming a d6 at 7th level, a d8 at 13th level, and a d10 at 18th level. Your Blood Magic pool replenishes after a long rest.

Alternatively, you can spend a hit die and roll it as if you were restoring hit points on a short rest, only instead you take damage equal to the roll. Afterwards, you replenish 2 spent Blood Magic dice.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Manipulation
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you have the ability to empower you and your spells with your blood magic. Using your Blood Magic, you can do one of the following :

entries.name: Blood Boost
entries: When you make an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can spend a blood magic die and add what you rolled to the result.

entries.name: Blood Empowerment
entries: When you cast a wizard spell of 1st level or higher, you can spend any number of blood magic dice up to your Intelligence Modifier (minimum of 1.) and add the total rolled to any damage or healing the spell provides. Alternatively, you can increase the save DC of the spell by 1 for every 2 blood magic dice spent.

entries.name: Blood Focus
entries: When you roll initiative, or as a bonus action every subsequent turn thereafter, you can spend a blood magic die and create an arcane focus for your wizard spells. This arcane focus replaces any costly materials for a spell up to 100 gp. If the spell consumes the material, your focus is also consumed. This arcane focus lasts for 1 hour, until consumed, or until dispelled as a bonus action. Right before the duration ends, you can spend an additional blood magic die to keep the arcane focus manifested for an additional hour.

subclassFeature.name: Dark Devotion
entries: Starting at 6th level, your devotion to the dark arts of blood magic gives you a will stronger than most. You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.

In addition, while toying with your mortality you’ve strengthened your body to better take your lust for destruction. You gain 6 hit points, and 1 additional hit point each time you gain a level in this class.

subclassFeature.name: Sigil of the Blood Arcane
entries: Starting at 10th level, you’ve discovered an arcane sigil that allows you to prepare more spells at a given time. Choose a number of wizard spells in your spellbook equal to your Constitution modifier. (minimum of 1.) You always have these spells prepared and they do not count against your total number of prepared spells. You can also cast them without expending a spell slot by spending blood magic dice equal to the spell’s level. Once you cast each of these spells in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

Additionally, when you use your Arcane Recovery feature, you can spend any number of blood magic dice up to your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1.) to increase the total level of spells you can recover for each blood magic die spent. (For example, at level 10 if you spend 2 blood magic dice you can recover 7 levels worth of spell slots.) You otherwise follow the rules of the feature as normal.

subclassFeature.name: Permanent Blood Focus
entries: Also at 10th level, when you manifest a Blood Focus using your Blood Manipulation, you can spend an additional 4 blood magic dice to keep the Blood Focus manifested until it is consumed by a spell or dispelled as a bonus action. When you do so, the gold cost of the material increases to 1000 gp.

If the spell consumes the material component, but it is worth less than 1000 gp, you subtract the difference and your Blood Focus is not consumed. The result becomes your new gold cost. When the gold cost reaches under 100 gp, your blood focus is consumed.

subclassFeature.name: Iron Will
entries: Starting at 14th level, your dedication to blood magic has strengthened both your body and mind. You add your Constitution modifier to your Intelligence and Wisdom saving throws. You also become proficient in Constitution saving throws. If you already have proficiency in this saving throw, choose one between Strength or Dexterity.

In addition, once when you would take damage from one of your Blood Magic features, you can choose to not take damage instead. When you do so, you gain vulnerability to the next damage roll, ignoring any resistances or immunities you would otherwise have. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Constitution Modifier, regaining expended uses after a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Ghostslayer
entries: The Order of the Ghostslayer is the oldest of the orders, having originally rediscovered the secrets of blood magic and refined them for combat against the scourge of undeath. ghostslayers seek out and study the moment of death, obsessing over the mysteries of the transition and how it can become corrupted by unholy powers to rise once more. Tuning their abilities to annihilate such abominations, these zealous blood hunters seek out the sources of such necromantic energies, intent to destroy them wherever they arise.

subclassFeature.name: Rite of the Dawn
entries: When you join this order at 3rd level, you learn the Rite of the Dawn esoteric rite (detailed below).

entries.name: Rite of the Dawn
entries: Your rite damage is radiant damage. While the rite is active, you gain the following benefits:

items: Your weapon sheds bright light out to a radius of 20 feet.
You have resistance to necrotic damage.
Your weapon deals one additional hemocraft die when you hit an undead.

subclassFeature.name: Curse Specialist
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, your ancient order teaches advanced mastery over blood curses. You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. In addition, your blood curses can target any creature, whether it has blood or not.

subclassFeature.name: Ethereal Step
entries: Upon reaching 7th level, at the start of your turn, if you aren't incapacitated, you can choose to magically step into the veil between the planes. You can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain, as well as see and affect creatures and objects on the Ethereal Plane. You take {@dice 1d10} force damage if you end your turn inside an object. If you are inside an object when this feature ends, you are immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy and take force damage equal to twice the number of feet you moved. This feature lasts for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1 round).
You can use this feature once. Beginning at 15th level, you can use your Ethereal Step feature twice between rests. You regain all expended uses when you finish a short or longrest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Sundering
entries: Beginning at 11th level, your Brand of Castigation now exposes a fragment of your foe's essence, leaving them vulnerable to your Crimson Rite. Whenever you damage a branded creature with your Crimson Rite, you roll one additional hemocraft die. In addition, the branded creature can't move through creatures or objects.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist
entries: At 15th level, you've honed your hemocraft to tear wicked influence from your allies, punishing those who would infiltrate their body and mind. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of the Exorcist|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This doesn't count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Revival
entries: Upon reaching 18th level, you learn to protect your fading life by absorbing your blood rite. When you are reduced to 0 hit points while you have an active Crimson Rite, but don't die outright, the rite ends and you drop to 1 hit point instead. If you have multiple rites active, you choose which one ends.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Profane Soul
entries: Those who have taken to the Order of the Profane Soul have seen the limits of hemocraft against some of the most ancient and cruel fiends and terrors of the world. Unable to pursue beings of such power, creatures able to vanish amongst the nobles without a trace, or bend the mind of the most stalwart warrior with but a glance, this order trusted in the irresilience and delved into this same well of corrupting arcane knowledge, making pacts with lesser evils to better combat the greater. While they may have traded a part of themselves, members of this order believe the power gained far outweighs the price, for even devils now quake when they know they've drawn the attention of the Order of the Profane Soul.

subclassFeature.name: Otherworldly Patron
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you strike a bargain with an otherworldly being of your choice: the Archfey, the Fiend, or the Great Old One, each detailed in the Player's Handbook, the Undying within the Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide, and the Celestial or Hexblade in Xanathar's Guide to Everything. Your choice augments some of your order features.

subclassFeature.name: Pact Magic
entries: When you reach 3rd level, you can augment your combat techniques with the ability to cast spells. See {@book chapter 10|PHB|10} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spell casting and chapter 11 of the Player's Handbook for the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}.

entries.name: Cantrips
entries: You learn two cantrips of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}. You learn an additional warlock cantrip of your choice at 10th level.

entries.name: Spell Slots
entries: The Profane Soul Spellcasting table shows how many spell slots you have. The table also shows what the level of those slots is; all of your spell slots are the same level. To cast one of your {@filter Warlock spells|spells|class=warlock} of 1st level or higher, you must expend a spell slot. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a short or long rest.
For example, when you are 8th level, you have two 2nd-level spell slots. To cast the 1st-level spell witch bolt, you must spend one of those slots, and you cast it as a 2nd-level spell.

entries.name: Spells Known of 1st Level and Higher
entries: At 3rd level, you know two 1st-level spells of your choice from the {@filter Warlock spell list|spells|class=warlock}.

The Spells Known column of the Profane Soul table shows when you learn more {@filter Warlock spells|spells|class=warlock} of your choice of 1st level and higher. A spell you choose must be of a level no higher than what's shown in the table's Slot Level column for your level. When you reach 11th level, for example, you learn a new warlock spell, which can be 1st, 2nd, or 3rd level.

Additionally, when you gain a level in this class and order, you can choose one of the warlock spells you know and replace it with another spell from the warlock spell list, which also must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

entries.name: Spellcasting Ability
entries: Intelligence is your spell casting ability for your warlock spells, so you use your Intelligence whenever a spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Intelligence modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a warlock spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

subclassFeature.name: Rite Focus
entries: Beginning at 3rd level, your weapon becomes a core to your pact with your chosen dark patron. While you have an active Crimson Rite, you can use your weapon as a spellcasting focus (found in {@book chapter 5|PHB|5} of the Player's Handbook) for your warlock spells, and you gain a specific benefit based on your chosen pact (outlined below).

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: When you deal rite damage to a creature, it glows with faint light until the end of your next turn. For the duration, the creature can't benefit from half cover, three-quarters cover, or being invisible.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: When you hit a creature with your Rite of the Flame, if you roll a 1 or 2 on your hemocraft die, you can reroll the die. If you do so, you must use the new roll.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: When you score a critical hit against a creature while using the weapon, that creature is frightened of you until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: Whenever you reduce a hostile creature to 0 hit points using a weapon, you regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can expend a use of your Blood Maledict feature as a bonus action to heal one creature that you can see within 60 feet of you. They regain a number of hit points equal to one roll of your hemocraft die + your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: Whenever you target a creature with a blood curse, your next attack against the cursed creature deals additional damage equal to your proficiency modifier.

subclassFeature.name: Mystic Frenzy
entries: Starting at 7th level, when you use your action to cast a cantrip, you can immediately make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

subclassFeature.name: Revealed Arcana
entries: At 7th level, your dark patron grants you the rare use of a dangerous arcane spell based on your pact.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: You can cast {@spell blur} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: You can cast {@spell scorching ray} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: You can cast {@spell detect thoughts} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: You can cast {@spell blindness/deafness} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can cast {@spell lesser restoration} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: You can cast {@spell branding smite} once using a pact magic spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Sapping Scar
entries: Upon reaching 11th level, your Brand of Castigation feature now digs dark, arcane scars into your target, leaving them vulnerable to your magic. A creature branded by you has disadvantage on their saving throws against your warlock spells.

subclassFeature.name: Unsealed Arcana
entries: At 15th level, your patron grants you the rare use of an additional arcane spell based on your pact.

entries.name: The Archfey
entries: You can cast {@spell slow} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Fiend
entries: You can cast {@spell fireball} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Great Old One
entries: You can cast {@spell haste} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Undying
entries: You can cast {@spell bestow curse} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Celestial
entries: You can cast {@spell revivify} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

entries.name: The Hexblade
entries: You can cast {@spell blink} once without expending a spell slot. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of the Souleater
entries: Starting at 18th level, you've learned to siphon the soul from your fallen prey. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of the Souleater|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Mutant
entries: The process of the Hunter's Bane is a painful, scarring, and sometimes fatal experience. Those that survive find themselves irrevocably changed, enhanced. Some found this experience exalting, embracing the ability to alter one's own physiology through a combination of hemocraft and corrupted alchemy. Over generations of experimentation, a splinter order of blood hunters began to emerge, one that focused on brewing toxic elixirs to modify their capabilities in battle, altering their blood and, overtime, become something beyond what they once were. They called themselves the Order of the Mutant. Researching their targets to know their strengths and weaknesses, these blood hunters can alter their biology to be best prepared for the coming conflict.

subclassFeature.name: Formulas
entries: You begin to uncover forbidden alchemical formulas that temporarily alter your mental and physical abilities. Beginning at 3rd level, you choose to learn four mutagen formulas. Your {@filter formula options|optionalfeatures|Feature Type=Mutagen} are detailed at the end of this order description. You gain an additional formula at 7th level, 11th level, 15th level, and 18th level. Additionally, when you gain a new mutagen formula, you can choose one of the formulas you already know and replace it with a new mutagen formula.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagencraft
entries: At 3rd level, you can concoct a single mutagen when you finish a short or long rest. Starting at 7th level, the number of mutagens you can create when you finish a rest increases to two, and you can create three mutagens at 15th level.

As a bonus action you can consume a single mutagen, and the effects and side effects last until you finish a short or long rest, unless otherwise specified. While one or more mutagens are affecting you, you can use an action to focus and flush the toxins from your system, ending the effects and side effects of all mutagens.

Mutagens are designed for your biology and have no effect on other creatures. They are also unstable by nature, losing their potency over time and becoming inert if not used before you finish your next short or long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Mutagens
entries: These mutagens are presented in alphabetical order. You can learn a mutagen at the same time you meet its prerequisites.

entries.name: Aether (11th Level Required)
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks for 1 hour.

entries.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to slightly enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on initiative rolls.

entries.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your Dexterity maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

entries.name: Conversant
entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

entries.name: Cruelty (11th level required)
entries: When you use the Attack action, you can make an additional weapon attack as a bonus action. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Deftness
entries: You gain advantage on Dexterity ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

entries.name: Embers
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to cold damage.

entries.name: Gelid
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to fire damage.

entries.name: Impermeable
entries: You gain resistance to piercing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to slashing damage.

entries.name: Mobile
entries: You are immune to the grappled and restrained conditions. At 11th level, you also are immune to the paralyzed condition. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength ability checks.

entries.name: Nighteye
entries: You gain darkvision for up to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this increases its range by 60 additional feet. As a side effect, you gain sunlight sensitivity (detailed in the Dark Elf section on page 24 in the Player's Handbook).

entries.name: Percipient
entries: You gain advantage on Wisdom ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma ability checks.

entries.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your Strength maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

entries.name: Precision (11th level required)
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10feet. At 15th level, your speed increases by 15 feet instead. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks.

entries.name: Reconstruction (7th level required)
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus if you have at least 1 hit point but no more than half of your hit points left. As a side effect, your speed decreases by 10ft for 1hour.

entries.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your Intelligence maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma saving throws.

entries.name: Shielded
entries: You gain resistance to slashing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

entries.name: Unbreakable
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to piercing damage.

entries.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on death saving throws.

subclassFeature.name: Strange Metabolism
entries: Beginning at 7th level, your body has begun to adapt to toxins and venoms, ignoring their corroding effects. You gain immunity to poison damage and the poisoned condition. In addition, you can instill a burst of adrenaline to temporarily resist the negative effects of a mutagen. As a bonus action, you can choose to ignore the side effect of a mutagen affecting you for 1 minute. Once you use this feature to resist side effects, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of Axiom
entries: At 11th level, your hemocraft has altered your Brand of Castigation to enforce a foe's true nature. Any illusions disguising or making a creature invisible when you brand them end, and they can't benefit from such illusions while branded. If a creature branded by you is polymorphed or has changed shape, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or revert to their true form and be stunned until the end of your next turn. Whenever a branded creature attempts to polymorph or change shape, they must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or the attempt fails, and they are stunned until the end of your next turn.

subclassFeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion
entries: Starting at 15th level, your blood curse can wrack a creature's body with terrible toxins. You gain the {@optfeature Blood Curse of Corrosion|BH2020} for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Exalted Mutation
entries: At 18th level, your body has adapted to produce your toxins naturally in a moment of need. As a reaction, you can choose one mutagen currently affecting you to flush from your system and end, then immediately have a mutagen you know the formula for take effect in its place. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1). You regain all uses of this feature after you finish a long rest.

subclassFeature.name: Order of the Lycan
entries: Of the many terrible curses that plague the realm, few are as ancient or as feared as Lycanthropy. Passed through blood, this affliction seeds a host with the savage strength and hunger for violence of a wicked beast. The Order of the Lycan is a proud order of blood hunters who undergo "The Taming," a ceremonial inflicting of lycanthropy from a senior member. These hunters then use their abilities to harness the power of the monster they harbor without losing themselves to it. Through intense honing of one's own willpower, combined with the secrets of the order's blood magic rituals, members learn to control and unleash their hybrid form for short periods of time. Enhanced physical prowess, unnatural resilience, and razor sharp claws make these warriors a terrible foe to any evil that crosses their path. Yet, no training is perfect, and without care and complete focus, even the greatest of blood hunters can temporarily lose themselves to the bloodlust.

subclassFeature.name: Heightened Senses
entries: Starting when you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to adopt the improved abilities of a natural predator. You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation
entries: Upon choosing this archetype at 3rd level, you begin to learn to control the lycanthropic curse that now lives in your blood. As a bonus action, you can transform into your hybrid form for up to 1 hour. You can speak, use equipment, and wear armor in this form. You can revert to your normal form earlier as a bonus action. You automatically revert to your normal form if you fall unconscious, drop to 0 hit points, or die. This feature replaces the rules for Lycanthropy within the Monster's Manual.
Once you use this feature, you must finish a short or long rest before you can use it again. While you are transformed, you gain the following features:

entries.name: Feral Might
entries: You gain a +1 to melee damage rolls. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+2) and 18th level (+3). You also have advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws.

entries.name: Resilient Hide
entries: You have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical attacks not made with silver weapons. While you are not wearing heavy armor, you gain a +1 bonus to your AC.

entries.name: Predatory Strikes
entries: Your can apply your Crimson Rite feature to your unarmed strikes. You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolIs of your unarmed strikes. When you use the Attack action with an unarmed strike, you can make one unarmed strike as a bonusaction. Your unarmed strikes deal 1d6 slashing damage. The damage increases to 1d8 at 11th level.

entries.name: Bloodlust
entries: If you begin your turn with no more than half of your maximum hit points, you must succeed on a DC 8 Wisdom saving throw or move directly towards the nearest creature to you and use the Attack action against that creature. You can choose whether or not to use your Extra Attack feature for this frenzied attack. If there is more than one possible target, roll to randomly determine the target. You then regain control for the remainder of your turn. If you are under an effect that prevents you from concentrating (like the barbarian's Rage feature), you automatically fail this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: The Onus of Lycanthropy
entries: Those inducted into the Order of the Lycan choose this path with conviction, understanding the terrible burden it is and the challenges it brings. Where most who embrace this curse grow wicked, mad, even murderous, these blood hunters accept the gifts of the beast while maintaining control through intense training and blood magic. These factors enable a member of the Order of the Lycan to prevent the spread of their curse through blood, should they wish to. One of the most sacred oaths of this order is to never infect another without the order's sanction.

Should a member of the Order of the Lycan be cured of the lycanthropic curse, it is a terrible shame on their name, the order, and those who carry the curse still. There have been passages written about members being cleansed against their will, but those brothers and sisters readily return to the order to undergo a renewed initiation of The Taming, reintroducing the curse to their bodies and restoring their honor.

Lycanthropy comes in many forms. Each version of the curse is bound to a specific beast: wolf, bear, tiger, boar, and rat are a few of the more well-known variations. The strain of the curse defines the beast a hybrid form will share, but the features the curse bestows remain relatively uniform across strains.

subclassFeature.name: Stalker's Prowess
entries: At 7th level, your speed increases by 10 feet. You also can add 10 feet to your long jump distance and 3 feet to your high jump distance. In addition, your hybrid form gains the Improved Predatory Strikes feature.

entries.name: Improved Predatory Strikes
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack rolls made with your unarmed strikes. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+2) and 18th level (+3). In addition, when you have an active Crimson Rite while in your hybrid form, your unarmed strikes are considered magical for the purpose of overcoming resistance and immunity to nonmagical attacks and damage.

subclassFeature.name: Advanced Transformation
entries: Starting at 11th level, you learn to unleash and control more of the beast within. You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature twice, regaining all expended uses when you finish a short or long rest. In addition, your hybrid form gains the Lycan Regeneration feature. Lycan Regeneration. At the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to 1 + your Constitution modifier (minimum of 1) if you have at least 1 hit point and no more than half of your hit points left.

subclassFeature.name: Brand of the Voracious
entries: At 15th level, you have advantage on your Wisdom saving throws to maintain control of your bloodlust in hybrid form. In addition, your Brand of Castigation now binds your foe to your hunter's thirst for savagery. While in your hybrid form, your attacks have advantage against a creature branded by you.

subclassFeature.name: Hybrid Transformation Mastery
entries: At 18th level, you have wrestled your inner predator and master edit.
