You can use your Hybrid Transformation feature an unlimited number of times, and your hybrid form can now last indefinitely. You also gain the Blood Curse of the Howl for your Blood Maledict feature. This does not count against your number of blood curses known.

subclassFeature.name: Way of the Tempest
entries: You follow a monastic tradition that teaches you to harness the power of the storm. When you focus your ki, you can align yourself with the storm inside you and bend them to your will, using them as an extension of your body.
Many monks of this tradition tattoo their bodies with representations of their ki powers, commonly imagined as coiling dragons, but also as elder tempests and arcane sigils.

subclassFeature.name: Stormlord’s Protection
entries: Starting at 3rd level you gain resistance to lightning damage. At 10th level you gain resistance to thunder damage.

subclassFeature.name: Fists of the Storm
entries: Starting at 3rd level you can call upon the might of a raging tempest that lies deep within your soul. Your unarmed strikes deal an additional amount of lightning or thunder damage (your choice) equal to your martial arts die.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn Weapons
entries: Also at 3rd level pick two weapons of your choice that lack the special property. You spend a 1 hour ritual concentrating on these weapons to channel your ki through them. When you do so, these weapons are considered Monk Weapons.
When you deal damage with these weapons, you deal an additional amount of lightning or thunder damage (your choice) equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

In addition, these weapons are considered magical for the purposes of overcoming resistances to non-magical weapons. If you are not proficient in these weapons already, you gain that proficiency until the ritual ends. Any attempt to perform this ritual again instantly removes the benefits from the previous weapons you had made as your Stormborn Weapons.

subclassFeature.name: Storm Disciple
entries: Starting at 6th level, you can channel your inner storm into magical spells. You gain the Shocking Grasp and Thunderclap cantrips which uses Wisdom as your spellcasting ability.

In addition you have learned certain disciplines that allow you to cast spells using ki points. You have three disciplines of your choice as detailed below starting at level 6. You learn two additional disciplines of your choice at 11th and 17th levels. Whenever you learn a new discipline, you can also replace one discipline that you already know with a different discipline.

See {@book chapter 10|PHB} of the Player's Handbook for the general rules of spellcasting. To cast one of these spells, you use its casting time and other rules, but you don't need to provide material components for it. When you cast a spell with a discipline, it is cast at the spell's lowest level unless otherwise specified. You use Wisdom for your Spellcasting Ability.
Level 6 Disciplines:

entries.name: Fist of Four Thunders
entries: You slam your fists together in front of you, causing a thunderous boom that blows away everything around you. You can spend 1 ki point to cast thunderwave.

entries.name: Relentless Shock
entries: You condense your mystical energies together into a single mote of lightning of which you hurl at a single enemy. You can spend 1 ki point to cast witch bolt.

entries.name: Booming Thunder
entries: You summon forth a storm within your weapon, allowing you to impact your enemies with the might of thunder and lightning. You can spend 1 ki point to cast thunderous smite.

entries.name: Dragon's Lightning
entries: You can summon the ancient might of the breath of dragons. You can spend 2 ki points to cast dragon’s breath, but can only choose lightning damage.

entries.name: Ire of the Storm
entries: You can draw from the energies around you to conjure a small storm, of which you channel the flow of your ki through in order to strike your foes with lightning bolts. You can spend 3 ki points to cast the Call Lightning Spell.

entries.name: Artemis's Lightning
entries: You can channel raw ki into your ranged attacks, electrifying your shots. You can spend 3 ki points to cast the Lightning Arrow spell.

entries.name: Chariot of the Elder Tempest
entries: You call forth a mighty source of power from within you, unleashing a mighty bolt of electricity being carried by an elder tempest. You can spend 3 ki points to cast the lightning bolt spell.

entries.name: Thor's Leap
entries: You summon forth a mighty strength from within which allows you to burst through the tethers of the material plane, allowing you to make a thunderous step and appear in another position. You can spend 3 ki points to cast the thunder step spell.
Level 11 Disciplines:

entries.name: Sphere of the Storm King
entries: You conjure the power of ancient giant lords to summon forth a powerful storm condensed within a large sphere. You can spend 4 ki points to cast the storm sphere spell.

entries.name: Overwhelming Surge
entries: You can release outward a powerful force of electrifying power by letting loose the storm within you. You can spend 5 ki points to cast the destructive wave spell, but you replace the radiant damage with lightning instead.

entries.name: Ballet of Storms
entries: You perform a variety of stances that allows you to move at lightning speeds. You can spend 5 ki points to cast the steel wind strike spell, but deals your choice of thunder or lightning damage instead of force.

entries.name: Fury of the Storms
entries: You let loose a wild surge of electricity that jumps from one target to the next. You can spend 6 ki points to cast the chain lightning spell.

entries.name: Ritual of the Storm Lord
entries: You perform an ancient religious dance that unlocks hidden potential from within, allowing you to become one with the storms. You can spend 6 ki points to cast the Investiture of Wind spell, but the special action you use to create a cube of swirling wind deals your choice of thunder or lightning damage instead of bludgeoning, adopting a new appearance accordingly.

entries.name: Revival Shock
entries: You rub your hands together to generate a large amount of electric energy that you can use in a pinch to resurrect a dead comrade. You can spend 6 ki points to cast the revivify spell, however in order for the spell to succeed you must make a dc 16 Wisdom (Medicine) ability check. On a failed check, the spell fails and you lose the ki points used to cast the spell. The dc decreases by 2 for each successful death save the target had prior to dying.

Once you reach 11th level in this class, you can spend additional ki points to increase the level of a discipline spell that you cast, provided that the spell has an enhanced effect at a higher level, as lightning bolt does. The spell's level increases by 1 for each additional ki point you spend. For example, if you are a 11th-level monk and use Chariot of the Elder Tempest to cast lightning bolt, you can spend 4 ki points to cast it as a 4th-level spell (the discipline's base cost of 3 ki point plus 1).
The maximum number of ki points (its base ki point cost plus any additional points) that you can spend on the spell is 6, unless a discipline specifies otherwise.

subclassFeature.name: Stormborn’s Tempest
entries: At 11th level, as a bonus action you can spend 3 ki points to channel a powerful storm into a protective aura. You gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to twice your Wisdom Modifier at the start of each of your turns for 1 minute, you also gain these temporary hit points when you use this ability. While you have these temporary hit points, you gain the following benefits :

items: Creatures that hit you with melee attacks while within 5 ft of you take lightning or thunder damage (your choice) equal to twice your Wisdom Modifier.
You have a +2 bonus to AC and Dexterity saving throws.
Whenever you deal lightning or thunder damage, whether by a spell, weapon attack, or magical effect: you add an amount to the roll equal to your Wisdom Modifier.
Once your Stormborn’s Tempest ends you cannot do so again until you have completed a long rest. In addition, you gain one level of exhaustion which can be restored after a short rest.

Your Stormborn’s Tempest can be ended early if a Dispel Magic spell of 5th level or higher, or by similar magical effects is used on you targeting the Stormborn’s Tempest effect. You can also end it early as a bonus action, doing so does not give you a level of exhaustion as long as half the duration or more did not pass.

subclassFeature.name: Overwhelming Storm
entries: Starting at 17th level your lightning has become so powerful, it has become effective against those who resist it. You ignore damage resistances and immunities to lightning and thunder damage. Creatures that were immune to lightning and thunder damage instead take half damage.
When you deal lightning damage to a creature with the Lightning Absorption feature, you can spend 4 ki points to ignore the absorption effect for that damage.
You can also spend additional ki points on your weapon attacks to add 1 extra martial arts die of lightning or thunder damage (your choice) to your attacks per point spent to a maximum of 5.

spell.name: Tetragrammaton
entries: You may cast this spell as an action or a reaction. A creature within range you can see is healed for {@dice 3d8} hit points instantaneously.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the hit points recovered increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Regen
entries: The target's body is enchanted with a blessing which repairs damage to their body over time. For the duration, the creature regains {@dice 1d6} hit points at the start of its turn.

spell.name: Holy
entries: You let loose an orb of radiant energy which floats above you for a moment before exploding with great force in a 10ft radius. All creatures within range must make a Constitution saving throw. Creatures take {@damage 6d8} radiant damage and are {@condition stunned} for one round on a failed save, and take half as much and resist the stun effect on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Banish
entries: Light energy converges on a creature you can see within range. The creature makes a dexterity saving throw. This energy erupts with great force, searing the target creature with {@damage 3d6} radiant damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful save.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 2d6} for each slot level above 2nd.

spell.name: Assize
entries: An eruption of energy from your body soothes allies and wounds enemies. All allies within 60ft. recover {@dice 3d8} hit points and all enemies within 60ft. must make a Wisdom saving throw. They take {@damage 4d4} radiant damage, and half as much on a successful save. You may reverse which die affect healing and which die deal radiant damage, but must make this distinction before rolling.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, increase the number of die for each effect for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Suiton
entries: You draw out the energies of Jin to cause a powerful geyser of water to explode from the ground beneath around you in a 10 ft. radius circle. Each creatures inside the geyser must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes {@damage 4d6} bludgeoning damage and {@damage 4d6} cold damage, and half as much on a successful save. Additionally, you and any items you are wearing or carrying become {@condition invisible} for 1 minute. The invisibility ends when you attack or cast a spell

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@damage 1d6} bludgeoning damage for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Doton
entries: You draw out the energies of Ten to create a circle of corrupted earth on the ground centered at a point of your choosing within range. The circle has a radius of 10ft. and is considered to be difficult terrain for all creatures except for you. Creatures take {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage for every 5ft. they travel within Doton. When Doton appears, all creatures within the ring make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 4d4} necrotic damage and half as much on a successful save. You are unaffected by this damage.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d4} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Jolt
entries: A shard of crystallized aether streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d8} force damage.

The spell creates more than one shard when you reach higher levels: two shards at 5th level three shards at 11th level and four shards at 17th level You can direct the shards at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each shard

spell.name: Flare
entries: You select a target within range and create a point of energy on their body. Fiery energy explodes from their location in a 40 feet globe, incinerating all creatures within the globe. All affected creatures make a Dexterity saving throw, taking {@damage 20d6} fire and {@damage 20d6} force damage on a failed saving throw and half as much on a success.

spell.name: Lustrate
entries: You may cast this spell as an action or as a reaction. This spell cannot be used in tandem with Adloquiem (Nymian Scholar feature). A target you can see within range is invigorated by a burst of soothing magic. They recover hit points equal to {@dice 5d8}

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the hit points recovered increases by {@dice 1d8} for each slot level above 4th.

spell.name: Sacred Soil
entries: You create a 10ft. radius dome of protective magic to shield your allies from harm centered on a location within range. When an ally within the dome takes damage, the damage is reduced by {@dice 1d6}.

spell.name: Celestial Opposition
entries: You release a massive amount of astral energy in a 30 feet radius globe centered on you. The inside of the globe is dimly lit, and filled with the softly glowing lights which map the starry sky. On this release, all enemies coming in contact with the globe are star struck and must make a Wisdom saving throw. Enemies take {@damage 6d8} force damage and are {@condition stunned} for the next {@dice 1d4} rounds on a failed save.On a success, the enemies take half damage and are not {@condition stunned}.

spell.name: Collective Unconscious
entries: You create a magical barrier around yourself. The barrier is a 10ft. radius sphere. All allies within the radius are healed immediately for {@dice 3d8}. As long as they remain in the barrier, their AC receives a +1 bonus and each time they start their turn within the barrier they are healed for {@dice 1d6} hitpoints.

spell.name: Gravity
entries: You conjure the energies of the stars through your arcane focus to temporarily create a small, dense celestial body at a point within range. A spherical gravitational field appears around the body with 20 feet radius and produces a pulsing sound. Each creature within the field must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes {@damage 10d6} force damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each slot level above 5th.

spell.name: Control Sparks
entries: You create small harmless sparks of electricity. You can shape the strands of electricity in any way you see fit within range in a 5ft cube. You can use the sparks to ignite small objects, for example a cigarette, but never actually set it aflame. You can also surround yourself with these sparks and whenever a creature comes into contact with you, the sparks zap them as if it were static electricity. You can also use this feature to give a device active electricity for up to 1 hour.

spell.name: Shape Acid
entries: You choose an area of acid that you can see within range and that fits within a 5-foot cube. You manipulate it in one of the following ways:

items: You instantaneously move or otherwise change the flow of the acid as you direct, up to 5 feet in any direction. This movement doesn’t have enough force to cause damage and the acid being manipulated loses its damaging properties until released, which when released it deals {@damage 1d6} acid damage to a creature it is dropped on.
You cause the acid to form into simple shapes and animate at your direction. This change lasts for 1 hour.
You change the acid’s color or opacity. The acid must be changed in the same way throughout. This change lasts for 1 hour.

entries: If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have no more than two of its non-instantaneous effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

spell.name: Poison Flow
entries: Choose a poisonous substance nearby, whether it is in a vial, pool, bowl, drink, etc. You can magically move that substance freely within range. If moved into a creature, the creature can make a Dexterity Saving Throw, consuming the poison on a failed save. If a creature has a poison flowing through them, you can use this cantrip to remove the poison safely, without harming the creature who is {@condition poisoned}. The creature must be within the range of the cantrip and must remain perfectly still so that the flow is not interrupted. This process typically takes anywhere from 1 minute to 1 hour depending on how long the poison had been present.

spell.name: Dragon Roar
entries: You let out a loud and mighty roar that can be heard from 100 feet away that startles creatures nearby. Each creature within range, other than you, must make a Constitution saving throw or take {@damage 1d6} thunder damage.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d6} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d6}), 11th level ({@dice 3d6}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d6}).

spell.name: Dragon Fury
entries: You channel draconic magic to cause your teeth or fingernails to sharpen, ready to deliver a powerful attack. Make a melee spell attack against one creature within 5 feet of you. On a hit, the target takes {@damage 1d10} piercing damage. After you make the attack, your teeth or fingernails return to normal.
The spell's damage increases by {@dice 1d10} when you reach 5th level ({@dice 2d10}), 11th level ({@dice 3d10}), and 17th level ({@dice 4d10}).

spell.name: Detect Wyrm
entries: For the duration, you know if there is a dragon within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically altered by a dragon’s territorial influence.
The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

spell.name: Dragon Flame
entries: A nonmagical weapon you touch becomes a magic weapon. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration, the weapon wreathes in magical flame and deals an extra {@damage 1d6} damage of the chosen type when it hits.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th or 6th level, the extra damage increases to {@dice 2d6}. When you use a spell slot of 7th or 8th level, the bonus to the extra damage increases to {@dice 3d6}. When you use a spell slot of 9th level, the bonus increases to {@dice 4d6}.

spell.name: Conjure Minor Drakes
entries: You summon dragons that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. You choose one the following options for what appears:

items: One {@filter dragon of challenge rating 2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&2]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Two {@filter dragons of challenge rating 1 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Four {@filter dragons of challenge rating 1/2 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/2]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}
Eight {@filter dragons of challenge rating 1/4 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&1/4]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm}.

entries: A dragon summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any verbal commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.
The DM has the creatures' statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

spell.name: Conjure Dragon

components.m: a scale or claw from type of dragon you are conjuring

entries: You call forth a draconic servant. A {@filter dragon of challenge rating 7 or lower|bestiary|challenge rating=[&0;&7]|type=dragon|miscellaneous=!swarm} appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. The dragon disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The dragon is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the dragon, which has its own turns. It obeys any verbal commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the dragon, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your concentration is broken, the dragon doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the dragon, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions for being ordered by lesser creatures, and it might attack. An uncontrolled dragon can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.
The DM has the dragon's statistics.

entriesHigherLevel.name: At Higher Levels
entries: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 6th.

monster.name: Emerald Carbuncle
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

action.name: Gust
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) thunder damage.

action.name: Back Draft {@recharge}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) thunder damage. When a creature is damaged by Back Draft they must make a Strength saving throw equal to 8 + Emerald Carbuncle's Wisdom modifier + proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the target is knocked back 10 ft., and are not knocked back on a successful save.

monster.name: Topaz Carbuncle
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

action.name: Gouge
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. A creature struck by Gouge must make a Wisdom saving throw equal to 8 + Topaz Carbuncle's Wisdom modifier + proficiency bonus. On a failed save, the creature has disadvantage on actions taken against targets other than Topaz Carbuncle during their next actions

action.name: Curl {@recharge}
entries: Topaz Carbuncle increases its AC by 2 for {@dice 1d4} rounds.

monster.name: Ifrit-Egi
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

action.name: Burning Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage plus {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Flame Charge {@recharge}
entries: The Ifrit-Egi releases a burst of flames in a circle 10 ft. around itself. Each creature in that area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + Ifrit-Egi's Charisma modifier + proficiency bonus, taking {@h}6 ({@damage 1d12}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on successful one.

action.name: Inferno (Requires Enkindle)
entries: Ifrit-Egi releases an explosive pillar or fire around itself in a 30 ft. radius, severely burning all creatures in range. All affected creatures must make a Dexterity save equal to 8 + Ifrit-Egi's Charisma modifier + proficiency bonus, receiving {@damage 7d12} fire damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful save.

monster.name: Titan-Egi
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

action.name: Rock Buster
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 21}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Earthen Armor {@recharge}
entries: Creates a barrier of stone around Titan-Egi and either the summoner or any other ally within 30ft. of Titan-Egi. Both Targets obtain temporary hit points equal to Titan-Egi's Constitution modifier + proficiency bonus. The barriers crumble to dust at the end of Titan-Egi's next round, removing the temporary hit points as well.

action.name: Earthen Fury (Requires Enkindle)
entries: Titan-Egi instantaneously pulverizes the land around it, turning a 30 ft. radius circle of land into a swampy mire. The affected area is considered difficult terrain and all creatures other than the Summoner or Titan-Egi that start their turn in the mire receive 18 {@damage 4d8} poison damage. The area remains for a number of turns equal to your Intelligence modifier.

monster.name: Garuda-Egi
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

action.name: Wind Blade
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) thunder damage.

action.name: Aerial Slash {@recharge}
entries: A target creature within 30 ft. of Garuda-Egi becomes the center point of a massive burst of wind. All creatures within 10 ft. must make a Dexterity saving throw equal to 8 + Garuda-Egi's Charisma modifier + proficiency bonus. On a failed save the creature takes 7 {@damage 2d6} thunder damage and half as much on a successful save.

action.name: Aerial Blast (Requires Enkindle)
entries: Garuda-Egi unleashes a thunderous burst of energy in a 20 ft. circle within 30 ft. of Garuda-Egi. This massive tornado persists for a moment, dealing 39 {@damage 6d12} thunder damage. All creatures within range must make a Strength saving throw equal to 8 + Garuda-Egi's Charisma modifier + proficiency bonus. On a failed save all creatures are knocked back 20 ft. from the point of Aerial Blast.

monster.name: Eos
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eos's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Unarmed
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fey Shield {@recharge}
entries: Eos creates a shield of temporary hit points around a target creature within 60 ft. of them. This shield is {@dice 1d4} + Eos's spellcasting ability modifier. The shield lasts for one minute before fading.

monster.name: Selene
languages: understands the languages of its summoner but cannot speak

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Selene's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Unarmed
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Fey Lance
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) radiant damage.

action.name: Auto-fire
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Root Stance
entries: As an action the Rook Autoturret releases tripod legs into the ground rooting it in place. The turret now automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws and it's speed becomes 0 ft. The turret must use an action to retract its tripod legs and leave its stance. The Rook Autoturret doubles the proficiency bonus it receives from Companion Bond on its attack and damage rolls.

action.name: Muscle Stimulator (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: Rook Autoturret releases a field of stimulating energy around itself. Allied creatures within 20 ft. of Rook Autoturret deal {@damage 2d6} bonus damage when they make a melee or ranged weapon attack.

action.name: Area Shock
entries: All creatures within 5 ft. of the Bishop Autoturret must make a Dexterity saving throw (DC = 8 + proficiency bonus), taking {@damage 1d6} lightning damage on a failed saved, and half as much on a successful save.

action.name: Single Shock
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 3} to hit, range 20 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Barrier Stance
entries: As an action the Bishop Autoturret releases tripod legs into the ground rooting it in place. The turret now automatically fails all Dexterity saving throws and it's speed becomes 0 ft. The turret must use an action to retract its tripod legs and leave its stance. The Bishop Autoturret creates a circular barrier of lightning energy, 10 ft. in radius centered on itself. Any creature that attempts to pass through the barrier must make a {@dc 14} Constitution check. On a failed check, the creature takes {@damage 2d6} lightning damage and is paralyzed for one round. On a successful save, half damage is taken and the creature is not paralyzed.

action.name: Mana Capacitor (Recharges on a Long Rest)
entries: Bishop Autoturret releases a field of aether amplifying energy around itself. Allied creatures within 20 ft. of Bishop Autoturret gain +3 to their spell save DC and ranged spell attack bonus.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Many up and coming spellcasters from Magic High usually come to the Academy of Vulnaris to learn how to properly cast magic higher than cantrip level These students are some of the most brilliant minds the land, but they are still novices to the craft. Often these spellcasters are wizards, but in the Academy of Vulnaris there is a plethora of different kinds of spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kobold is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The mage has 3 sorcery points. It regains all its spent sorcery points when it finishes a long rest. It can spend its sorcery points on the following options:

Heightened Spell: When it casts a spell that forces a creature to a saving throw to resist the spell's effects, the mage can spend 3 sorcery points to give one target of the spell disadvantage on its first saving throw against the spell.
Subtle Spell: When the mage casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiar
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Many up and coming spellcasters from Magic High usually come to the Academy of Vulnaris to learn how to properly cast magic higher than cantrip level These students are some of the most brilliant minds the land, but they are still novices to the craft. Often these spellcasters are wizards, but in the Academy of Vulnaris there is a plethora of different kinds of spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pseudodragon has learned the very basics of spellcasting. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells without requiring material components:

trait.name: Keen Senses
entries: The pseudodragon has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight, hearing, or smell.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The pseudodragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Limited Telepathy
entries: The pseudodragon can magically communicate simple ideas, emotions, and images telepathically with any creature within 100 feet of it that can understand a language.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the target falls {@condition unconscious} for the same duration, or until it takes damage or another creature uses an action to shake it awake.

action.name: Fire Breath
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 10-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

variant.name: Pseudodragon Familiar
entries: Some pseudodragons are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such pseudodragons have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

The elusive pseudodragon dwells in the quiet places of the world, making its home in the hollows of trees and small caves. With its red-brown scales, horns, and a maw filled with sharp teeth, a pseudodragon resembles a tiny red dragon but its disposition is playful.

entries.name: Quiet and Defensive
entries: Pseudodragons have little interest in other creatures, and they avoid them whenever possible. If it is attacked, a pseudodragon fights back using the poisonous stinger at the tip of its tail, one jab of which can put a creature into a catatonic state that can last for hours.

entries.name: Draconic Familiars
entries: Mages often seek out pseudodragons, whose agreeable disposition, telepathic ability, and resistance to magic make them superior familiars. Pseudodragons are selective when it comes to choosing companions, but they can sometimes be won over with gifts of food or treasure. When a pseudodragon finds an agreeable companion, it bonds with that person as long as it is treated fairly.
A pseudodragon puts up with no ill treatment, and it abandons a manipulative or abusive companion without warning.

entries.name: Language of Emotion
entries: Pseudodragons can't speak, but they communicate using a limited form of telepathy that allows them to share basic ideas such as hunger, curiosity, or affection. When it bonds with a companion, a pseudodragon can communicate what it sees and hears even over long distances.

A pseudodragon often vocalizes animal noises. A rasping purr indicates pleasure, while a hiss means unpleasant surprise. A bird-like chirping represents desire, and a growl always means anger or discontent.
Variant: Pseudodragon Familiar
Some pseudodragons are willing to serve spellcasters as a familiar. Such pseudodragons have the following trait.

entries.name: Familiar
entries: The pseudodragon can serve another creature as a familiar, forming a magic, telepathic bond with that willing companion. While the two are bonded, the companion can sense what the pseudodragon senses as long as they are within 1 mile of each other. While the pseudodragon is within 10 feet of its companion, the companion shares the pseudodragon's Magic Resistance trait. At any time and for any reason, the pseudodragon can end its service as a familiar, ending the telepathic bond.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 7th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Mages spend their lives in the study and practice of magic. Good-aligned mages offer counsel to nobles and others in power, while evil mages dwell in isolated sites to perform unspeakable experiments without interference.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is an 18th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell gift of alacrity|egw} and {@spell fortune's favor|egw} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.
Emit is a powerful mage that has practiced time manipulation. He appears to be on the verge of a breakthrough, but has made little progress past that.
Little is known of his past, he doesn't share much with anyone. They say he likes you if he even tells you his name.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The assassin's spellcasting ability is Constitution ({@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Unstable Mark
entries: When the assassin casts an innate spell, each creature within 10 feet of the assassin must make a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw, taking 4 ({@damage 1d8}) force damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: The claire stravras deals an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the claire stravras that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the claire stravras doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the claire stravras is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the claire stravras instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the claire stravras has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the claire stravras scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Chromatic Orb (1/Day)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 4} to hit, range 90 ft., one creature. {@h}18 ({@dice 4d8}) damage of a type chosen by the assassin: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, or thunder.

Claire Stravras, daughter of Eririus Stravras the headmaster of The Academy of Vulnaris. She was stolen by a group of assassins known as The Wayfinders. She was trained to kill them, but she also learned how to cast spells via her unstable dragonmark.

entries.name: Aberrant Dragonmark Innate Spells
entries: The power granted by an aberrant dragonmark is unpredictable. When running a Tarkanan assassin, you can roll on the Aberrant Dragonmark Innate Spells table to determine the spells gained from that NPC's aberrant mark, replacing the spells in the stat block's Innate Spellcasting trait.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:
At will: {@spell dancing lights}, {@spell detect magic}, {@spell counterspell}
1/day each: {@spell clairvoyance}, {@spell darkness}, {@spell detect thoughts}, {@spell dispel magic}, {@spell faerie fire}, {@spell levitate} (self only), {@spell suggestion}

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The drow is a 12th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). He has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 14 ({@dice 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes three shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword + 1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Light Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Sneak
entries: Terris uses half of his movement and takes the hide action. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Evasive Shot
entries: Terris uses half of his movement and makes one attack with his crossbow. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Evasive Movement
entries: Terris uses his full movement. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Terris casts a 3rd level or lower spell.

Trained in the use of poison, assassins are remorseless killers who work for nobles, guildmasters, sovereigns, and anyone else who can afford them. Terris Wayfinder is a powerful assassin, and leader of the crime syndicate The Wayfinders. He has a grudge against the Academy after kicking him out for following Lolth.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Malissa's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Destructive Magic
entries: When Malissa casts a spell that deals damage, it gains a bonus to the damage roll equal to her spellcasting ability modifier.

trait.name: Red Draconian Origins
entries: Whenever Malissa casts a spell of 1st level or higher that deals fire damage, each creature that suffers the effects of the spell must make a Constitution Saving Throw. On a failed save, the creature will be wreathed in flames that will deal fire damage equal to her spellcasting ability modifier at the start of each of their turns for 1 minute. They can repeat their saving throws at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on a success. A creature can spend their action putting out the flames, ending the effect early.

trait.name: All Knowing Eyes
entries: Malissa can cast {@spell Identify} at will without expending a spell slot or requiring a material component, you also do not need to touch the item to identify it.

trait.name: Eyes of the Magi Drakes
entries: Malissa can cast {@spell detect magic} at will without material, somatic, or verbal components or spending a spell slot.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Malissa Dragonflame was born into a poor family. When she was a young girl, her mother and father were forced to join the military and had to send her away to a foster home. This foster home was attacked and destroyed.

She was found by a red dragon, who took her in and raised her for a time. When she was old enough to take care of herself, the dragon left. She went off to find Eririus Stravras, who promised her training in the arcane and place to call home.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
headerEntries: Lyssandra's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lyssandra's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The Lyssandra can innately cast the following spells:

trait.name: Brave
entries: Lyssandra has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Lyssandra knows if she hears a lie.

trait.name: War Priest 4/long rest
entries: When Lyssandra uses the Attack action, she can make one weapon attack as a bonus action.

trait.name: Channel Divnity 1/rest
entries: Turn Undead: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear her within 30 feet of her must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.
Guided Strike: When Lyssandra makes an attack roll, she can use her Channel Divinity to gain a +10 bonus to the roll.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.
Lyssandra was born with further celestial origins than your typical Aasimar. She has a divine presence that gives her immense magical power.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
headerEntries: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Disciple of Life
entries: Also starting at 1st level, your healing spells are more effective. Whenever Annabeth uses a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to 2 + the spell's level.

trait.name: Channel Divinity 1/rest
entries: Turn Undead: As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear her within 30 feet of her must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

Preserve Life: As an action, Annabeth presents her holy symbol and evoke healing energy that can restore a number of hit points equal to 5. She chooses any creatures within 30 feet of her, and divide those hit points among them. This feature can restore a creature to no more than half of its hit point maximum. You can't use this feature on an undead or a construct.

Annabeth was born into the Loreli family. The Loreli family has always been faithful followers to Sune, the Goddess of Love and Beauty. She has a passion for looking her absolute best all the time, and she hopes to find magic that can help with that.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eririus is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 25}, {@hit 17} to hit with spell attacks). Eririus can cast {@spell healing word} and {@spell misty step} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Eririus has a {@item staff of the magi}, {@item ring of protection}, and a {@item robe of the archmagi} attuned to. He also has a +3 rapier disguised as a ring that he wears. He can use a bonus action to speak its command word and have it transform into the sword.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If Eririus is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Eririus regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons
entries: Eririus Stravras's weapon attacks are magical. When Eririus Stravras hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 4d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Eririus Stravras knows if he hears a lie.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, Eririus Stravras can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery
entries: When Eririus finishes a short rest, he can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half his CR (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

trait.name: Healing Light
entries: Whenever Eririus uses a spell of 1st level or higher to restore hit points to a creature, the creature regains additional hit points equal to his charisma modifier + half the spell's level (rounded down to a minimum of 1).

trait.name: Empowered Healing 5/day
entries: When Eririus casts a spell of 1st level or higher that would heal a target, instead of rolling he can restore the maximum possible hit points from the spell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Eririus Stravras fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Rapier +3
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 23 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Strategic Advantage
entries: The next ability check, attack roll, or saving throw Eririus makes is at advantage.

legendary.name: Strategic Command
entries: Eririus can command one ally that can hear him to use half of their movement and they can either make one weapon attack or cast a spell with a casting time of 1 action.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Eririus casts a spell of 6th level or lower.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Eririus Stravras is a powerful archmage that is the current headmaster of the Academy of Vulnaris. He is often quite busy with his duty as the headmaster, but still manages to find time for his own craft.

Eririus has taken in several students under his wing, and hopes to one day watch all of them flourish as their own archmages. This is mainly due to his daughter being stolen from him by The Wayfinders many years ago. He's tried all kinds of divination magic, but to this day he still hasn't found her.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

hp.special: equal the elemental's Constitution modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier + five times the spell's level

trait.name: Amorphous Form (Air, Fire, and Water Only)
entries: The elemental can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} +4 + the spell's level to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4} + the spell's level bludgeoning damage (Air, Earth, and Water only) or fire damage (Fire only).

action.name: Gust (air only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} + the spell's level to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) + the spell's level thunder damage.

action.name: Flare Shot (fire only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} + the spell's level to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) + the spell's level fire damage.

action.name: Rock Throw (earth only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} + the spell's level to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) + the spell's level bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Ice Shard (water only)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} + the spell's level to hit, range 30/30 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) + the spell's level cold damage.

ac.special: 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

hp.special: equal the elemental's Constitution modifier + your spellcasting ability modifier + five times the spell's level

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The astral carbuncle can innately cast {@spell plane shift} twice per day, without requiring material components. Charisma is its spellcasting ability.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The astral carbuncle can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the astral carbuncle is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The astral carbuncle has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The astral carbuncle's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, the astral carbuncle can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The elemental makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell's level (rounded down).

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} +4 + the spell's level to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}{@damage 1d10 + 4} + the spell's level force damage.

action.name: Pulse Beam
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} + the spell's level to hit, range 60/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) + the spell's level force damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4  -1}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Many up and coming spellcasters from Magic High usually come to the Academy of Vulnaris to learn how to properly cast magic higher than cantrip level These students are some of the most brilliant minds the land, but they are still novices to the craft. Often these spellcasters are wizards, but in the Academy of Vulnaris there is a plethora of different kinds of spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The kobold is a 2nd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiar
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Many up and coming spellcasters from Magic High usually come to the Academy of Vulnaris to learn how to properly cast magic higher than cantrip level These students are some of the most brilliant minds the land, but they are still novices to the craft. Often these spellcasters are wizards, but in the Academy of Vulnaris there is a plethora of different kinds of spellcasting.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Healer)
headerEntries: The spellcaster's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). The spellcaster has following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Divine Arcana 1/rest
entries: As a bonus action, Emil can speak a prayer to control the flow of magic around him. The next spell he casts gains a +2 bonus to any attack roll you make for it or to its saving throw DC, as appropriate.

trait.name: Arcane Recovery
entries: When Emil finishes a short rest, he can choose expended spell slots to recover. The spell slots can have a combined level that is equal to or less than half his CR (rounded up), and none of the slots can be 6th level or higher.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/40 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage in melee, or 4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage at range.
Emil grew up studying from the academy, he may be young but he has a lot of promise. His father is the famously known Eririus Stravras, the headmaster of the academy.
He doesn't really talk very much, he seems to be very shy and reserved. He apparently likes to read books.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 16th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Alcoholic
entries: Desmond has advantage on saving throws against being intoxicated.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Desmond spends most of his time either in bars or on the streets. He likes to take walks or nap when he doesn't have students to look after. He's a bit of a slob, but at least he dresses nice. He is at least very well read when it comes to magic and he is a particularly good detective.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Karen is a 14th level sorcerer. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma and has a {@dc 17} spell save and a +9 to hit with spell attacks. She has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Petrifying Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the medusa's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the medusa, the medusa can force it to make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw if the medusa isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is instantly {@condition petrified}. Otherwise, a creature that fails the save begins to turn to stone and is {@condition restrained}. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The petrification lasts until the creature is freed by the  {@spell greater restoration} spell or other magic.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the medusa until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the medusa in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.
If the medusa sees itself reflected on a polished surface within 30 feet of it and in an area of bright light, the medusa is, due to its curse, affected by its own gaze.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The medusa makes either three melee attacks—one with its snake hair, one to constrict, and one with its shortsword—or two ranged attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Snake Hair
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage plus 17 ({@damage 5d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage.

action.name: Constrict
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 12}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the medusa can't constrict another target.

Karen used to be an evil Medusa that tried to kill Eririus Stravras. Though her efforts had failed, it would ultimately be for the best as Eririus would actually take her in and show her a new path. She now teaches new sorcerers how to cast magic.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Professor Watanabe is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: Professor Watanabe's Unarmed Strikes are considered magical.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: Professor Watanabe takes 40 less damage from falling.

trait.name: Ki (8/8)
entries: Professor Watanabe can spend 1 ki point to do one of the following:
Stunning Strike.
Flurry of Blows.
Patient Defense.
Step of the Wind.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: Professor Watanabe reduces a ranged attack by {@dice 1d10 + 8}. If she reduces the damage to 0, she makes throws the attack back at the target.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Professor Watanabe is a strong woman who likes to go out drinking occasionally. She gets the job done quickly and efficiently, though she can be a bit crude or harsh. She doesn't hold back when it comes to criticism and she expects perfection. Though she has a kind heart deep down.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If Master Misaki is subjected to an effect that allows her to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, she instead takes no damage if she succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if she fails.

trait.name: Ki-Empowered Strikes
entries: Master Misaki's Unarmed Strikes are considered magical.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: Master Misaki takes 55 less damage from falling.

trait.name: Ki (13/13)
entries: Master Misaki can spend 1 ki point to do one of the following:
Stunning Strike.
Flurry of Blows.
Patient Defense.
Step of the Wind.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: Professor Watanabe reduces a ranged attack by {@dice 1d10 + 13}. If she reduces the damage to 0, she makes throws the attack back at the target.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Master Misaki is a very well-verse Monk who has trained for nearly her entire life. She is a very kind spirited woman who cares for her students as if they were her own children. She can often be seen meditating in the Garden of Hope.

trait.name: Amorphous
entries: The assassin can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.

trait.name: Shadow Stealth
entries: While in dim light or darkness, the assassin can take the Hide action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Otherworldly Perception
entries: Amon Wayfinder can sense the presence of any creature within 30 feet of him that is {@condition invisible} or on the Ethereal Plane. He can pinpoint such a creature that is moving.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Amon Wayfinder can't be affected or detected by spells of 5th level or lower unless he wishes to be. he has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects. If Amon takes radiant or force damage, this ability is suppressed until the end of his next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Amon uses his Otherworldly Touch if available. He makes two Shadow Blade attacks.

action.name: Shadow Blade
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage. Unless the target is immune to necrotic damage, the target's Strength score is reduced by {@dice 1d4} each time it is hit by this attack. The target dies if its Strength is reduced to 0. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a short or long rest. If a non-evil humanoid dies from this attack, a shadow (see the Monster Manual) rises from the corpse {@dice 1d4} hours later.

action.name: Otherworldly Touch  {@recharge 5}
entries: Amon touches a creature and severs their connection to the weave, temporarily blocking them from casting magic until the end of their next turn. The target then makes a Constitution saving throw {@dc 21} taking {@damage 3d10} force damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. If this attack reduces a creature to 0 hit points, the effects are permanent on a failed Wisdom save {@dc 21}.

reaction.name: Magical Disruption
entries: When a creature casts a spell of 1st level or higher, Amon makes an Intelligence ability check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level, on a success he disrupts the spell and the effects of the spell are canceled. The caster then takes {@damage 3d10} force damage.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Fey Champion's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, spell attack +9). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The fey champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the fey champion to sleep.

trait.name: Chameleon Skin
entries: The fey champion has advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks made to hide.

trait.name: Sure-Footed
entries: The fey champion has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving throws made against effects that would knock it {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Freedom of Movement
entries: The fey champion ignores difficult terrain, and magical effects can't reduce its speed or cause it to be {@condition restrained}. It can spend 5 feet of movement to escape from nonmagical restraints or being {@condition grappled}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its shortsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Shortsword of the Feywild
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Shortbow of the Feywild
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 10 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Fey Champion adds a +6 to its AC against a single melee attack.

Fey Champions are mighty warriors who honed their fighting skills in the feywild. To elves and other fey who fight to protect themselves or even their homes, champions fight for the Feywild as a whole.

trait.name: Fiery Death and Rebirth
entries: When the faenix dies, it explodes. Each creature within 60-feet of it must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The fire ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't worn or carried.

The explosion destroys the faenix's body and leaves behind an egg-shaped seed that weighs 5 pounds. The seed is burningly cold, dealing 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage to any creature that touches it, though no more than once per round. The seed is immune to all damage, and after {@dice 2d6} days, it hatches a new faenix.

trait.name: Fire Form
entries: The faenix can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing. Any creature that touches the faenix or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. In addition, the faenix can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. The first time it enters a creature's space on a turn, that creature takes 5 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage. With a touch, the faenix can also ignite flammable objects that aren't worn or carried (no action required).

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The faenix doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: The faenix sheds bright light in a 60-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Feywild Flames
entries: The faenix ignores any damage resistances or immunity to fire damage.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The faenix has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the faenix to sleep.

trait.name: Cold Flames
entries: The faenix can replace its fire damage with cold damage if it so chooses.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The faenix makes two attacks: one with its beak and one with its fiery talons.

action.name: Beak
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) fire damage. If the target is a creature or a flammable object, it ignites. Until a creature takes an action to douse the fire, the target takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) fire damage.

The Faenix is an Elemental birthed from the Feywild, a response to the Elementals during the Planar War. The Faenix was a fierce weapon from the Feywild as its fire burned coldly. It is said that its fire could harm any creature, including those who were supposed to be naturally resistant to fire. Though it is indeed a powerful recreation of the Elemental Phoenix, it is not a perfect replica.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Siren's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: Siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Siren has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) psychic damage while the target is {@condition charmed}.

action.name: Stupefying Touch
entries: Siren touches one creature she can see within 5 feet of her. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 16} Intelligence saving throw or take 25 ({@damage 6d6 + 4}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the start of Siren's next turn.

action.name: Luring Song
entries: The siren sings a magical melody. Every humanoid and giant within 300 feet of the siren that can hear the song must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition charmed} until the song ends. The siren must take a bonus action on its subsequent turns to continue singing. It can stop singing at any time. The song ends if the siren is {@condition incapacitated}.

While {@condition charmed} by the siren, a target is {@condition incapacitated} and ignores the songs of other siren. If the {@condition charmed} target is more than 5 feet away from the siren, the target must move on its turn toward the siren by the most direct route, trying to get within 5 feet. It doesn't avoid opportunity attacks, but before moving into damaging terrain, such as lava or a pit, and whenever it takes damage from a source other than the siren, the target can repeat the saving throw. A {@condition charmed} target can also repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns. If the saving throw is successful, the effect ends on it.
A target that successfully saves is immune to this siren's song for the next 24 hours.
Originally, sirens were what are now known as the harpies. As time went on, the depiction of the sirens evolved into the fey we now know them as.

Sirens are fey that are spiteful toward mankind. Their beauty and lustful singing can enchant the hearts of even the strongest men and lure them to the Siren, similarly as the harpies do. When their prey are lured in to their lair, they devour those who are foolish and weak enough to fall for their enchantments. Few return with their lives to tell the tale, and fewer return claiming they had slain the creature.

monster.name: Winter Walker
languages: Understands Sylvan but does not speak it

trait.name: Freezing Aura
