As an action, The Traveling Merchant can make an attack action as normal, but with one or multiple attacks he rips open rifts into other planes. Each of these rifts operate as per the Gate spell, and can lead to any plane including the domains of Gods.

Each time a creature is hit with this dagger, a piece of their soul is damaged as well. A creature hit with this dagger cannot gain the benefits of any healing until they finish a long rest. In addition, a creature reduced to 0 hit points is instantly killed and their soul is destroyed. They cannot be resurrected by any means short of a {@spell wish} spell, and only if The Traveling Merchant allows it.
A deity or similar being slain by this dagger is destroyed permanently.

trait.name: Temporal Shift
entries: The Traveling Merchant adds his Charisma modifier to his AC.

trait.name: Divine Being
entries: The Traveling Merchant can't be surprised and can't be changed into another form against his will.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Traveling Merchant doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Traveling Merchant uses his Divine Presence and Temporal Shatter if its available, he then makes five attacks.

action.name: Divine Presence
entries: Each creature within 120 ft of The Traveling Merchant must make a {@dc 42} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws made against The Traveling Merchant and in addition, they cannot gain advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws against The Traveling Merchant. These effects end when they stay out of range of this effect for more than 10 minutes. On a successful save, they are immune to this effect for the next hour. If they fail the saving throw by 10 or more, attack rolls that are less than a 20 on the {@dice d20} automatically miss, dealing no damage. Saving throws and ability checks that are less than a 20 on the {@dice d20} automatically fail. A creature can repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

action.name: Reality Breaker
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 39} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 600/1200 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d4 + 12}) piercing damage in melee, or 22 ({@damage 4d4 + 12}) piercing damage at range, plus 34 ({@damage 4d10 + 12}) force damage.

action.name: Temporal Shatter {@recharge 5}
entries: The Traveling Merchant reaches into the mind of one creature he can see and wanders through their memories. He then alters the events that took place, or even removes them entirely. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 42} or take {@damage 24d12} force damage and completely forgets that memory for 24 hours, or permanently. (The Traveling Merchant's choice.) On a success, the target only takes half damage and retains the memory, though it appears fuzzy for 24 hours.
For each memory lost in this way, the creature's level (or CR) is reduced by 1. If their level (or CR) is reduced to 0, they die.

action.name: Perfect Mimic
entries: The Traveling Merchant creates any number of perfect illusions of himself in unoccupied spaces he can see that last for 1 hour. He may use a bonus action to exert precise control over the illusions, otherwise they imitate his movements perfectly. He can cast spells or attack as though he were in the illusions place. These illusions appear in the minds of each creature and even fools truesight.

action.name: Alter Reality {@recharge 5}
entries: The deity can duplicate any spell of 12th level or lower as an action. The duplicated spell has no material or XP components, and the DC of its saving throw (if one is allowed) is 42. The deity also can duplicate a spell with any metamagic feat (so long as the metamagic feat is available to characters of 20th level or lower). The deity can render a magical or supernatural effect permanent. The deity can undo any magical or supernatural effect. The deity can create temporary, nonmagical objects. This works like the Create Object ability, except that the items last one day per rank. The deity also can create permanent nonmagical objects as if using the Create Object ability. The deity can create temporary magic items or creatures. The deity can reshape a landscape, creating any type of terrain the deity can imagine.
There are also other effects that can take place by the DM's discretion.

action.name: Replicate Divinity {@recharge}
entries: The Traveling Merchant can replicate any God or other Divine being's abilities. Their effects and action cost apply as normal, any ability that requires a saving throw has a save DC of 42.

reaction.name: Timestop {@recharge}
entries: When The Traveling Merchant is hit with an attack, prior to being hit he can use his reaction to cast {@spell time stop}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Traveling Merchant makes a Reality Breaker attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Traveling Merchant can teleport to an unoccupied space within half his fly speed.

legendary.name: Innate Spellcasting
entries: The Traveling Merchant casts a spell.

legendary.name: Regenerate
entries: The Traveling Merchant regenerates 150 hit points.

legendary.name: Temporal Curse (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Traveling Merchant curses one creature he can see. The creature must make a {@dc 42} Wisdom saving throw, or be shackled by the chains of time.
The creature is {@condition incapacitated}, their movement speed is 0, and they automatically fail saving throws. Attack rolls have advantage and each attack that hits is considered a critical hit.

This effect ends at the end of the creature's next turns. After which, for the next minute the creature's speed is cut in half and they can only make one weapon attack per turn. They also can only take an action or bonus action, not both and lose their reactions.

legendary.name: Rewrite (Costs 4 Actions)
entries: The Traveling Merchant forces one creature he can see to reroll one roll (attack, save, damage, etc.) with disadvantage or advantage, The Traveling Merchant’s choice. The new roll replaces the previous roll, reshaping reality to accommodate the change.
"Time is irrelevant to those who are not bound by it, and yet you mortals yearn for it. I envy those who can run out of time."
An endless wanderer throughout space and time, a creature not bound by the laws of mortals or gods. He is supposedly the being that represents time, or perhaps even the concept of it.

His travels allow him to gain an assortment of items from throughout the multiverse and throughout all of time, if it has existed he can get his palms on it. While he could learn whatever he wants at any given time, he prefers to take his time learning about adventurers, learning through mere conversation instead.
He rewards adventurers with interesting tales with magical items, though the items in question are random.

monster.name: Zehir, God of Darkness and Snakes

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: Zehir can innately cast the following spell, his spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 25}):

trait.name: Discorporation
entries: When Zehir drops to 0 hit points or dies, her body is destroyed but her essence travels back to her domain in the Towers of Night, and she is unable to take physical form for a time.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If Zehir fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless she wishes to be affected, Zehir is immune to spells of 6th level or lower. She has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Zehir's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: Zehir regains 30 hit points at the start of her turn.

trait.name: Ethereal Jaunt
entries: As a bonus action, Zehir can magically shift from the Material Plane to the Ethereal Plane, or vice versa.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Zehir doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: Zehir is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The Zehir knows if it hears a lie.

trait.name: Fear Aura
entries: Any creature hostile to the Zehir that starts its turn within 20 feet of the Zehir must make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw, unless the Zehir is {@condition incapacitated}. On a failed save, the creature is {@condition frightened} until the start of its next turn. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the Zehir's Fear Aura for the next 24 hours.

trait.name: Divine Might
entries: A greater god's attacks and effects ignore the resistances and immunities of creatures CR 25 and below. A greater god's attacks and effects targeting creatures of CR 26-35 ignore resistances and treat immunities as resistance (condition immunities provide advantage in lieu of immunity)

trait.name: Divine Spellcasting
entries: Zehir knows all spells available to clerics, sorcerers, and warlocks and can cast each three times per day at 9th level. Zehir can cast additional spells as indicated for greater gods and as noted bellow in innate spellcasting.

trait.name: Shroud of the Serpents (Mythic Trait, recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: When Zehir falls to 0 hit points, he doesn't fall {@condition unconscious} or die, he instead regains 800 hit points and summons {@dice 4d8 + 4} Couatls. He then envelops the current plane into magical darkness. This magical darkness cannot be dispelled by any means short of a wish spell cast by a deity or Divine Intervention. While within this darkness, creatures other than Zehir and his couatls cannot receive the benefits of healing.
If Zehir uses this trait in his domain, he can be killed permanently.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Zehir can use his Divine Presence. He then makes three attacks: two with his bite and one with his tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 4d12 + 12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 25 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 4d8 + 12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Divine Presence
entries: Each creature within 120 ft of Zehir must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they have disadvantage on attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws made against Zehir and in addition they cannot gain advantage on attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws against Zehir. These effects end when they stay out of range of this effect for more than 10 minutes. On a successful save, they are immune to this effect for the next hour. If they fail the saving throw by 10 or more, attack rolls that are less than a 20 on the {@dice d20} automatically miss, dealing no damage. Saving throws and ability checks that are less than a 20 on the {@dice d20} automatically fail. A creature can repeat their save at the end of each of their turns.

legendary.name: Divine Regeneration
entries: Zehir regains 50 hit points.

legendary.name: Serpentine's Ferocity
entries: Zehir makes one bite attack and one tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Zehir moves up to half its movement without provoking attacks of opportunity.

legendary.name: Eternal Darkness (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Zehir casts maddening darkness, centered on itself. This darkness covers the entirety of Zehir's domain if he is in it.

mythicHeader: If Zehir's mythic trait is active, for the next hour he can use the following as Legendary Actions:

mythic.name: Absorb Couatl
entries: Zehir can kill one of his couatls to regain hit points equal to the current hit points the target couatl was at currently.

mythic.name: Swarming Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Zehir makes one bite attack, then each of his couatls makes a bite attack.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the tarrasque fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The tarrasque has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Reflective Carapace
entries: Any time the tarrasque is targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 1 to 5, the tarrasque is unaffected. On a 6, the tarrasque is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the tarrasque, turning the caster into the target.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The tarrasque deals double damage to objects and structures.

trait.name: Unbreakable Body
entries: The tarrasque reduces all damage dealt to it by 12. This reduction is done before resistances and other reductions are applied.

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: A destroyed tarrasque gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. Only through the means of a wish spell or divine intervention can prevent the tarrasque's rejuvenation.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The tarrasque regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn.The tarrasque dies only if it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the tarrasque can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The tarrasque can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes five attacks: one with its bite, two with its claws, one with its horns, and one with its tail. It can use its Swallow instead of its bite. It can also use a spike attack instead of a horn attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 4d12 + 12}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained}, and the tarrasque can't bite another target.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d8 + 12}) slashing damage.

action.name: Horns
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d10 + 12}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 21} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d6 + 12}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Spike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 120/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the tarrasque's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 19} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the tarrasque is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the tarrasque's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Swallow
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack against a Large or smaller creature it is grappling. If the attack hits, the target takes the bite's damage, the target is swallowed, and the grapple ends. While swallowed, the creature is {@condition blinded} and {@condition restrained}, it has total cover against attacks and other effects outside the tarrasque, and it takes 56 ({@damage 16d6}) acid damage at the start of each of the tarrasque's turns.

If the tarrasque takes 60 damage or more on a single turn from a creature inside it, the tarrasque must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw at the end of that turn or regurgitate all swallowed creatures, which fall {@condition prone} in a space within 10 feet of the tarrasque. If the tarrasque dies, a swallowed creature is no longer {@condition restrained} by it and can escape from the corpse by using 30 feet of movement, exiting {@condition prone}.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The tarrasque makes one claw attack or tail attack.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The tarrasque moves up to half its speed.

legendary.name: Chomp (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The tarrasque makes one bite attack or uses its Swallow.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Slumber's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). He can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Confusing Gaze
entries: When a creature starts its turn within 30 feet of the umber hulk and is able to see the umber hulk's eyes, the umber hulk can magically force it to make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, unless the umber hulk is {@condition incapacitated}.

On a failed saving throw, the creature can't take reactions until the start of its next turn and rolls a {@dice d8} to determine what it does during that turn. On a 1 to 4, the creature does nothing. On a 5 or 6, the creature takes no action but uses all its movement to move in a random direction. On a 7 or 8, the creature makes one melee attack against a random creature, or it does nothing if no creature is within reach.

Unless surprised, a creature can avert its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. If the creature does so, it can't see the umber hulk until the start of its next turn, when it can avert its eyes again. If the creature looks at the umber hulk in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

trait.name: Tunneler
entries: The umber hulk can burrow through solid rock at half its burrowing speed and leaves a 5 foot-wide, 8-foot-high tunnel in its wake.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Slumber has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Slumber's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Sense Magic
entries: Slumber senses magic within 120 feet of it at will. This trait otherwise works like the detect magic spell but isn't itself magical

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The umber hulk makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its mandibles. Alternatively, the umber hulk can replace one of its claw attacks to cast a spell.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Mandibles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 4d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

Slumber is an Umber Hulk that has grown adept with various enchantment magics, even going as far as casting some of these spells at will. Slumber doesn't particularly hunt every living creature for food, in fact he prefers to eat other monstrosities that lives down in the Underdark, as opposed to their typical diets of humanoids. He goes scavenging for various minerals and precious gems.

entries.name: Devious Delvers
entries: Umber hulks can burrow through solid rock, forming new tunnels in their wake. The steel-hard chitin of its body can withstand the cave-ins, tunnel collapses, and rock falls that commonly follow it.

Burrowing into the wall of a cavern or passageway, an umber hulk lies in wait for creatures to pass by on the other side, its hair-like feelers sensing any movement around it. When it explodes out in a shower of earth and rock, its unsuspecting quarry turns to face the oncoming threat-and is entranced by the umber hulk's bewildering eyes, forced to stand helpless as its mandibles snap shut.

entries.name: Mind Scrambler
entries: Many survivors of an umber hulk encounter recollect little about the attack, because the monster's confusing gaze scrambles their memory of the event. Those who have fought and killed umber hulks recognize the signs. For other denizens of the Underdark, grisly tales of vanished explorers and wanton destruction speak of an unknown foe. Umber hulks take on supernatural status in these harrowing stories, many of which convey the same warning: once an umber hulk has been spotted, it is already too late to escape it.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Warren Malqir reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, Warren Malqir can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, Warren Malqir can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the Warren Malqir is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the Warren Malqir instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Great Katana
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Warren has trained his entire life to guard his home, Port Cattamoly. One day, he failed his people and the port was destroyed. He returned to his training after being rescued and trained in a dimension where time flowed quicker.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Krovis is a 10th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The Champion has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d8 + 9}) slashing damage, or 14 ({@damage 1d10 + 9}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) damage.

Korvis Maxwell is a young prince from a faraway land. He has come to pay respects to the great hero Erikku Blade during his wedding day, but seems to be stuck on Ishland since the incident in Port Cattamoly happened, and the ports in Western Ishland have closed.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eldak is a 20th-level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 21}, {@hit 13} to hit with spell attacks) He can cast {@spell burning hands} and {@spell continual flame} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons (Solar)
entries: Eldak Gladomain's weapon attacks are magical. When Eldak Gladomain hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of Eldak Gladomain's turns, each creature within 5 feet of him takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches Eldak Gladomain or hits him with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Eldak Gladomain doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when he flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: Eldak Gladomain sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Eldak Gladomain fails a saving throw, he can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Eldak Gladomain's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Eldak makes three attacks using his Fiery Talons.

action.name: Fiery Talons
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) fire damage, plus 32 ({@damage 6d8 + 5}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Blessing of the Phoenix
entries: Eldak regains an expended spell slot.

legendary.name: Flames of the Phoenix
entries: Eldak uses his fiery talons.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: Eldak moves half of his flying speed.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Eldak casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.
Eldak Gladomain is a powerful Aasimar that has ascended past his mortal form, and has evolved into a Solar. He rules the Floating City of Angels with his awesome power, mostly unquestioned.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Eilcaryn is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks) He can cast {@spell cure wounds} and {@spell continual flame} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Angelic Weapons (Solar)
entries: Eilcaryn's weapon attacks are magical. When Eilcaryn hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 6d8} radiant damage.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Eilcaryn doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when she flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Illumination
entries: Eilcaryn sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Eilcaryn fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: Eilcaryn's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Eilcaryn makes three attacks using her angelic longsword.

action.name: Angelic Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d8 + 7}) slashing damage, or 12 ({@damage 1d10 + 7}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus 34 ({@damage 6d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Fly
entries: Eilcaryn moves half of his flying speed.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Eilcaryn casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Eilcaryn Gladomain is the queen of the Floating City of Angels. She is kind and passionate, unlike her husband who is ruling and power driven. She supposedly married Eldak Gladomain to keep him in check.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The githzerai's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 9} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

trait.name: Psychic Defense
entries: While esk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Esk makes three unarmed strikes.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage.

action.name: Temporal Strike {@recharge}
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 52 ({@damage 8d12}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or move 1 round forward in time. A target moved forward in time vanishes for the duration. When the effect ends, the target reappears in the space it left or in an unoccupied space nearest to that space if it's occupied.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Lia is a 20th-level spellcaster. Her spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit with spell attacks) She can cast {@spell cure wounds} and {@spell prayer of healing} at will and has the following spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: Lia has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Lia fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Royal Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 15 ({@damage 2d8}) radiant damage.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell
entries: Lia casts a spell of 3rd level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

legendary.name: Cast a spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Lia casts a spell of 6th level or lower with a casting time of 1 action.

legendary.name: Healing Halo (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Lia creates a magical halo that she uses to heal nearby creatures. Creatures within 60 ft of her restores {@dice 10d10} hit points and gains 10 temporary hit points.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

Lia Elvenwood is the current ruling queen of the wood elves. She has been ruling for roughly the past 1500 years and has been alive for over 2000 years. It is said that she has immortality as she is not of druidic origins, though she has made excellent relationships with the nearby druids.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Royal Knight's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Royal Knight's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The half-dragon has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the half-dragon hits with it (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The half-dragon makes three melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d12 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft. and range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h} ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage, or ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage if used with two hands to make a melee attack.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a Medium or smaller creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The half-dragon exhales fire in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 52 ({@damage 15d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The half-dragon adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the half-dragon must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Time Guardian's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 24}, {@hit 16} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the Time Guardian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The Time Guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Temporal Awareness
entries: The Time Guardian adds its Charisma modifier to its initiative.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The guardian of time can't be affected or detected by spells of 6th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Time Guardian makes four attacks.

action.name: Mace of Temporal Disruption
entries: {@atk mw} automatic hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d6 + 10}) bludgeoning damage and 40 force damage, and the target makes a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24} or is {@condition incapacitated} and their movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Temporal Lock {@recharge 5}
entries: The Time Guardian chooses a creature within 120 ft of it. That creature must make a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24} or is {@condition incapacitated} and their movement speed is reduced to 0 for 1 minute. A {@spell greater restoration} or {@spell dispel magic} spell cast at 6th level or higher can end this effect.

action.name: Temporal Travel
entries: The Guardian of Time teleports to a space within 1 mile.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Time Guardian makes one attack.

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: The Guardian of Time teleports to an unoccupied space within 300 ft.

legendary.name: True Foresight (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The next weapon attack automatically misses the Guardian of Time. Alternatively, The Guardian of Time automatically succeeds its next saving throw.

legendary.name: Inevitable Fate (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The Guardian of Time chooses one creature it can see within 60 ft of it. That target makes a Wisdom saving throw {@dc 24}. On a failed save, they are reduced to 0 hit points. On a success, they take {@damage 10d10} force damage and are {@condition stunned} until the end of the Guardian of Time's next turn.

trait.name: Tandem Tactician
entries: Richie can use the help action as a bonus action.

When he uses the Help action to aid an ally in attacking a creature, increase the range of the Help action by 10 feet. Additionally, you can help two allies targeting the same creature within range when you use the Help action this way.

trait.name: Quick Tinkerer
entries: Richie can use an artisans tool as a bonus action to repair objects retaining to that tool. For the purposes of restoring hit points to objects or constructs, they regain {@dice 3d10} hit points.

trait.name: Magitech Energy: (200/200)
entries: Richie can use his Magitech Energy in the following ways as a bonus action:
2 Points: Use the dodge action, stabilize a dying ally, or make a single weapon attack using a Magitech Weapon.
5 Points: Add {@damage 1d10} force damage to a weapon attack made with a magitech weapon or switch gear modes.
10 Points: Generate a powerful Magitech Gadget using your automatic workstation. Choose either Elemental Magnus, Healing Doughnut, or Huge Impactinator 9000.
20 Points: Release outward a powerful energy pulse centered on himself, knocking medium creatures back 5 ft and dealing {@damage 3d10} force damage.

action.name: Magitech Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 1d10 + 10}) force damage.

action.name: Magitech Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) radiant damage, plus 6 ({@damage 1d10}) radiant damage.

action.name: Elemental Magnus
entries: You hurl a grenade filled with chaotic energy at space within 60 feet. Each creature takes {@damage 10d8} damage. Use the first {@dice d8}. The number rolled on that die determines the attack's damage type. (1. Acid, 2. Cold, 3. Fire, 4. Force, 5. Lightning, 6. Poison, 7. Psychic, 8. Thunder)

action.name: Healing Doughnut
entries: You release outward a band of healing energy that disperses wildly. Each creature within 30 ft of you regains {@dice 5d8 + 7} hit points.

action.name: Huge Impactinator 9000
entries: You hurl a giant fist with rockets propelling it forward at high speeds. It rushes forward in a 200 ft long and 5 ft wide straight line. Each creature and object within range takes {@dice 3d10 + 7} points of bludgeoning damage and an additional {@damage 1d10} force damage for every 10 ft the fist traveled. The fist can also go through walls as tough as stone and creates a 5 ft by 5ft hole where it passed through, but travels at half it's normal distance for each wall it passes through.

monster.name: Huge Universal Golem Assistant

immune.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the golem is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The golem makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Arm Cannon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 16} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Sword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Poison Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The golem exhales poisonous gas in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 19} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 5d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Thyrogog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the thyrogog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the thyrogog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Thyrogog has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Thyrogog hits with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thyrogog makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shovel
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Shotgun
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 30/90 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Bertha Trimorg has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Bertha adds a +2 to her AC for this attack.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) slashing damage, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The alexandria guard has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Alexandria Guard makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Indomitable (2/Day)
entries: The champion rerolls a failed saving throw.

trait.name: Second Wind (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: As a bonus action, the champion can regain 20 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The champion makes three attacks with its greatsword or its shortbow.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) slashing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage if the champion has more than half of its total hit points remaining.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 15 feet (included in its speed).

trait.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: When the monk hits with a melee weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 14} or be {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows (3/Day)
entries: The monk can make two additional Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action.

trait.name: Patient Defense (2/Day)
entries: The monk takes the dodge action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The monk's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: The monk reduces all fall damage by 40 points.

trait.name: Agile Parry
entries: Whenever the monk makes a melee weapon attack with their spear, they add a +2 to their AC.

trait.name: Crusher
entries: When the monk scores a critical hit with their unarmed strike, they have advantage on all weapon attacks until the end of its turn.
In addition, whenever they hit a creature no larger than itself with an unarmed strike, they can move that creature 5 ft.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, or 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The monk adds 2 to its AC against one melee or ranged weapon attack that would hit it. To do so, the monk must see the attacker.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: If the monk is hit with a ranged weapon attack, they can reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10 + 12}. If they reduce it to zero, they can make a ranged attack using that ammunition at a range of 20/60.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The enchanter is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Alice has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the alice to sleep.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Instinctive Charm (Recharges after the Enchanter Casts an Enchantment Spell of 1st level or Higher)
entries: The enchanter tries to magically divert an attack made against it, provided that the attacker is within 30 feet of it and visible to it. The enchanter must decide to do so before the attack hits or misses.

The attacker must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the attacker targets the creature closest to it, other than the enchanter or itself. If multiple creatures are closest, the attacker chooses which one to target.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Noble Knight's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}). They can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The royal elven knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the royal elven knight to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee or ranged attacks.

action.name: Elven Longsword +1
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow +1
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: While the monk is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, its walking speed increases by 10 feet (included in its speed).

trait.name: Stunning Strike (1/Day)
entries: When the monk hits with a melee weapon attack, they can force the creature to make a Constitution saving throw {@dc 13} or be {@condition stunned}.

trait.name: Flurry of Blows (2/Day)
entries: The monk can make two additional Unarmed Strikes as a bonus action.

trait.name: Patient Defense (2/Day)
entries: The monk takes the dodge action as a bonus action.

trait.name: Slow Fall
entries: The monk reduces all fall damage by 25 points.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The monk has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the petra to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The monk makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missiles
entries: If the monk is hit with a ranged weapon attack, they can reduce the damage by {@dice 1d10 + 9}. If they reduce it to zero, they can make a ranged attack using that ammunition at a range of 20/60.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The archmage is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 20}, {@hit 12} to hit with spell attacks). The archmage can cast {@spell gift of alacrity|EGW} and {@spell fortune's favor|EGW} at will and has the following wizard spells prepared:
footerEntries: *The archmage casts these spells on itself before combat.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The archmage has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Kyo Osamu has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the kyo osamu to sleep.

action.name: Elven Longsword +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) slashing damage, or ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) slashing damage if used with both hands, plus ({@damage 2d12}) force damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

monster.name: Naamah, The Pleasant Queen

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Exploitation of the Debtors
entries: As a bonus action, the angel targets a creature {@condition charmed} by it that it can see within 30 feet of it. The angel deals 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage to the target, and the angel gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Naamah doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Fallen Angelic Weapons
entries: Naamaah's weapon attacks are magical. When she Naamaah hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Naamaah knows if she hears a lie.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If Naamaah is flying and dives at least 30 feet. straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 6 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to the target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Naamaah fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lustful Desires (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Naamah is reduced to 0 hit points, she regains 160 hit points and springs back to her feet with a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature of Naamah's choice within 30 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw, or the creature takes 24 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage and is {@condition charmed} until the end of Naamah's turn.
Afterwards, for the next hour her walking speed increases by 10 feet and her fly speed increases by 30 feet and her Fallen Angelic Weapons increases by {@dice 1d8}.

trait.name: Aura of Lust
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the succubus at the start of each of their turns makes a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition charmed} and take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. On a success, they are not {@condition charmed} and takes no damage. A {@condition charmed} creature makes attacks at the succubus at disadvantage.

trait.name: Special Equipment; Spear of Lustful Desires
entries: This magical spear brings out the most inner lustful thoughts and desires of a creature on hit. A creature hit with this magic weapon can only suffer non-lethal damage. In addition, they must pass a {@dc 17} Wisdom Saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by its wielder. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition incapacitated} lusting over its wielder. A {@condition charmed} creature repeats its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 63 ({@damage 10d10 + 8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 25 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spear of Lustful Desires
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) piercing damage, plus 25 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Lustful Binding
entries: Naamah chooses one humanoid that she can see within 30 feet. She uses her Charm on the target, even if the target had passed its save against it (a creature who has succeeded once before must make the save again, becoming {@condition charmed} as normal on a failure, after the 3rd save it becomes immune to this legendary action).

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Naamah magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Namaah emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Naamah's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

mythic.name: Lustful Chain
entries: Naamah binds a creature to her lustful desires. She chooses a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. Until the end of her next turn, that creature is {@condition charmed}.

mythic.name: Unbound Desires (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Naamah suppresses any spells, magical effects, or magic items within 30 feet of her granting creatures immunity to being {@condition charmed} for the next minute.

mythicHeader: If Naamah's mythic trait is active, she can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Hearts of the Kraken.

spellcasting.name: Blood Magic
headerEntries: Captain Blood hair can cast magic through her innate blood magic. Each time she casts a spell, she takes 1d8 damage per level of the spell. Her spellcasting ability is Wisdom (Save {@dc 18}, +10 to hit.) and she can cast the following spells without requiring material components:

trait.name: Flourish
entries: The captain adds its Charisma modifier to the damage roll for its longsword attacks (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The captain has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, Captain Bloodhair deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of Captain Bloodhair that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the Captain Bloodhair doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Regeneration (Vampire)
entries: Captain Bloodhair regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Captain Bloodhair takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Shapechanger (Vampire)
entries: If Captain Bloodhair isn't in sunlight or running water, she can use her action to polymorph into a Tiny bat or a Medium cloud of mist, or back into its true form. While in bat form, she can't speak, her walking speed is 5 feet, and she has a flying speed of 30 feet. Its statistics, other than her size and speed, are unchanged. Anything she is wearing transforms with her. She reverts to her true form if she dies. While in mist form, she can't take any actions, speak, or manipulate objects. She is weightless, has a flying speed of 20 feet, can hover, and can enter a hostile creature's space and stop there. In addition, if air can pass through a space, the mist can do so without squeezing, and she can't pass through water. She has advantage on Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution saving throws, and she is immune to all nonmagical damage, except the damage it takes from sunlight.

trait.name: Vampire Weakness (Vampire)
entries: Captain Bloodhair has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance}. She can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water}. She takes 20 acid damage if it ends its turn in running water.

{@i Stake to the Heart}. If a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into her heart while she is {@condition incapacitated} in her resting place, she is {@condition paralyzed} until the stake is removed.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity}. She takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, she has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Misty Escape (Vampire)
entries: When she drops to 0 hit points outside her resting place, the captain transforms into a cloud of mist (as in the Shapechanger trait) instead of falling {@condition unconscious}, provided that she isn't in sunlight or running water. If she can't transform, she is destroyed.

While she has 0 hit points in mist form, she can't revert to her true form, and she must reach its resting place within 2 hours or be destroyed. Once in her resting place, she reverts to her true form. She is then {@condition paralyzed} until she regains at least 1 hit point. After spending 1 hour in her resting place with 0 hit points, she regains 1 hit point.

trait.name: Greater Vampire
entries: Captain Bloodhair can subside one of her Vampire Weaknesses as an action on her turn. She can only subside one weakness at a time.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Captain Bloodhair fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Blood Forge
entries: When Captain Bloodhair rolls initiative, or as a bonus action on her turn, she can spend {@dice 1d8} hit points to create a weapon made of blood. This weapon lasts for 1 hour and deals {@damage 1d8} necrotic damage. The weapon can be versatile, finesse, or both. She can spend an additional {@dice 1d8} hit points to give the weapon an additional damage die.

trait.name: Blood Bath (3/day)
entries: As a bonus action on her turn, Captain Bloodhair can enter a Blood Bath. While in her Blood Bath she has the following effects:
She takes 2 points of damage at the start of her turn.
She has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
She has advantage on Constitution and Wisdom saving throws.

trait.name: Scorching Blood
entries: Whenever Captain Bloodhair takes any form of slashing, piercing, or necrotic damage, each creature within 5 ft of her takes 5 acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes two attacks.

action.name: Blood Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) necrotic damage, or 18 ({@damage 2d10 + 8}) necrotic damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Revolver (reload 6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Blood Beam (three rays)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) necrotic damage. You can spend {@dice 1d8} hit points to increase the damage of this beam by {@dice 1d10}.

action.name: Bleeding Ray (three rays)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120/120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

reaction.name: Blood Barrier
entries: As a reaction, Captain Bloodhair can spend {@dice 2d8} hit points to add a +5 to her AC and take no damage from the magic missile spell.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Captain Bloodhair moves up to her speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Quickshot
entries: Captain Bloodhair makes a Revolver attack.

legendary.name: Cast a Spell (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Captain Bloodhair casts one of her Blood Magic spells.

legendary.name: Blood Vortex (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: By spending {@dice 6d8} hit points, Captain Bloodhair creates a 5 ft tall and 30 ft radius cylinder that resembles a swirling vortex of blood. Each creature within range makes a Strength saving throw ({@dc 18}) or take {@damage 6d10} necrotic damage and are dragged 10 ft closer to the center of the vortex on a failed save, or half as much damage on a success and they are not dragged.
Pirate captains spend their lives at sea, earning and keeping command through blood and daring. A captain's impressive sword work and biting words inspire both confidence and fear in a ship's crew.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Denise is a 10th level spellcaster. Charisma is her spellcasting abilitiy (Spell save {@dc 16}, +8 to hit) and has the following fate weaver spells prepared:

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The first mate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: Denise can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Inspiring Performance (1/long rest)
entries: Denise can spend 10 minutes performing by playing her lyre and singing a song. When she does so, she targets herself and four other creatures. Those creatures have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} for the next 8 hours. In addition, those creatures gains 10 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Elusive Jester
entries: When Denise makes a Charisma (Persuasion) or Charisma (Deception) check, she can treat a {@dice d20} roll of 9 or lower as a 10 by spending a fate die. When she does so, she then rolls that fate die and adds it to the total.

trait.name: Regeneration (Vampire Spawn)
entries: Denise regains 10 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If Denise takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of Denise's next turn.

trait.name: Vampire Weakness
entries: Denise has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance}. Denise can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water}. Denise takes 20 acid damage if she ends her turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart}. The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity}. The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The first mate makes two attacks with its longsword.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, the first mate can choose to deal no damage with the attack to disarm the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding on the ground.
These no-nonsense sailors are the trusted allies of a pirate ship's captain. Ex-soldiers and trained mercenaries often find employment as mates aboard pirate ships.

monster.name: Vampirate
languages: the languages it knew in life

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The vampire regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the vampire takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the vampire's next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The vampire can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Vampire Weaknesses
entries: The vampire has the following flaws:
{@i Forbiddance.} The vampire can't enter a residence without an invitation from one of the occupants.
{@i Harmed by Running Water.} The vampire takes 20 acid damage when it ends its turn in running water.
{@i Stake to the Heart.} The vampire is destroyed if a piercing weapon made of wood is driven into its heart while it is {@condition incapacitated} in its resting place.
{@i Sunlight Hypersensitivity.} The vampire takes 20 radiant damage when it starts its turn in sunlight. While in sunlight, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The vampire has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The vampire makes two attacks, only one of which can be a bite attack.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one willing creature, or a creature that is {@condition grappled} by the vampire, {@condition incapacitated}, or {@condition restrained}. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the necrotic damage taken, and the vampire regains hit points equal to that amount. The reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage. Instead of dealing damage, the vampire can grapple the target (escape {@dc 13}).

action.name: Revolver (reload 6)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

Awakened to an endless night, vampires hunger for the life they have lost and sate that hunger by drinking the blood of the living. Vampires abhor sunlight, for its touch burns them. They never cast shadows or reflections, and any vampire wishing to move unnoticed among the living keeps to the darkness and far from reflective surfaces.

entries.name: Dark Desires
entries: Whether or not a vampire retains any memories from its former life, its emotional attachments wither as once-pure feelings become twisted by undeath. Love turns into hungry obsession, while friendship becomes bitter jealousy. In place of emotion, vampires pursue physical symbols of what they crave, so that a vampire seeking love might fixate on a young beauty. A child might become an object of fascination for a vampire obsessed with youth and potential. Others surround themselves with art, books, or sinister items such as torture devices or trophies from creatures they have killed.

entries.name: Born from Death
entries: Most of a vampire's victims become vampire spawn-ravenous creatures with a vampire's hunger for blood, but under the control of the vampire that created them. If a true vampire allows a spawn to draw blood from its own body, the spawn transforms into a true vampire no longer under its master's control. Few vampires are willing to relinquish their control in this manner. Vampire spawn become free-willed when their creator dies.

entries.name: Chained to the Grave
entries: Every vampire remains bound to its coffin, crypt, or grave site, where it must rest by day. If a vampire didn't receive a formal burial, it must lie beneath a foot of earth at the place of its transition to undeath. A vampire can move its place of burial by transporting its coffin or a significant amount of grave dirt to another location. Some vampires set up multiple resting places this way.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: Neither a vampire nor a vampire spawn requires air.

entries.name: A Vampire's Lair
entries: A vampire chooses a grand yet defensible location for its lair, such as a castle, fortified manor, or walled abbey. It hides its coffin in an underground crypt or vault guarded by vampire spawn or other loyal creatures of the night.

entries.name: Player Characters as Vampires
entries: The game statistics of a player character transformed into a vampire spawn and then a vampire don't change, except that the character's Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution scores become 18 if they aren't higher. In addition, the character gains the vampire's damage resistances, {@sense darkvision}, traits, and actions. Attack and damage rolls for the vampire's attacks are based on Strength.

The save DC for Charm is 8 + the vampire's proficiency bonus + the vampire's Charisma modifier. The character's alignment becomes lawful evil, and the DM might take control of the character until the vampirism is reversed with a {@spell wish} spell or the character is killed and brought back to life.

entries.name: Strahd von Zarovich
entries: A brilliant thinker and capable warrior in life, Strahd von Zarovich fought in countless battles for his people. When war and killing finally stripped him of his youth and strength, he settled in the remote valley of Barovia and built a castle on a towering pinnacle, from which he could survey his lands. His brother Sergei came to live with him in Castle Ravenloft, becoming Strahd's adviser and constant companion.

In his brother, Strahd saw everything he had lost. Sergei was handsome and young, while Strahd had become old and scarred. Resentment colored their relationship, eventually turning into hatred. Strahd's beloved, Tatyana, spurned him for Sergei, whom she pledged to marry.

In a desperate attempt to win Tatyana's heart, Strahd forged a pact with dark powers that made him immortal. At the wedding of Sergei and Tatyana, he confronted his brother and killed him. Tatyana fled and flung herself from Ravenloft's walls. Strahd's guards, seeing him for a monster, shot him with arrows. But he did not die. He became a vampire-the first vampire, according to many sages.

In the centuries since his transformation, Strahd's lust for life and youth have only grown. He broods in his dark castle, cursing the living for stealing away what he lost, and never admitting his hand in the tragedy he created.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the minotaur moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a gore attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 22 ({@damage 5d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Labyrinthine Recall
entries: The minotaur can perfectly recall any path it has traveled.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the minotaur can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls it makes during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rampage
entries: When Thyrogog reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the thyrogog can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make another attack.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the thyrogog can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Brave
entries: Thyrogog has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when Thyrogog hits with it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Thyrogog makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}36 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 3d8 + 5}) slashing damage, or 21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) slashing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 14 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Vanea has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Vanea to sleep.

trait.name: Fey Step {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
