entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
Age: 220
Quite quick on her feet, and usually to herself to anyone but a special someone. Can be quite the prankster when you get to know her.
"I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide. The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it."
"Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them." (Chaotic)
"Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again."
"There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest."

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Carric is a 10th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC: 15, + 7 to hit with spell attacks.). He has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the knight to sleep.

trait.name: Martial Advantage
entries: Once per turn, the knight can deal an extra 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to a creature it hits with a weapon attack if that creature is within 5 feet of an ally of the knight that isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: When the knight hits a creature with a weapon attack, they can spend one of their spell slots to deal {@damage 2d8} radiant damage plus {@damage 1d8} radiant damage for each slot level above 1st. This extra damage deals an additional {@damage 1d8} damage against fiends and undead.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: While the knight is conscious, each creature within 20 ft of the knight adds a +3 bonus to their saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

Carric is one of the high expositors of the Cobalt Soul from Port Damali. His daughter had joined the Cobalt Soul in order to follow his legacy, but after a horrible accident the two haven't spoken in a long time. After hearing about his daughter's death, he traveled to Uthodurn to mourn her loss. It is here that he met the party of adventurers: Song, Belenas, and Malin.

monster.name: Naamah, The Pleasant Queen

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: Naamah's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}). She can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Telepathic Bond
entries: The fiend ignores the range restriction on its telepathy when communicating with a creature it has {@condition charmed}. The two don't even need to be on the same plane of existence.

trait.name: Shapechanger
entries: The fiend can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Without wings, the fiend loses its flying speed. Other than its size and speed, its statistics are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

trait.name: Exploitation of the Debtors
entries: As a bonus action, the angel targets a creature {@condition charmed} by it that it can see within 30 feet of it. The angel deals 11 ({@damage 2d10}) necrotic damage to the target, and the angel gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: Naamah doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

trait.name: Fallen Angelic Weapons
entries: Naamaah's weapon attacks are magical. When she Naamaah hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 5d8} necrotic damage.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: Naamaah knows if she hears a lie.

trait.name: Dive Attack
entries: If Naamaah is flying and dives at least 30 feet. straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 6 ({@damage 2d6}) damage to the target.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Naamaah fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Lustful Desires (Mythic Trait; Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: If Naamah is reduced to 0 hit points, she regains 160 hit points and springs back to her feet with a burst of necrotic energy. Each creature of Naamah's choice within 30 feet of her must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw, or the creature takes 24 ({@damage 6d8}) necrotic damage and is {@condition charmed} until the end of Naamah's turn.
Afterwards, for the next hour her walking speed increases by 10 feet and her fly speed increases by 30 feet and her Fallen Angelic Weapons increases by {@dice 1d8}.

trait.name: Aura of Lust
entries: Each creature within 30 feet of the succubus at the start of each of their turns makes a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, they are {@condition charmed} and take {@damage 2d6} psychic damage. On a success, they are not {@condition charmed} and takes no damage. A {@condition charmed} creature makes attacks at the succubus at disadvantage.

trait.name: Special Equipment; Spear of Lustful Desires
entries: This magical spear brings out the most inner lustful thoughts and desires of a creature on hit. A creature hit with this magic weapon can only suffer non-lethal damage. In addition, they must pass a {@dc 17} Wisdom Saving throw or become {@condition charmed} by its wielder. A creature {@condition charmed} in this way is {@condition incapacitated} lusting over its wielder. A {@condition charmed} creature repeats its saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Charm
entries: One humanoid the fiend can see within 30 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} for 1 day. The {@condition charmed} target obeys the fiend's verbal or telepathic commands. If the target suffers any harm or receives a suicidal command, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect on it ends, the target is immune to this fiend's Charm for the next 24 hours.
The fiend can have only one target {@condition charmed} at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

action.name: Draining Kiss
entries: The fiend kisses a creature {@condition charmed} by it or a willing creature. The target must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 63 ({@damage 10d10 + 8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The target's hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0.

action.name: Etherealness
entries: The fiend magically enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage, plus 25 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Spear of Lustful Desires
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 10}) piercing damage, plus 25 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Lustful Binding
entries: Naamah chooses one humanoid that she can see within 30 feet. She uses her Charm on the target, even if the target had passed its save against it (a creature who has succeeded once before must make the save again, becoming {@condition charmed} as normal on a failure, after the 3rd save it becomes immune to this legendary action).

legendary.name: Teleport
entries: Naamah magically teleports, along with any equipment she is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space she can see.

legendary.name: Searing Burst (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Namaah emits magical, divine energy. Each creature of her choice in a 10-foot radius must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

mythicHeader: If Naamah's mythic trait is active, she can use the options below as legendary actions for 1 hour after using Lustful Desires.

mythic.name: Lustful Chain
entries: Naamah binds a creature to her lustful desires. She chooses a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. Until the end of her next turn, that creature is {@condition charmed}.

mythic.name: Unbound Desires (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: Naamah suppresses any spells, magical effects, or magic items within 30 feet of her granting creatures immunity to being {@condition charmed} for the next minute.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The eladrin's innate spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During its first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The assassin deals an extra 14 ({@damage 2d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Vanea has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Vanea to sleep.

trait.name: Fey Step {@recharge 4}
entries: As a bonus action, the eladrin can teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes two shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage plus an additional {@damage 1d6} cold damage.
Age: 220
Quite quick on her feet, and usually to herself to anyone but a special someone. Can be quite the prankster when you get to know her.
"I am incredibly slow to trust. Those who seem the fairest often have the most to hide. The best way to get me to do something is to tell me I can't do it."
"Freedom. Chains are meant to be broken, as are those who would forge them." (Chaotic)
"Someone I loved died because of a mistake I made. That will never happen again."
"There's no room for caution in a life lived to the fullest."

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The warlock's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

trait.name: Limited Amphibiousness
entries: The warlock can breathe air and water, but it needs to be surfaced at least once every 4 hours to avoid suffocating.

trait.name: Shark Telepathy
entries: The warlock can magically command any shark within 120 feet of it, using a limited telepathy.

trait.name: Maddening Hexblade's Curse (1/rest)
entries: As a bonus action, Avantika chooses one creature she can see within 30 feet. The target is cursed for 1 minute. The curse ends early if the target dies, she dies, or if she is {@condition incapacitated}. Until the curse ends, she deals an extra 11 points of psychic damage to the target and her weapon attacks scores a critical on a 19-20. If the cursed target dies, Avantika regains 20 hit points.

trait.name: Devil's Sight
entries: Magical darkness doesn't impede Avantika's darkvision.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: Avantika has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put Avantika to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warlock makes two attacks.

action.name: +1 Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h} ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) force damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: Avantika adds a +2 to her AC.

reaction.name: Armor of Hexes
entries: If a cursed target hits Avantika with an attack, she can roll a {@dice d6}. On a 4 or higher, the attack misses, regardless of the roll.

The slumbering leviathan Uk'otoa preys on the fears and ambitions of humanoids that brave the depths of the Lucidian Ocean. Countless communities of sahuagin inhabit uncharted pockets of water along the Menagerie Coast, and the most ambitious among them often hear the call of the leviathan in their dreams, urging them to take his power and use it to achieve their bloodsoaked dreams.

trait.name: Flourish
entries: The captain adds its Charisma modifier to the damage roll for its longsword attacks (included in the attack).

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The captain has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The pirate captain has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the pirate captain can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes two attacks: one with its hand crossbow and one with its longsword.

action.name: Longsword +2
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 10}) slashing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow +2
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 11} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Shape Up, Ye Dog (2/Day)
entries: Whenever a friendly creature within 30 feet of the captain that can hear it misses with an attack, the captain can yell perilous threats to allow that creature to reroll the attack roll.

reaction.name: Stone's Endurance
entries: When he takes damage, The Plank King can roll a {@dice d12} and reduce the damage by an amount equal to the roll plus his constitution modifier.

Pirate captains spend their lives at sea, earning and keeping command through blood and daring. A captain's impressive sword work and biting words inspire both confidence and fear in a ship's crew. Sigurd "Snake Eyes" is the pirate captain who leads a gang of smugglers in The Sinister Secret of Saltmarsh.

trait.name: Cargo Hauler
entries: The bosun has advantage on Strength checks.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The bosun has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Light Hammer
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 2} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.
The bosun (or boatswain) is tasked with organizing the cargo and crew aboard a ship. Bosuns are capable fighters whose experience with hauling cargo and delivering beatings make them tough opponents.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The bandit has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the drow bandit to sleep.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The dillyu can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Friend of the Sea
entries: Using gestures and sounds, Dillyu can communicate simple ideas with any beast that has an innate swimming speed.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Trident
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d8}) slashing damage in melee, or 3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage at range, or 4 ({@damage 1d8}) piercing damage if used with both hands.

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The first mate has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The first mate makes two attacks with its longsword.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage, or 7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a creature, the first mate can choose to deal no damage with the attack to disarm the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or drop one item it is holding on the ground.

These no-nonsense sailors are the trusted allies of a pirate ship's captain. Ex-soldiers and trained mercenaries often find employment as mates aboard pirate ships. In The Sinister Secret of Saltmarsh, Bloody Bjorn serves as the first mate aboard Sea Ghost.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The deck wizard is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Sea Legs
entries: The deck wizard has advantage on ability checks and saving throws to resist being knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

These salt-encrusted practitioners of magic are at once learned and superstitious. The crews of pirate ships generally give their deck wizards a wide berth, as they magically step from place to place and unleash their briny magic against attackers.

Xaluud, a fallen king from his homeland long since dead. He once ruled over humans as a powerful Dragon. He started as a renowned king, powerful and kind. Eventually his power drove him mad, his mind not able to handle it.

trait.name: Death Throes
entries: When the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw, taking 70 ({@damage 20d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion ignites flammable objects in that area that aren't being worn or carried, and it destroys the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood's weapons.

trait.name: Blood Frenzy
entries: The Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood has advantage on melee attack rolls against any creature that doesn't have all its hit points.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Fire Absorption
entries: Whenever the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood is subjected to fire damage, it takes no damage and instead regains a number of hit points equal to the fire damage dealt.

trait.name: Fire Aura
entries: At the start of each of the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood's turns, each creature within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage, and flammable objects in the aura that aren't being worn or carried ignite. A creature that touches the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

trait.name: Fiendish Blessing
entries: The AC of the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood includes its Charisma bonus.

trait.name: Aggressive
entries: As a bonus action, the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point and isn't in sunlight or running water. If the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood takes radiant damage or damage from holy water, this trait doesn't function at the start of the Xaluud The Fallen Red Hood's next turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: Xaluud moves up to half its movement without provoking attacks of oppurtunity.

legendary.name: Rebuke the Weak
entries: Xaluud places a curse onto a creature, causing them to feel weak and useless. They have disadvantage on their next attack roll.

legendary.name: Fire Breath (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Xaluud uses his Fire Breath Weapon

reaction.name: Draconic Rebuke
entries: Xaluud points his finger to a creature that damaged him within 60 feet. That target makes a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@damage 8d10}) fire damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Xaluud makes three attacks with his Greatsword

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 18} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 10}) slashing damage, plus 24 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon exhales fire in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 25} Dexterity saving throw, taking 91 ({@damage 26d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Unholy Light {@recharge 5}
entries: Xaluud releases a bright blinding light that drains the life of nearby creatures. Each creature within 20 ft of Xaluud must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw, taking ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic and ({@damage 10d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is an 11th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Wonderous Magical Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

action.name: Wonderous Magical Revolver (reload after 6 shots)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 10} to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) piercing damage, plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) force damage.

variant.name: Familiars
entries: Any spellcaster that can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell (such as an archmage or mage) is likely to have a familiar. The familiar can be one of the creatures described in the spell (see the Player's Handbook) or some other Tiny monster, such as a {@creature crawling claw}, {@creature imp}, {@creature pseudodragon}, or {@creature quasit}.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Shady is attuned to a Belt of Fire Giant Strength, a gray Robe of the Archmagi, and a Ring of Invisibility.

Shady is a merchant who sells all kinds of magical items. Some may be cursed, some aren't, you never know what you could buy from this guy. He always seems to have just what you need though, it's almost scary.

When you purchase a magical item from Shady's shop, there is a 10% chance the item will be cursed. Roll a d10, on a 1 the item becomes cursed. The likelyhood of the item being cursed increases by an additional 10% for each rarity tier above common. In order for an item to be cursed, it must also require attunement and every cursed item dissallows a creature attuned with it from willingly ending their attunement and they have a strong desire to keep the item on their person at all times.
If the item is cursed, roll a d8 or choose one of the following curses:

rows: The first time you touch a gem or piece of jewelry while attuned to this item, the value of the gem or jewelry is reduced by half.
While attuned to this item, your movement speed is reduced by 5 ft.
While attuned to this item, you begin to feel less emotion toward most things. Your alignment becomes neutral.
While attuned to the item, you emit a sour stench noticeable from up to 10 feet away.
While attuned to this item, taking a short rest requires twice the amount of time for you.
While you are attuned to the item, your flaw is amplified in a way determined by the DM.
While you are attuned to the item, you cannot taste nor can you get intoxicated. You are also immune to being poisoned.
While you are attuned to the item, you have a permanent reduction to your AC. Your AC is reduced by 1 until your attunement ends.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Guided Strike (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest grants a +10 bonus to an attack roll made by itself or another creature within 30 feet of it. The priest can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

War priests worship deities of war and combat. They plan tactics, lead soldiers into battle, confront enemy spellcasters, and tend to casualties. A war priest might command an army or serve as a warlord's right hand on the battlefield.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following cleric spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

reaction.name: Guided Strike (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: The priest grants a +10 bonus to an attack roll made by itself or another creature within 30 feet of it. The priest can make this choice after the roll is made but before it hits or misses.

War priests worship deities of war and combat. They plan tactics, lead soldiers into battle, confront enemy spellcasters, and tend to casualties. A war priest might command an army or serve as a warlord's right hand on the battlefield.

monster.name: Starlight Companion
languages: and the languages of its creator

trait.name: Companion's Bond
entries: The Starlight Companion cannot be {@condition charmed} by creatures other than its summoner. The Starlight Companion has a number of hit points equal to the level of its summoner, plus its proficiency bonus, plus its Constitution modifier. Its AC is 12 plus its proficiency bonus.

trait.name: Companion's Tether
entries: The Starlight Companion can be no further than 60 ft away from its summoner, or it begins to lose hit points. It loses 5 hit points if it starts its turn more than 60 ft away from its summoner. If it is reduced to 0 hit points in this manner, it is destroyed. While the Starlight Companion is within 30 ft of its summoner, both the summoner and the companion regains 1 hit point, so long as one of them has half of their remaining hit points or less. Whenever a spell or magical effect that lasts longer than one round is cast on its Summoner, the Starlight Companion shares the same magical effect.

trait.name: Aura of Hope
entries: The Starlight Companion emits a shining aura of light that can restore ailments and bolster nearby creatures with bravery and hope. At the start of the Starlight Companion's turn, each creature it chooses within 10 ft of it gains temporary hit points equal to its proficiency bonus. At 6th level, while they are in this aura, until the end of that creature's next turn they have advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened} and when they regain hit points they regain the maximum possible result. The aura can also shine bright light out to a radius of 10 ft, and dim light for an additional 10 ft. At 10th level, if a creature within this aura has a disease or one of the following conditions: {@condition blinded}, {@condition deafened}, or {@condition poisoned}, the Starlight Companion can subside one of them while that creature remains within the aura. If that creature ever leaves the aura, the condition and its effects return as normal.

action.name: Bless (1/rest)
entries: The Starlight Companion casts {@spell bless} as a 1st level spell. Its summoner becomes an automatic target of the spell, and the other two targets must be creatures friendly to its summoner. Once this spell is cast in this way, it cannot be cast again until its summoner completes a short or long rest even if a new Starlight Companion is summoned. You gain an additional use of this action when you reach 6th, 10th, and 14th levels.

action.name: Starlight Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) radiant damage.

“You dare set foot in my court, desecrating this place we Fair Folk find sacred no matter what walk of life we choose. You will wish that your toes had never stepped here in the first place.” – Archfey Nuada the Silver-Handed

It is known that the fey are strange, miraculous beings, but their power is dwarfed by that of the Archfey. In the eyes of sylvan beings, none compare in their mastery of the arcane and of trickery. They keep grudges for what seems like eternity, and will not let up on the chase for something even if it means watching from a distance their prey weaken and diminish. Always with a other-worldly grace to them, they look similar to elves but have wings that take the form of either ones belonging to insects like dragonflys or birds. Some even have wings resembling those of dragons and demons.

For all of their power, they seldom travel out of the world of Faerie, and due to this they enlist Warlocks to serve them in whatever way they wish. Some seek ever-growing knowledge while others wish to spread mischief and chaos wherever they go. They grant great power: power that makes  their servants fear if they should ever fail their patron or even dare to go against their will.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Archfey is an 18th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The Archfey has the following spells prepared, from the Druid and Warlock spell lists. The Archfey can cast these spells without requiring material components.

trait.name: Otherworldly Spell Versatility {@recharge 5}
entries: If the Archfey so chooses, they can use a bonus action on their turn to exchange one spell they have prepared with another one from the Druid and Warlock spell lists.

trait.name: Tree Stride
entries: Once on their turn, the archfey can use 10 feet of movement to step magically into one living tree within reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

trait.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
entries: The archfey can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

trait.name: Superior Invisibility
entries: As a bonus action, the archfey can magically turn {@condition invisible} until its concentration ends (as if concentrating on a spell). Any equipment the archfey wears or carries is {@condition invisible} with it.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the archfey fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

legendary.name: Cantrip
entries: The Archfey casts a cantrip.

legendary.name: Conjure Fey (costs 2 Actions)
entries: As the Archfey, he can summon other Sylvan creatures to fight alongside him in combat or to aid in any myriad of tasks. The creatures he can summon include Blink Dogs, Satyrs, Green and Sea Hags, Faerie Dragons, Pixies, Sprites and Dryads. These summons have the same Charisma and Dexterity as the Archfey, while all other stats remain the same.

legendary.name: Reversal (costs 3 Actions)
entries: Until the Archfey’s next turn, all incoming attacks, spells, and magical effects have the chance to backfire and cause damage to the creature who initially targeted the Archfey. Roll a {@dice d100}: anything below a 50 backfires upon said creature and above 50 the attack carries through as normal. A backfired attack or effect makes the source of said attack or effect the centered target of it. If a saving throw is required, they must make it as if they were the target of the effect.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight is a 17th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Leadership (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: The knight can fill his sword with divine energy. Whenever he hits with a weapon attack, he can spend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. He can spend additional spell slots to increase the extra damage by {@dice 1d8} per slot level above 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d8}. Undead and Fiends take an additional {@dice 1d8}.

trait.name: Channel Divinity: Guided Strike (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: If the knight were to miss an attack, he can add a +10 to his roll.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the the sword of the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mobile Striker
entries: As long as the knight makes at least one melee weapon attack, they do not provoke opportunity attacks when they move.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes four greatsword attacks.

action.name: +2 Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d6 + 8}) slashing damage plus 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Sword {@recharge 5}
entries: The knight's sword is filled with a divine magical power that decimates everything in a 5ft wide 100 ft long line. Each creature in range must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw.  A creature takes 31 ({@damage 9d6}) slashing damage and 31 ({@damage 9d6}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The knight can retaliate at an immense speed. Whenever they are hit with an attack, they can make a single melee weapon attack against a creature within 5 ft of them.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Poisonous Bites
entries: A creature that is hit by the swarm of butterflies must make a dc 13 constitution saving throw or be {@condition poisoned} for 1 hour. If a creature spends their action doing nothing, at the end of their turn they can repeat their save, ending the condition on a success.

action.name: Bites
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 0 ft., one target in the swarm's space. {@h}10 ({@damage 4d4}) piercing damage, or 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

entries.name: The Nature of Swarms
entries: The swarms presented here aren't ordinary or benign assemblies of little creatures. They form as a result of some sinister or unwholesome influence. A vampire can summon swarms of bats and rats from the darkest corners of the night, while the very presence of a mummy lord can cause scarab beetles to boil up from the sand-filled depths of its tomb. A hag might have the power to turn swarms of ravens against her enemies, while a yuan-ti abomination might have swarms of poisonous snakes slithering in its wake. Even druids can't charm these swarms, and their aggressiveness is borderline unnatural.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Leadership (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: The knight can fill his sword with divine energy. Whenever he hits with a weapon attack, he can spend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. He can spend additional spell slots to increase the extra damage by {@dice 1d8} per slot level above 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d8}. Undead and Fiends take an additional {@dice 1d8}.

trait.name: Channel Divinity: Retribution of the Violent (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: If a creature other than the knight takes damage within 30 ft of them, the attacker takes an amount of radiant damage equal to the amount of damage they dealt.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (1/Day)
entries: If the the sword of the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the shield of the king is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Aura of Protection
entries: Each creature the knight chooses within 30 ft of them adds a +4 to their saving throws.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two longsword attacks and one shield bash attack.

action.name: +1 Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage plus 13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Shield (3/day)
entries: The knight's shield contains divine energy powerful enough to withstand the most devastating of attacks. You can release a protective barrier that veils over each creature within 30 ft of the knight that the knight chooses. Each of them gains {@dice 18d6} temporary hit points. While they have these temporary hit points, they have resistance to all damage and have advantage on all saving throws.

reaction.name: Protective Shield
entries: The knight can protect their allies very effectively. When a creature takes damage while within 30 ft of the knight, the knight can spend its reaction to take the damage instead and when they do so, they have resistance to that damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The knight is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Leadership (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Divine Smite
entries: The knight can fill his sword with divine energy. Whenever he hits with a weapon attack, he can spend a spell slot to deal an extra {@damage 2d8} radiant damage. He can spend additional spell slots to increase the extra damage by {@dice 1d8} per slot level above 1st, to a maximum of {@dice 5d8}. Undead and Fiends take an additional {@dice 1d8}.

trait.name: Channel Divinity: Harness Divine Power (Recharges after a short or long rest)
entries: The king can spend a bonus action to regain a single spell slot for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd levels.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The king regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point. If the king takes radiant damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the king's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The king makes four greatsword attacks.

action.name: +3 Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage plus 20 ({@damage 3d8 + 7}) radiant damage.

action.name: Divine Burst (2/Day)
entries: The king releases a burst of divine energy at a point he can see within 120 ft. Each creature in a 20 ft radius centered on that point must make a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 20d6} radiant damage. Fiends and Undead have disadvantage on this saving throw.

reaction.name: Retributive Strike
entries: The king can retaliate at an immense speed. Whenever they are hit with an attack, they can make a single melee weapon attack against a creature within 5 ft of them.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The aboleth can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Mucous Cloud
entries: While underwater, the aboleth is surrounded by transformative mucus. A creature that touches the aboleth or that hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw. On a failure, the creature is diseased for {@dice 1d4} hours. The diseased creature can breathe only underwater.

trait.name: Probing Telepathy
entries: If a creature communicates telepathically with the aboleth, the aboleth learns the creature's greatest desires if the aboleth can see the creature.

trait.name: Aberrant Ground
entries: The ground in a 10-foot radius around the aboleth is moist difficult terrain and has tiny grasping tentacles. Each creature that starts its turn in that area must succeed on a {@dc 10} Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced to 0 until the start of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The aboleth makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or become diseased. The disease has no effect for 1 minute and can be removed by any magic that cures disease. After 1 minute, the diseased creature's skin becomes translucent and slimy, the creature can't regain hit points unless it is underwater, and the disease can be removed only by heal or another disease-curing spell of 6th level or higher. When the creature is outside a body of water, it takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage every 10 minutes unless moisture is applied to the skin before 10 minutes have passed.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Enslave (3/Day)
entries: The aboleth targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be magically {@condition charmed} by the aboleth until the aboleth dies or until it is on a different plane of existence from the target. The {@condition charmed} target is under the aboleth's control and can't take reactions, and the aboleth and the target can communicate telepathically with each other over any distance.

Whenever the {@condition charmed} target takes damage, the target can repeat the saving throw. On a success, the effect ends. No more than once every 24 hours, the target can also repeat the saving throw when it is at least 1 mile away from the aboleth.
A creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth for more than 10 days does not repeat its save when it takes damage.

action.name: Psychic Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The aboleth makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Swipe
entries: The aboleth makes one tail attack.

legendary.name: Psychic Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: One creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage, and the aboleth regains hit points equal to the damage the creature takes.

Before the coming of the gods, aboleths lurked in primordial oceans and underground lakes. They reached out with their minds and seized control of the burgeoning life-forms of the mortal realm, making those creatures their slaves. Their dominance made them like gods. Then the true gods appeared, smashing the aboleths' empire and freeing their slaves. Aboleths have never forgotten.

entries.name: Eternal Memories
entries: Aboleths have flawless memories. They pass on their knowledge and experience from generation to generation. Thus, the injury of their defeat by the gods remains perfectly preserved in their minds.

Aboleths' minds are treasure troves of ancient lore, recalling moments from prehistory with perfect clarity. They plot patiently and intricately across eons. Few creatures can conceive of the extent of an aboleth's plan.

entries.name: Gods in the Lake
entries: Aboleths dwell in watery environments, including ocean abysses, deep lakes, and the Elemental Plane of Water. In these domains and the lands that adjoin them, aboleths are like gods, demanding worship and obedience from their subjects. When they consume other creatures, aboleths add the knowledge and experiences of their prey to their eternal memories. Aboleths use their telepathic powers to read the minds of creatures and know their desires. An aboleth uses this knowledge to gain a creature's loyalty, promising to fulfill such wants in exchange for obedience. Within its lair, the aboleth can further use its powers to override senses, granting creatures, such as its followers, the illusion of promised rewards.

entries.name: Enemies of the Gods
entries: The aboleths' fall from power is written in stark clarity on their flawless memories, for aboleths never truly die. If an aboleth's body is destroyed, its spirit returns to the Elemental Plane of Water, where a new body coalesces for it over days or months.
Ultimately, aboleths dream of overthrowing the gods and regaining control of the world. Aboleths have had untold eons to plot and to prepare their plans for perfect execution.

entries.name: An Aboleth's Lair
entries: Aboleths lair in subterranean lakes or the rocky depths of the ocean, often surrounded by the ruins of an ancient, fallen aboleth city. An aboleth spends most of its existence underwater, surfacing occasionally to treat with visitors or deranged worshipers.

entries.name: Lair Actions
entries: When fighting inside its lair, an aboleth can invoke the ambient magic to take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the aboleth takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects:

items: The aboleth casts {@spell phantasmal force} (no components required) on any number of creatures it can see within 60 feet of it. While maintaining concentration on this effect, the aboleth can't take other lair actions. If a target succeeds on the saving throw or if the effect ends for it, the target is immune to the aboleth's phantasmal force lair action for the next 24 hours, although such a creature can choose to be affected.

Pools of water within 90 feet of the aboleth surge outward in a grasping tide. Any creature on the ground within 20 feet of such a pool must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 20 feet into the water and knocked {@condition prone}. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

Water in the aboleth's lair magically becomes a conduit for the creature's rage. The aboleth can target any number of creatures it can see in such water within 90 feet of it. A target must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. The aboleth can't use this lair action again until it has used a different one.

entries.name: Regional Effects
entries: The region containing an aboleth's lair is warped by the creature's presence, which creates one or more of the following effects:

items: Underground surfaces within 1 mile of the aboleth's lair are slimy and wet and are difficult terrain.
Water sources within 1 mile of the lair are supernaturally fouled. Enemies of the aboleth that drink such water vomit it within minutes.

As an action, the aboleth can create an illusory image of itself within 1 mile of the lair. The copy can appear at any location the aboleth has seen before or in any location a creature {@condition charmed} by the aboleth can currently see. Once created, the image lasts for as long as the aboleth maintains concentration, as if concentrating on a spell. Although the image is intangible, it looks, sounds, and can move like the aboleth. The aboleth can sense, speak, and use telepathy from the image's position as if present at that position. If the image takes any damage, it disappears.

entries: If the aboleth dies, the first two effects fade over the course of {@dice 3d10} days.

spellcasting.name: Psionic Spellcasting
headerEntries: The aboleth has innate psionics in the form of spellcasting. Intelligence is the aboleth's spellcasting ability (DC: 16, +8 to hit with spells) and can cast the following spells without requiring material components:

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d12 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The magen dragon has a magical breath weapon that does damage based on its summoner's draconian origin. If it is not summoned via the "Manifest Dragon" feature, then you choose a damage type between acid, cold, fire, poison, or lightning.
The magen dragon exhales a breath weapon in a 15 ft cone. Each creature in the cone takes {@damage 4d6} damage as mentioned above.

resist.special: shares any resistances it its summoner had

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The magen dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Fiery End
entries: If the magen dragon dies, its body disintegrates in a harmless burst of fire and smoke, leaving behind anything it was wearing or carrying.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The magen dragon doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: Unless the lich wishes it, he is unaffected by spells of 3rd level or lower. He has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

trait.name: Rejuvenation (Lich)
entries: If it has a phylactery, a destroyed dead king, julius gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all its hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears within 5 feet of the phylactery.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the dead king, julius is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a saving throw to only take half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

trait.name: Epic Magic
entries: The lich has powerful magic that makes it harder for creatures to dispel or counter it. Any creature who attempts to dispel or counterspell his spells must make a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the spell fails and the spell slot is wasted. On a success, the spell applies as normal.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The lich doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Special Equipment
entries: Julius has attuned to various artifacts and legendary items. He has the following items on his person when he awakens: {@item Staff of the magi|dmg}, {@item robe of the archmagi|dmg}, {@item Book of Vile Darkness|dmg}

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes three greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 22} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 35 ({@damage 10d6}) fire damage and 35 ({@damage 10d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Royal Decree {@recharge 5}
entries: The dead king utters a powerful word with magical prowess. Each creature within 60 ft of him must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned}. While {@condition stunned}, the target takes {@damage 1d6} psychic damage and slowly begins to lose the will to fight. The target repeats its saving throw at the end of its turn, and on three consecutive failed saves they cannot willingly make an attack or cast a spell on the dead king until the next dawn.

action.name: 11th level Epic Spell: Create Lichdom (1/day)
entries: The lich touches one creature and shares its phylactery with them. That creature becomes a lich, but can only its Rejuvination property once. After it uses this property, if it dies again it remains dead unless the Dead King Julius wishes them to return.

action.name: 10th level Epic Spell: Summon Tarrasque
entries: The lich summons The Tarrasque{@monsters The Tarrasque|OGOFW}, it follows the commands of the lich as closely as possible, but it is under no compulsion to do so at all times.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 6 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
Long forgotten to time, Ichult was once a powerful prosperous land. Home to one of the strongest kingdoms, but now all that prominence was lost to time.

In a great war long ago, the entire world battled itself to claim rulership of all the kingdoms. Magic was a powerful tool in this war, but the old ways were used by the old king Julius. No one knew where or how he obtained these dark arts, but legend has it that he retreated from the war to preserve himself, and sank his castle deep underwater.

About 1500 years have passed since that war, and now that the castle has risen again, the return of the old king is soon upon us. He's been resting for over a thousand years, so he may be nowhere near his prime, but it is rumored that he was indeed immortal in age.
The Immortal Lich

"Meteors rained from the green eldritch skies, as cities would fall at his very utterings. Even the flying cities filled with powerful mages feared him. Few existed that could stand in proximity of this mighty warrior of chaos and destruction without losing their very soul to this lich's phylactery.  ."
Fear Amongst Nations

"When he was in power, it is said those who made allies in the war did so because of him. Every nation was struck with fear, and few even dared to attack during the war. He was close to winning the war, but Ishland had united, and that had finally struck fear into him. The elves, the dwarves, and even the humans. Alone they were nothing, together they were a force to be reckoned with. And reckoned with, the king did not."
Cruelty of a Tyrant

"I've never seen someone so evil to the very bone... This was no man, he was a monster. Those he didn't kill, he enslaved. He ruled a small country, might as well have been an island... Nobody even knows where he came from, but everyone knew why he wanted to rule."
The Retreat of the Mad King

"Everyone was so happy to see the rotten bastard retreat. Though, I don't blame him. The combined forces of Ishland would be too much for any country. Of course, that didn't last long. They went back to fighting after the king fled. Funny how alliances can end so quickly when the true threat is gone... I wonder if they will ever ally again, or if they'll just destroy each other."
Slayer of the Divine:

"Even the gods feared this king, they sent many clerics and paladins to their doom in efforts to fell this lich. They say he was once within reach of godhood, but was foiled by some adventurers long ago. That new queen of Eastern Ishland... she is a force to be reckoned with. Though most of the other adventurers didn't survive the fight, the queen was able to flee. Maybe it was those adventurers that gave her the opening she needed."
Bringer of Chaos:

"He turned kingdoms to ash, brought warriors to their knees, and champions cowering in fear. Some say he was going to be what brought about the rapture, the beginning of the end. He made several artifacts of war, and even managed to kill a god. He was unmatched by any known creature, and even had an Ancient Dracolich at his beckon call."
The Heroes of the Lands:

"During these times, there were five legendary heroes that attempted to slay the immortal king. Though they failed in their efforts to kill him, they managed to stop his desires to become a god, which would take many years to try and replicate the means to do so. These heroes were were Ragnarok a Wood Elf Sorcerer, Excalibur a Human Paladin, Yumiko a Tiefling Ranger, Kotone an Aasimar Bard, and Iryoku a Dwarf Barbarian. Together with the Queen of Eastern Ishland, they bravely fought against this impossible foe. Many of them gave their lives in this fight, and only the queen was known to escape. It is unknown if the others had, and the powerful weapons they wielded were lost. No one knows of their whereabouts, or if they even still exist."
Forgotten Magic

"Some say that this Lich had untold magic, even beyond what was originally thought to be capable. The epic magic used to make our floating cities pales in comparison to the dark secrets he has. No wonder the mighty heroes fell at the wake of his magic."

legendary.name: Spell
entries: The lich uses one of its at will spells.

legendary.name: Disrupt Life
entries: Each non-undead creature within 20 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw against this magic, taking 21 ({@damage 6d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

legendary.name: Energy Drain (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: Each creature with in 30 feet of the lich must make a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature's hit point maximum is magically reduced by 10 ({@dice 3d6}). If a creature's hit point maximum is reduced to 0 by this effect, the creature dies. A creature's hit point maximum can be restored with the greater restoration spell or similar magic.

legendary.name: Vile Curse (Costs 3 Actions)
entries: The lich targets one creature it can see within 30 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be magically cursed. Until the curse ends, the target has disadvantage on attack rolls and saving throws. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the curse on a success.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The lich's spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 24}, +16 to hit with spell attacks). The lich can cast the following spells:

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Breath Weapon {@recharge 5}
entries: The ancestral has a magical breath weapon that does damage based on its summoner's draconian origin.
The ancestral ally breath weapon's damage is based on the resistance the dragon shaman gained from their Draconic Origins.

The ancestral ally exhales a breath weapon in a 15 ft cone. Each creature in the cone makes {@dc 15} dexterity saving throw or takes {@damage 2d6} damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

resist.special: shares any resistances it its summoner had

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The ancestral ally doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Incorporeal Movement
entries: The ancestral ally can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

trait.name: Limited Flight
entries: The ancestral ally cannot fully fly, instead it can ascend up to 40 ft into the air, but slowly descends downward and by the end of its turn remains hovering 1 foot off the ground. It can indefinitely hover 1 foot off the ground and can move horizontally through the air normally, but if it has 0 speed while more than 5 ft off the ground, it slowly descends downward at a rate of 60 ft per round.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Plane Shift
entries: The dragon can cast plane shift without material components after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The ancient platinum dragon has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ancient platinum dragon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ancient platinum dragon regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 2d10 + 11}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d6 + 11}) slashing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 19} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 2d8 + 11}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Frightful Presence
entries: Each creature of the dragon's choice that is within 120 feet of the dragon and aware of it must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
entries: The dragon can magically heal a creature it touches for {@dice 8d10 + 8} healing.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Radiant Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a beam of radiant energy in a 5 foot wide 90-foot long line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 26} Dexterity saving throw, taking ({@damage 24d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Healing Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a vaporous breath that mends the wounds of wounded creatures in a 90-foot cone. Each creature in that area is healed {@dice 12d8} hit points and removes any disease or poison afflicting it.

action.name: Change Shape
entries: The dragon magically polymorphs into a humanoid or beast that has a challenge rating no higher than its own, or back into its true form. It reverts to its true form if it dies. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (the dragon's choice).

In a new form, the dragon retains its alignment, hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, Legendary Resistance, lair actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores, as well as this action. Its statistics and capabilities are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, except any class features or legendary actions of that form.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The dragon makes a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check.

legendary.name: Tail Attack
entries: The dragon makes a tail attack.

legendary.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 15 feet of the dragon must succeed on a {@dc 27} Dexterity saving throw or take 17 ({@damage 2d6 + 11}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the dragon fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Plane Shift
entries: The dragon can cast plane shift without material components after spending one hour in uninterrupted meditation.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The ancient platinum dragon's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ancient platinum dragon regains 20 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}22 ({@damage 2d10 + 9}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d6 + 9}) slashing damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 2d8 + 9}) bludgeoning damage.

A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the dragon's Frightful Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Healing Touch (4/Day)
entries: The dragon can magically heal a creature it touches for {@dice 5d10 + 5} healing.

entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ancient platinum dragon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (2/Day)
entries: The dragon can magically heal a creature it touches for {@dice 3d10 + 5} healing.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Radiant Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a beam of radiant energy in a 5 foot wide 30-foot long line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 31 ({@damage 12d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Healing Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a vaporous breath that mends the wounds of wounded creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area is healed {@dice 5d8} hit points.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The ancient platinum dragon regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn if it has at least 1 hit point.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dragon can use its Frightful Presence. It then makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (2/Day)
entries: The dragon can magically heal a creature it touches for {@dice 1d10 + 4} healing.

action.name: Breath Weapons {@recharge 5}
entries: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

items.name: Radiant Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a beam of radiant energy in a 5 foot wide 15-foot long line. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 27 ({@damage 6d8}) radiant damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

items.name: Healing Breath.
items.entry: The dragon exhales a vaporous breath that mends the wounds of wounded creatures in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area is healed {@dice 2d8} hit points.

feat.name: Draconic Adept
entries: Studying old and powerful dragons, you’ve uncovered strange but powerful abilities. Could this be the power of dragons, is this truly remnants of the abilities these great wyrms would procure? You learn one Draconian Power option of your choice from the dragon warrior and dragon shaman classes. If the power has a prerequisite, you can choose that power only if you're a dragon warrior or dragon shaman and only if you meet the prerequisite.
Whenever you gain a level, you can replace the draconian power with another one from the dragon warrior and dragon shaman classes.

feat.name: Draconic Herald
entries: Continuing your study of dragons, you’ve learned about all kinds of powerful wyrms and why they are so feared. You learn an additional Draconian Power option of your choice from the dragon warrior and dragon shaman classes. If the power has a prerequisite, you can choose that power only if you're a dragon warrior or dragon shaman and only if you meet the prerequisite.

In addition to this power, you have advantage on Charisma ability checks made to influence dragons. This could be interpreted as inducing fear, trying to persuade a dragon to spare you or your companions, or even seek aid from a dragon.

feat.name: Dragon Slayer
entries: Through your studies of dragons, you’ve discovered their weaknesses and can exploit them on a whim. You have advantage on saving throws against a dragon’s breath weapon, and when you successfully save against it, you can use a reaction to take no damage instead.

In addition, whenever you hit a dragon with an attack using a weapon, you can treat a 19 on the d20 as a critical hit. If you already consider a 19 on the d20 as a critical hit, you instead treat an 18 as a critical hit.

feat.name: Dedicated Hero
entries: Through your sheer willpower and dedication to save others you can make miracles happen.

items: You can't be surprised while you are conscious.
Whenever you would roll to stabilize a creature to prevent them from dying, you have advantage on the roll.

When a creature would be hit by a weapon or spell attack, and that creature is within the remaining distance of twice your movement as of the end of your last turn, you can spend your reaction to take the creature's space, moving them to a space adjacent to you. You become the target for the attack, and all incoming attacks from that source thereafter. This movement does not provoke attacks of oppurtunity. If the attack would hit, it is treated as a critical hit.

When a creature would be subjected to a constitution, dexterity, or strength saving throw, and that creature is within the remaining distance of twice your movement as of the end of your last turn, you can spend your reaction to take the creature's space, moving them to a space adjacent to you. This movement does not provoke attacks of oppurtunity. You shield them from the effects of the spell making yourself the main target of the spell. You suffer disadvantage on the saving throw of the spell and take twice the amount of damage you would ordinarily take, if any. If the spell would affect multiple creatures, you choose one creature to shield.

feat.name: Heroic Presence
entries: You stand as a paragon for the people, heroic and brave till the moment you draw your last breath. While you are concious, you have advantage on saving throws against being charmed or frightened.
You can spend an action on your turn to end a charmed or frightened condition. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

feat.name: Heroic Determination
entries: You've been through hell and back, your will to survive is complimented by your heroic nature.

items: Whenever you would fall to 0 hit points, but are not outright killed, you can do one of the following:
You can spend your reaction to remain at 1 hit point instead. Once you do so, you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
You can expend any of your remaining hit dice, you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the result.

optionalfeature.name: Gadget Crafting
entries: By undertaking this Magitech Research you can begin making more complex gadgets and gizmos. When making a Gadget consider what task you want it to complete. Examples include a Flash Grenade that is intended to blind creatures. So the idea is to give it a range of how far you can throw it, making it involve a saving throw, etc. Here are some examples of Gadgets, but work with your DM to craft your Gadgets. You have a number of known Gadgets equal to your Intelligence Modifier.

items: Grappling Hook! (50 GP) : This device contains a 50ft long hook and rope that shoots outward, connecting to any wooden or rough surface climbing gear would. (This is a bonus action in combat) Then you can either launch yourself forward with the Grappling Hook, or you can aim it at a creature and attempt to grapple them. They make an opposing athletics or acrobatics check against your Magitech Save DC. You can then spend an action to retract the Grappling Hook to knock the enemy prone and reduce their movement to zero until the start of your next turn. No save required if the target was already grappled on a previous turn.

Smoke Bomb! (50 GP) : A small ball filled to the brim with smoke, as a bonus action you throw it down you can do one of two things : set it to explode at a specific time OR have it explode on impact. Upon explosion a large amount of gas expands outward in a 20ft radius sphere. You have advantage on stealth checks to leave the sphere and creatures inside the sphere have disadvantage on perception checks.

Flash Grenade! (50 GP) : FLASH! Throw a grenade that explodes mid air as a bonus action, you create a flash of light outward for a 20ft radius sphere. Any creature within the radius of the flash grenade must pass a Constitution Saving Throw against your Magitech Save DC. On a failed save the target is blinded for 1d4 rounds.

entries: There are various different kinds of gadgets you can make, but most of these gadgets should be mundane in usage and don’t have any real magical properties to them, other than making the gadgets possible to function in general.

optionalfeature.name: Alchemical Research
entries: You’ve begun to delve into chemistry and making special elixirs. By undergoing this research you’ve uncovered various different methods to creating potions of varying effects.

You gain proficiency in Alchemist Supplies and can use them for crafting elixirs of varying effects. In addition you add your Improved Tinkers Tools bonus to ability checks made with your Alchemist Supplies. You can work with your DM on the nature of your elixirs and their effects, or the following options are added to the Alchemical Crafting option for your Alchemist Supplies, along with cost for the materials to make said elixirs.

items: Healing Elixir. (30 gp) You can craft a Potion of Healing, however it heals 2d4 plus your intelligence modifier instead.

Adrenaline Elixir. (30 gp) A creature who drinks this elixir gains an amount of temporary hit points equal to 2d6 plus your intelligence modifier and receives an extra action which they can use to make an ability check, attack (makes only one weapon attack), dash, or use an object. These benefits last for 1 minute or until they lose the temporary hit points, after which the drinker gains a level of exhaustion.

Bottled Fury Elixir. (50 gp) Several chemicals combined to fire signals to the drinker’s brain to stimulate a relentless rage. Using this rage, the drinker can draw out a far more primal-like strength. While enraged, they have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage. In addition, they have advantage on strength ability checks and strength saving throws. They also add a d4 of damage to their weapon attacks. This rage lasts for 1 minute or until the drinker is incapacitated, after which the drinker gains a level of exhaustion.

Magical Rejuvenating Elixir. (100 gp) You’ve discovered that the combination of certain chemicals can restore the use of weak magic used by spellcasters, but it may have odd effects on non-spellcasters. If the drinker is a spellcaster, they regain one 1st level spell slot. Alternatively, it restores 1 warlock spell slot. If the user is not a spell caster, roll a d4 and randomly determine the effect based on the result.

entries.caption: Magic Effects
rows: The drinker becomes intoxicated for 1 hour.
The drinker gains a level of exhaustion, but can see into the ethereal plane for 1 hour.
The user becomes invigorated and gains 2d4 temporary hit points.
The user gains an inspiration die, to which they can use as a Luck point.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Vehicle Construction
entries: By undertaking this Magitech Research you can make small land vehicles to help you and your group travel to places more quickly.
