Certain vehicles can make traveling in certain areas much less of a hassle. These vehicles can be used to possibly ignore difficult terrain and may come equipped with a set of navigation tools. Though you may have to supply some magitech energy to power them and they may not last long. Crafting one will generally cost around 100gp - 500gp.

These vehicles can take the appearance of whatever you wish so long that it is of medium or large size. (A medium sized vehicle can be something like a hoverboard, or a scooter even.) 5 Magitech Energy can power these vehicles for 1 hour, after which they need to be recharged by either spending 5 additional Magitech Energy or using a Magitech Energy Pack to keep it charged until the Energy Pack runs out of Energy.

The vehicles will have a stat block, but only the Strength, Dexterity, and Constitution Scores will be used. Work with the DM on how your specific vehicles may be statted. Its armor class will equal its Strength Score, its Speed will equal 5 x its Dexterity Score, and its hit points will be 10 x its Constitution Score. Some Example stat blocks will be at the bottom of this document. Regardless, its mental ability scores should all equal 1 and they are immune to all conditions.

optionalfeature.name: Basic Runic Studies
entries: By learning the various different kinds of magic, you have stumbled across a peculiar type of magic used by giants. You can incorporate this runic magic to your Magitech Gear and Weapons. Each Rune costs 50 gp to craft. (You can also apply the Runes to other Magitech Devices, but make sure to OK with your DM first.) Activating a Rune costs 10 Magitech Energy and lasts for 1 hour. Once a rune is used they lose their magical properties and regain them at the end of a long rest.

items: Rune of Strength: While you have the Rune Active, your Strength Score increases by 2 and you count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift. In addition you have advantage on Strength Checks.
Rune of Enlargement: While you have the Rune Active, your Constitution Score increases by 2 and you are put under the effects of the Enlarge effect of the Enlarge/Reduce Spell.
Rune of the Raven Eyes: While you have the Rune Active, your Wisdom Score Increases by 2 and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Insight) checks.

optionalfeature.name: Basic Construction
entries: Creating constructs has been a favored pastime for all kinds of inventors, from the mountain driven dwarves to the forest homed gnomes, tiny constructs have always held a special place in a tinkerer’s heart. Now you too can join in on the fun. By imbuing magic into a tiny humanoid looking statue made of wood, clay, or even metal; you can create a tiny construct that can move around and do mundane tasks.

As a 10 minute ritual, you can cast the Tiny Servant spell using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability at will. The duration lasts until the creature falls to 0 hit points, at which point the spell ends. Otherwise, the spell lasts until dispelled.

Rather than casting a spell, you can flavor this as tinkering around with an object until it resembles more of a humanoid like object, adding gears and tiny components that would allow it to move around and open doors, pick locks, etc.

optionalfeature.name: Magitech Attachments
entries: You took a look at your weapon and thought “You know… why not add more?”

You have a number of known Magitech Attachments equal to your Intelligence Modifier. You can craft Magitech Attachments at a base cost of 50 gp. Work with your DM on how your attachments function and the usages of them. Do they add a modifier to hit? To damage? Do they make weapons fly back into your hand? It’s up to you, but at the end of the day it’s up to you and the DM to determine that. Here are some example attachments to get you started:

items: Scope (50 GP): You gain advantage to hit a creature within base range of a shot with a ranged weapon this attachment is on and you gain a normal roll with the disadvantage range of a ranged weapon with this attachment on.
Serrated Blade (50 GP): A melee weapon with this attachment gains an additional 1d6 Slashing damage.
Energy Amplifier (75 GP): A magitech ranged weapon that is energy based adds an additional damage die of the type of damage it deals, but at the cost of 5 Magitech Energy.

Detachable Battery (100 GP): A magitech Energy Pack that you can attach directly to your weapons or devices. This battery can contain up to 5 x Your Intelligence Modifier in Magitech Energy and regains all expended Magitech Energy at the end of a long rest. Detaching and Attaching the battery onto a Magitech Device costs a Bonus Action in combat.

optionalfeature.name: Chemical Construction
entries: You’ve studied the art of technology and magic, but what if you added chemistry into the mix? Now you’re asking for a good time. Through your genius and research you’ve discovered a way to create a sentient ooze.

As a 1 hour ritual you can artificially create an ooze of a CR up to half your Magitechnician level (rounded down). The ooze has an Intelligence Score of 10 unless it was already higher than 10. It follows your initiative and acts on its own. You can mentally command it however by spending a bonus action. You can only have 1 ooze at a time when you use this feature.

optionalfeature.name: Ionic Research
entries: You’ve learned how to create energy based weapons through the means science and magic. You can replace the damage type of your Magitech Weapons with radiant damage. In addition, your Magitech Weapons deals an additional amount of radiant damage on hit equal to your intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Aberrant Technology
entries: You have been contacted by, or discovered, an eldritch aberration from the Far Realm and have been given information about their strange anatomy and the science behind it. Being the inventor you are, you have made it your goal to incorporate this information into your technology.

You are given a single Warlock Spell Slot, see the Warlock’s “Pact Magic” feature PHB pg 107. Choose from two Eldritch Invocations (you must meet the prerequisites) and create a Magitech Device that incorporates those invocations. You also gain the Eldritch Blast cantrip and 2 spells from the Warlock Spellcasting List. These spells must be of a level of which you’d be able to cast as a 3rd level Warlock. You cast these spells through odd Magitech Devices that are thematically designed to fit the spell. Eldritch Blast can be cast through your ranged Magitech Weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Botanist Researcher
entries: You’ve decided to delve into researching nature and have discovered that many herbs can be used in ways you’ve never even imagined. Never underestimate the power of nature. You gain proficiency in Nature, if you already have proficiency you add double your proficiency bonus instead. You also gain proficiency in an Herbalism Kit and you add your Improved Tinkers Tools bonus to ability checks made with your Herbalism Kit.
Additionally, when you make potions using your Herbalism Kit, you gain the following options using similar materials used to make Potions of Healing, costing the same amount:

items: Potion of Fertility: This greenish liquid allows soil to become instantly fertile, and capable of growing plant life even in arid or otherwise uninhabitable environments.
{@item Potion of Growth|DMG} (look at DMG p187)
{@item Philter of Love|DMG} (look at DMG p184)

optionalfeature.name: Nanotechnology
entries: Your research in robotics has led to this very moment, you have learned how to create very tiny, microscopic sized robots that basically act as a literal tiny army. It costs roughly 200 GP worth of Magitech materials in order to create an efficient batch of nanotech. This nanotechnology can perform mundane tasks as well as be used to further enhance other works of Magitech.

Your nanites, as they will be called for simplicity’s sake, have some basic commands that you can give them. Upon doing so they will be given a task based on that command. To use a command takes a bonus action. You can add more commands to the Nanites in time, but their basic commands go as such:

items: Assist : provides the help action.
Repair : Heals a construct for 1d6 + Your Intelligence Modifier.

Enhance : Your nanites enter inside of your weapons and gear enhancing them. You can now add a 1d6 to any attack roll, saving throw, or ability check. This can be used 3 times until the command ends. (This command can be used for yourself or any ally with the correct magitech gear, i.e if they only have a weapon they only get the bonus for attack rolls.)

optionalfeature.name: Magical Alchemy
entries: Your research has begun to bare fruit, and as such you’re capable of creating more powerful elixirs by combining magic into your Alchemy. To do so, you must have a form of spellcasting, the ability to cast spells, or an ally who has access to either of those options. You can create potions and infuse spells into those potions, work with your DM on how those spells are incorporated. Assume the following rules for imbuing a spell into a potion:

items: In order to infuse the spell, you must cast it at a level of which you can cast, targeting the potion. The magic is then stored into the potion for later use.

In order for the potion to hold the spell, it requires the use of certain chemicals that have magical properties. It costs 25 gp worth per level of the spell of these magical chemicals to create each potion. Cantrips cost 10 gp worth.
Assume the drinker of the potion is the target for the spell.
The process is equivalent to 10 minutes plus the casting time of the spell unless the potion is otherwise prepared in advance.
Spells that include a saving throw will use the Magitechnician’s Magitech Save DC for the purposes of the spell.
Spells that include a spell attack use the Magitechnician’s Spell Attack modifier, if they do not have one they use the Magitechnician’s Intelligence modifier.
Spells that have an area of effect, such as a sphere with a radius of 20 ft, uses half the range of the spell effect.

Potions that are thrown are destroyed and releases the spell wildly, the closest creature becomes the target of the spell, but if there is no creature within 30 ft of the point the potion was thrown the spell is wasted.
You can only imbue spells of 5th level or lower into potions, as higher magic requires a vastly more advanced process that you’re still struggling to understand.
Spells that require material components must be present and incorporated in some way into the potion. No matter the material required, the magic will make it not harmful for consumption.
In addition, you can create more potent elixirs from your Alchemical Research. The following changes can be made to the following elixirs for an extra cost of 50 gp.

entries.caption: Magic Effects
rows: The elixir restores an additional 2d4 healing.
The elixir gives an additional 2d6 temporary hit points and grants advantage to ability checks and saving throws.
The elixir lasts for an additional minute and grants advantage on melee attack rolls, but melee attacks made against the drinker have advantage.
The elixir can restore a 2nd level spell slot, or two 1st level spell slots of the drinker’s choice. Alternatively, it restores two warlock spell slots instead of one.

optionalfeature.name: Magical Gadgets
entries: You have furthered your research into your Gadget Crafting and incorporated magic into the mix. You can craft gadgets that can magically cause a creature to become poisoned, paralyzed, slowed, etc. You can recreate your already existing gadgets to become magical gadgets. Some examples of magical gadgets are :

items: Shock Grenade : (150 GP) As a bonus action you can throw a small object that explodes mid air, releasing a large discharge of electricity. Each creature within 20 ft of the Shock Grenade makes a Dexterity saving throw against your Magitech Save DC, taking 2d10 lightning damage and is paralyzed on a failed save, or half as much on a success and is not paralyzed.

Noxious Spray : (100 GP) As an action you can pull out a spray canister that contains a noxious gas. You spray out a 15 ft cone of this gas, each creature within range makes a Constitution saving throw against your Magitech Save DC or is poisoned for the next minute. While poisoned in this way, instead of being able to see clearly or hear, it hallucinates and is considered blinded and deafened. A creature can repeat its save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

Charming Bowtie : (100 GP) As an action you can tighten a special bowtie to give off a very stunning appearance to those around you. Each creature that can see you makes a Charisma saving throw against your Magitech Save DC, or be charmed by you for the next hour. If the creature takes damage by you or your companions, this effect ends. If they pass the saving throw, they do not know you were attempting to charm them. While charmed in this way, they see you as a close friend and are more willing to share sensitive information with you.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Vehicle Construction
entries: As you delve more into your research into constructing vehicles, you can now make much larger vehicles, allowing more than one person to enter a vehicle. You can craft a huge Vehicle which can carry up to two people at a time. A larger Vehicle can potentially move slower, but have a higher hit point pool. Some examples of Huge Vehicle stat blocks will be shown at the bottom of this document alongside the smaller ones.
In addition, your Advanced Vehicles come equipped with mounted weapons. The mounted weapons use the statistics of a Laser Rifle found in Chapter 9 of the dmg.
These Huge Vehicles can also be made as Water Vehicles, meaning that they can be driven on water as if it was traveling on land.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Runic Studies
entries: When you gain this feature you gain the following Runes that each cost 100 GP :

items: Rune of the Allfather: While you have the Rune Active, your Intelligence Score increases by 2 and you gain advantage on all Intelligence checks for 1 minute. In addition you can ask the DM any one question within that minute, to which the DM responds with a truthful, but possibly vague answer. Once you do so, the Rune’s magic ends early, depending on the answer.
Rune of the Valkyries: While you have the Rune Active, your Dexterity Score increases by 2 and you gain a flying speed of 60 ft. for the next minute.

Rune of the Trickster: While you have the Rune Active, your Charisma Score increases by 2 and you gain a special action that you can use to charm a creature within 60 ft of you. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw against your Magitech Save DC. On a failed save, the creature is charmed by you for 1 hour and persists even when the Rune loses its magic. While charmed in this way, the creature is oblivious to your attempts to deceive them, no ability check required. The charm ends early if you or one of your allies damages them.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Magitech
entries: You took a look at your weapon and thought “You know… it’s not good enough, let’s set it on fire.”

You have an Elemental Attachment that you can use to spend 5 Magitech Energy to grant your weapon with a specific elemental damage for the next minute. Until the effect ends, you deal an additional 1d10 damage using acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison for the damage type using your Magitech Weapons.

optionalfeature.name: Potent Magical Alchemy
entries: You’ve discovered more potent combinations of chemicals which opens the door to more powerful elixirs. The following items are added to your Alchemical Crafting, the cost of which vary on the rarity of the items. Refer to the Magic Item Crafting Time and Cost table found on page 128 of Xanathar’s Guide to Everything for the cost and time needed of these items if they are not already provided. The highest rarity of potion you can create is rare. The cost and time needed for these items are cut in half. If the potion or elixir involves a saving throw, the dc is instead equal to your Magitech Save DC.
The following requires only 1 work day to make :

items: {@item Black Sap|EGW}; EGW p152
{@item Muroosa Balm|EGW}; EGW p70
{@item Olisuba Leaf|EGW}; EGW p70
{@item Soothsalts|EGW}; EGW p152
{@item Theki Root|EGW}; EGW p70
{@item Willowshade Oil|EGW}; EGW p70
The following are magic items, refer to the chart mentioned above in XGE :
{@item Elixir of Health|DMG}; DMG p168
{@item Keoghtom's Ointment|DMG}; DMG p179
{@item Oil of Etherealness|DMG}; DMG p183
{@item Oil of Slipperiness|DMG}; DMG p184
{@item Potion of Climbing|DMG}; DMG p187
{@item Potion of Diminution|DMG}; DMG p187
{@item Potion of Giant Strength|DMG}; DMG p187
{@item Potion of Invulnerability|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Maximum Power|EGW}; EGW p268
{@item Potion of Mind Control|TftYP}; Tales from the Yawning Portal p229
{@item Potion of Mind Reading|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Poison|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Resistance|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Watchful Rest|WDMM}; Waterdeep: Dungeon of the Mad Mage p62
{@item Potion of Water Breathing|DMG}; DMG p188

entries: In addition, the following changes can be made to the following elixirs for an additional cost of 100 gp:

entries.caption: Magic Effects
rows: The elixir restores an additional 2d4 healing and can cure one disease afflicting the drinker.
The elixir gives an additional 2d6 temporary hit points and grants an additional 10 ft to the drinkers movement speed.
The elixir lasts for an additional minute and grants resistance to acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison damage until the rage has ended.
The elixir can restore a 3rd level spell slot, two 2nd level spell slots and one 1st level spell slot, or three 1st level spell slots of the drinker’s choice.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Construction
entries: One construct was not enough for you, you must have more. They must be bigger, stronger, faster, and better. So you have studied this far to create your army of constructs.

You can spend a 1 hour ritual casting the spell Animate Objects at will using Intelligence as your spellcasting ability. The duration lasts until dispelled or until the objects are each dropped to 0 hit points.

Rather than casting a spell, you can flavor this as tinkering around with the objects until it resembles more like humanoid like objects, adding gears and tiny components that would allow them to move around and open doors, fight, pick locks, etc.

optionalfeature.name: Advanced Nanotechnology
entries: You have learned how to make improvements to your nanotechnology and they have now become more efficient.
When your nanites use the “Assist” Command you can add a 1d6 on top of the roll.
Any command (except for Assist) that requires a die roll, such as Enhance and Repair, increase that die to a d10 if it was not already a d10.
You can now make 2 commands during the same bonus action but cannot do so again until you complete a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Research
entries: You have plundered magical knowledge from a wide spectrum of disciplines. Choose two spells from any classes, including the one you chose from this subclass. You learn those spells and add them to your spellcasting list. A spell you choose must be of a level you can cast or a cantrip. The chosen spells count as Magitechnician spells for you and do not count against your prepared spells. Each time you level up, you can exchange the 1 of the 2 spells you chose for a different one.

optionalfeature.name: Masterwork Vehicle Construction
entries: Your research has led you to this moment, you have now mastered the art of craft with vehicles. You can now create significantly larger vehicles, going to Gargantuan and larger sizes. These Vehicles can carry up to nine different medium sized creatures at a given time. These are the vehicles that can look more like modern cars, but you can flavour them however you wish.
You can also now create a flying vehicle, flying vehicles have a flying speed equal to its regular speed, but must have a speed higher than 50 ft and be of large size or smaller in order to fly.

optionalfeature.name: Legendary Alchemy
entries: You’ve mastered the art of Alchemy, as such you can create far more potent mixtures than any other. You can now imbue up to 9th level spells into potions rather than 5th level, doing so takes an additional amount of time equal to 1 work week per level above 5th.
You gain the following potions added to your list of craftable potions, in addition you can now craft potions up to Legendary rarity. :

items: {@item Potion of Speed|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Flying|DMG}; DMG p187
{@item Potion of Longevity|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Potion of Vitality|DMG}; DMG p188
{@item Oil of Sharpness|DMG}; DMG p184

entries: The following changes are made to the following elixirs for an additional cost of 1000 gp.

entries.caption: Magic Effects
rows: The elixir restores an additional 20 points of healing.
The elixir gives an additional 20 temporary hit points and grants the benefits of the Freedom of Movement spell.
The elixir lasts for an additional minute and the drinker can no longer be frightened or charmed while enraged.
The elixir can restore a 6th level spell slot, or a number of spell slots whose total levels equal 6 of the drinker’s choice. Alternatively, it restores three warlock spell slots instead of two.

entries: In addition, by spending a large amount of time messing with chemicals your body has become acclimated to them. You have immunity to disease and poison.

optionalfeature.name: Grandiose Vehicle Construction
entries: You have been peaked by interstellar travel. You know that there is more out there than what was previously thought to be and you wish to experience it first hand. Your research up until now, was thought to be completed, but now you have stumbled across a new grand design

Your vehicles can now be created large enough to sustain at least 2 months of stellar travel, and any size category of vehicle can have a flying speed. This feature requires both Masterwork Vehicle Construction and this option and does not replace and inherit the previous ones. Your Vehicles can now carry a maximum of 20 different kinds of creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Ancient Runic Studies
entries: You have stumbled across the most powerful and ancient of runic magic. When you gain this feature you gain the following Runes that each cost 500 GP :

items: Rune of the Aesir: When the Rune is Active, you gain a truesight of 60 ft for 1 hour.
Rune of the Giants: When the Rune is Active, you gain the ability to tell whenever someone is telling a lie.
Rune of the Yggdrasil: When the Rune is Active you can cast one of the following spells: Etherealness, Astral Projection, or Teleport. Once one of the spells ends, the Rune loses its magic.

optionalfeature.name: Golem Crafting
entries: Your studies of creating constructs have led you to the intricate process of crafting various different kinds of constructs, including those that would initially require special magic items to craft. Instead now, your expertise in technology is enough to substitute.

You can craft a magical golem identical to ones through a similar process as if you had access to each variation of the Manual of Golems, but do not require the actual item itself in order to begin your Golem Crafting. Having the manual on hand will reduce the amount of time and resources needed by half. The Golem created by this effect follows your proficiency bonus instead. Once you have magically created a Golem in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

In addition, you can as a one hour ritual magically create any 1 construct that doesn’t list “Golem” in its name. This construct rolls its own initiative, and uses your proficiency bonus instead. Once you have magically created a construct in this way, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Armor
entries: You can cast mage armor on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components. Instead of adding your Dexterity modifier, you instead add your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Death Grip
entries: Whenever you grapple a creature using a bloody tendril, you can spend a blood die to deal an extra amount of bludgeoning damage equal to the amount you rolled. In addition, they take that damage at the end of every turn they are grappled by that tendril.

optionalfeature.name: Masking Blood
entries: You can manifest a masking layer of blood to hide your true self.  By spending a Blood Die, you can cast the Disguise Self spell at will using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability.

optionalfeature.name: Bloody Form
entries: As an action on your turn you gain the ability to shapechange into an ooze type creature. While in your Bloody Form you have the Amorphous feature. (You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.) While in this form you have resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks. In addition, you are immune to being prone and blinded. While in this form you have disadvantage on charisma checks against creatures whom you are not familiar with, or they are not familiar with you. In addition you cannot use your normal senses, instead you have a blindsight for up to 60 ft, and you are blind beyond that point. You cannot take the attack action or cast spells while in your Bloody Form. While in this form you can understand the languages you know, but you can’t read or speak. It is an action to shapechange back into normal form.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Companion
entries: You can spend a Blood Die to cast the Find Familiar spell at will without material components using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability. This Familiar gains an attack that it can use during combat, Blood Shot, but it can only attack using this trait. Blood Shot. Ranged Weapon Attack, Proficiency + DEX to hit, range 60 ft, one creature. Hit: 1d4 necrotic damage. As an action the familiar can shapechange into an ooze type creature, when it does it loses its Blood Shot attack and gains the Amorphous feature. (You can move through a space as narrow as 1 inch wide without squeezing.) While in this form it has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks. In addition, it is immune to being prone and blinded. In addition it cannot use its normal senses, instead it has a blindsight for up to 60 ft, and it is blind beyond that point. It is an action to shapechange back into normal form.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Beam
entries: You gain the Eldritch Blast cantrip using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability, but it deals necrotic damage instead. You can increase the damage by 1d10 for each ray by spending a blood die for each ray you boost.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Senses
entries: You gain a darkvision of up to 60 ft. If you already have darkvision, its range increases by an additional 60 ft. In addition you know the general location of exposed blood within 120 ft of you. You cannot detect a person’s blood in this way who is in total cover.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Affinity
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Medicine) checks. In addition when you successfully clean a wound that involves bleeding you can replenish 1 Blood Die into your blood pool.

optionalfeature.name: False Death
entries: You can cast the Feign Death spell at will without material components using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability, but only on yourself.  You can end the spell as a bonus action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Eviscerate
entries: When you make the attack action using your Bloody Tendrils, they deal an additional amount of slashing damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Bleeding Rays
entries: By spending 2 Blood Dice, you can cast the Scorching Ray spell at its lowest level at will using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Instead of dealing fire damage it deals necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Scorching Blood
entries: When you are hit by a creature within 5ft of you by a melee attack that deals slashing, piercing, or necrotic damage; the attacker takes acid damage equal to your Wisdom Modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Great Weapon Forging
entries: When you use your Blood Forge feature you can forge martial weapons and two-handed blood weapons. Forging either of these options costs an additional blood die. For the purposes of a versatile weapon, holding the weapon in two hands increases the damage dice by 1 size. Ex. 1d8 turns into a d10, 1d10 into a d12, etc. A weapon that has the Two-Handed Property adds an additional damage die to the damage rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Chilling Blood
entries: You can cast the Armor of Agathys spell at will at 3rd level without material components using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Once you use this trait you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Spiteful Blood
entries: You can spend 3 Blood Dice to cast the Bane spell at will at 3rd level without material components using Wisdom as your spellcasting ability. Once you use this trait you cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Toxic Blood
entries: Whenever you hit a creature using a blood weapon or your bloody tendrils, the creature must make a Constitution Saving Throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, the creature is poisoned until the start of your next turn. On a success the target is immune to the effects of this feature until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Unstable Blood Magic
entries: Whenever you cast a spell using your Hemomancer features, roll a d10. On a 3 or lower your blood magic goes wild. Roll from the Wild Magic chart provided by the Wild Magic Sorcerer, except any effect that includes sorcery points uses Blood Dice instead and any effect that involves spell slots can instead regain the usage of one of your Blood Magic spells of the appropriate slot level. If you have spell slots, then the effect can apply as normal. When your blood magic goes wild you gain 10 temporary hit points.

optionalfeature.name: Impatient Adrenaline
entries: When you take the dash action, you can spend a blood die to double your movement speed. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Constitution Modifier. You regain all expended uses of this feature when you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Fluidity of Blood
entries: You gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a swimming speed, it increases by 30 ft. In addition you can breathe water as if you could breathe air.

optionalfeature.name: Destructive Blood
entries: When you hit with a weapon attack using your blood weapons or bloody tendrils, you can deal an additional 2d10 force damage by spending 2 blood dice. In addition, your blood weapons and bloody tendrils deal double damage to structures and objects.

optionalfeature.name: Bloody Ambush
entries: You can stealth as a bonus action on your turn, in addition you can move using your full movement and stealth at the same time without imposing disadvantage on your stealth check. When you deal damage to a creature(s) that cannot see you, you deal an additional 4d6 damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vampiric Weapons
entries: When you successfully hit a creature with your Blood Weapons or Bloody Tendrils, you replenish one Blood Die into your blood pool. In addition, you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to half the damage you dealt.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Vitality
entries: While you are conscious, you regain an amount of hit points at the start of your turn equal to half your proficiency bonus (rounded down). If you take any form of fire or cold damage you do not gain this benefit. In addition, the first time you would be knocked unconscious as a result of falling to zero hit points, you can spend your reaction to remain at 1 instead. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Corrosive Blood
entries: While your blood bath is active, when you successfully hit a creature with a blood weapon or your bloody tendrils they suffer a -2 penalty to their AC until the start of your next turn. A creature can only suffer the penalties of this feature once per round.

optionalfeature.name: Reduced Agony
entries: Whenever you take damage, as a reaction you can reduce the amount of damage you would take by 1d10 + your Wisdom Modifier. If you reduce the damage to 0, immediately you can spend a blood die to make a single weapon attack using a blood weapon or a bloody tendril. You have a number of uses of this feature equal to your Constitution Modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Blood Weapons
entries: Your Blood Weapons and Bloody Tendrils now gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls. In addition, whenever you make a weapon attack using a Blood Weapon or Bloody Tendril, as a bonus action by spending a blood die, you can gain advantage on one attack you make with that chosen weapon.

optionalfeature.name: Permanent Blood Weapon
entries: If you spend a 1 hour ritual concentrating on your Blood Weapon, you can have the weapon forged for an indefinite amount of time, no longer requiring concentration on the weapon. In addition, the weapon cannot be destroyed by non-magical means. You can only have 1 Permanent Blood Weapon at a time.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Vortex
entries: By spending six Blood Dice, you create a 5ft tall and 30 ft radius swirling vortex of blood centered on yourself for 1 minute. The area within the vortex counts as difficult terrain. The vortex moves with you and ignores half and three quarters cover. Each creature, except yourself, within range must make a Strength saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. The vortex deals 6d10 necrotic damage on a failed save and they are dragged 10ft closer to the center. On a successful save they take half as much damage and are not dragged. You concentrate on this feature as if you were concentrating on a spell, when you lose concentration the vortex ends early.

optionalfeature.name: Everlasting Horror
entries: While you are conscious, every hostile creature that can see you must make a wisdom saving throw against your Hemomancer Save DC. On a failed save, they are frightened. While frightened by you in this way, they go into a panic and can only make the attack action on you, otherwise they must use their action to hide, disengage, or dash. A creature who passes the saving throw is not frightened and immune to this feature for 1 hour. A creature can repeat their saving throw at the end of their turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood for the Blood God
entries: When you kill a creature using a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril, as a reaction you can shout “Blood for the Blood God!”. Your Blood Pool is instantly replenished and you gain an amount of temporary hit points equal to the creature’s CR. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Ultimate Vitality
entries: Once while you are conscious, you can restore hit points up to half of your hit point maximum. Once you use this feature you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sacrificial Clone
entries: You know the clone spell and can cast it once per year without requiring material components. Once, while you are unconscious if you were to die and you do not have an active clone, instead all of the blood remaining in your body, as well as your required organs, rises out and you enter your Bloody Form. When you do, you are at 1 hit point and have 3 levels of exhaustion. Your body perishes and requires a new one for the Bloody Form to enter. If you cannot find a body within an amount of days equal to your constitution modifier, you perish. Entering a new body is difficult, and requires an intense amount of willpower. As an action, make an opposing Wisdom Check against the creature whose body you are entering. The target cannot take actions or reactions until either creature succeeds. The creature that fails the opposing check receives one death failure and the winning creature receives one success. You use their statistics, but not their class features. You do gain their innate abilities, innate spellcasting, and racial traits as well as any boons, celestial gifts, etc. You replace their Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores with your own.

optionalfeature.name: Lethal Strike
entries: When you score a critical hit with a Blood Weapon or a Bloody Tendril, by spending half of your blood dice you can instantly drop the creature to 0 hit points, doing so does not outright kill them. You can use this feature once per long rest. This feature has no effect on creatures with Legendary Resistance or Legendary Actions.

optionalfeature.name: Abyssal Drain
entries: You can spend 6 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell contagion}.

optionalfeature.name: Creeping Darkness
entries: You can spend 2 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell darkness}.

optionalfeature.name: Damning Curse
entries: You can spend 1 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell bane}.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Dance
entries: You can spend 2 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell mirror image}.

optionalfeature.name: Dark Passenger
entries: You can spend 3 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell lightning bolt}. The spell deals necrotic damage.

optionalfeature.name: Delirium
entries: You can spend 2 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell suggestion}.

optionalfeature.name: Edge of Shadow
entries: You can spend 2 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell shatter}.

optionalfeature.name: Flood of Darkness
entries: You can spend 6 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell negative energy flood|XGE}.

optionalfeature.name: Helter Skelter
entries: You can spend 4 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell hypnotic pattern}.

optionalfeature.name: Power Slash
entries: You can spend 3 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell elemental weapon}.

optionalfeature.name: Reprisal
entries: You can spend 2 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell hellish rebuke}.

optionalfeature.name: Salted Earth
entries: You can spend 3 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell hunger of Hadar}.

optionalfeature.name: Scourge
entries: You can spend 1 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell hex}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Skin
entries: You can spend 4 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell shadow of Moil}.

optionalfeature.name: Shadow Wall
entries: You can spend 6 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell wall of force}.

optionalfeature.name: Syphon Stouch
entries: You can 3 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell vampiric touch}.

optionalfeature.name: Unleash
entries: You can 1 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell arms of Hadar}.

optionalfeature.name: Unmend
entries: You can 1 {@classFeature Well of Darkness|Dark Knight|FFXIV|1} points to cast {@spell magic missile}.

optionalfeature.name: Fleet Foot
entries: Your movement speed increases by 5ft.

optionalfeature.name: Fuma
entries: Performing the Furna ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell ice knife|XGE} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Shadon
entries: Performing the Furna ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell darkness} spell.

optionalfeature.name: Katon
entries: Performing the Katon ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell fireball} spell at half the maximum range.

optionalfeature.name: Raiton
entries: Performing the Raiton ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell lightning bolt} spell at half the maximum range.

optionalfeature.name: Hyoton
entries: Performing the Hyoton ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell ice storm} spell at half the maximum range.

optionalfeature.name: Huton
entries: Performing the Huton ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell haste} spell on yourself.

optionalfeature.name: Doton
entries: Performing the Doton ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell doton|FFXIV} spell

optionalfeature.name: Suiton
entries: Performing the Suiton ninjutsu allows you to cast the {@spell suiton|FFXIV} spell

optionalfeature.name: Gunner
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls you make with your Gunner Shot {@action Attack} action.

optionalfeature.name: Adamantoise Shell
entries: You can cast {@spell mage armor} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Ahriman's Gaze
entries: You can cast {@spell hold person} once using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Bad Breath
entries: You develop a breath weapon you may use as your action. Your breath weapon is a 15ft. cone. Any creature in range must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC. Your breath weapon deals poison damage. A creature takes {@dice 2d6} damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one. The damage increases to {@dice 3d6} at 6th level, {@dice 4d6} at 11th level, and {@dice 5d6} at 16th level. Each time the damage of your breath weapon increases, the range also increases by 5ft.
Additionally, a creature who fails their saving throw becomes poisoned or blinded for 1 minute. You choose the additional effects when you decide to take this action.
You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Siphon
entries: You can cast {@spell vampiric touch} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Behemoth's Destruction
entries: You can cast {@spell destructive wave} once using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Bomb Detonation
entries: You can cast {@spell fireball} at will centered on yourself. You automatically take half the damage of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Cactuar Needles
entries: When you are attacked by a melee weapon attack, as a reaction you may release a flurry of aetherial needles from your body in a 5ft. radius around you. All creatures in range must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC, taking {@dice 1d10} damage on a failure and half as much on a success. Creatures who fail this saving throw become poisoned for one minute.

optionalfeature.name: Crab Grab
entries: When you use your {@action Attack|PHB} action to grapple a creature of your size or smaller, you gain advantage on your Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check.

optionalfeature.name: Chocobo's Dash
entries: You can cast {@spell expeditious retreat} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Choco Cure
entries: You can cast {@spell cure wounds} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Coblyn's Shatter
entries: You can cast {@spell shatter} at will centered on yourself. You automatically take half the damage of the spell.

optionalfeature.name: Couerl Blaster
entries: You can cast {@spell lightning bolt} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Drake Breath
entries: You can cast {@spell Aganazzar's scorcher|XGE} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Flan's Body
entries: You can cast {@spell absorb elements|XGE} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.
You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Funguar's Nature
entries: You can cast {@spell speak with plants} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Gremlin Tongue
entries: You can cast {@spell vicious mockery}. You gain proficiency in the {@skill Deception} skill.

optionalfeature.name: Goblin Operations
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Sleight of Hand} and {@skill Stealth} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Goobbue Sneeze
entries: You can cast {@spell stinking cloud} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Mandragora Shriek
entries: You can cast {@spell confusion} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Mantis Claws
entries: You can attack with your weapon twice, instead of once, whenever you take the {@action Attack} action on your turn.

optionalfeature.name: Mind Flayer's Blast
entries: As an action, you release a blast of psychic energy from your mouth. All creatures in a 15ft. cone make an Intelligence saving throw against your spell save DC. On a failure, they become {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. They may repeat the save as an action on their turn.
You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Mimic's Nature
entries: You can cast {@spell disguise self} at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Pom Cure
entries: You can cast {@spell healing word} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Ochu Vines
entries: You can cast {@spell entangle} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Opo-Opo Athletics
entries: You gain proficiency in the {@skill Athletics} and {@skill Acrobatics} skills.

optionalfeature.name: Sahagin's Curse
entries: You can cast {@spell polymorph} using a blue mage spell slot. You may only select {@monster frog|MM} or a {@monster giant frog|MM} as the new form. You can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Succubus Charm
entries: You can cast {@spell charm person} at will, without spending a spell slot or material components. A creature that resists this effect becomes immune to this spell cast by you for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Frog's Legs
entries: You can cast {@spell jump} on yourself at will, without expending a spell slot or material components.

optionalfeature.name: Tonberry's Grudge
entries: When you attack a creature who is {@condition stunned} or {@condition paralyed} with a melee weapon, you deal bonus damage equal to the average damage of the weapon's damage die.

optionalfeature.name: Undead Tough
entries: You can cast {@spell inflict wounds} using a blue mage spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Worm Sense
entries: You gain 30ft. {@sense tremorsense}. You can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a 30ft. radius, provided that you and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance. {@sense tremorsense} can't be used to detect flying or incorporeal creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Zu's Rage
entries: As an action, you leap 20ft. from your current location at blinding speed, delivering a leaping strike with a melee weapon. Once you land, you may make one melee weapon attack against a creature within range. this attack does bonus damage equal to your spellcasting ability modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Advantageous
entries: When rolling initiative, you may expend one use of tactics to increase an ally or your own initiative roll by your proficiency bonus. You may only do so once per initiative roll.

optionalfeature.name: Aetherial Barrier
entries: When a creature you can see attacks a target other than you that is within 5 feet of you or your summoned ally, you can use your reaction to impose disadvantage on the attack roll.

optionalfeature.name: Blessing of Nym
entries: {@b (Scholar only).} You may cast a spell recovers hit points or is from the Nymian Scholar spell list through your summoned ally. Your fey acts the point of origin for the spell and your touch based spells be cast as though you were standing where your fey is.

optionalfeature.name: Bombarding
entries: {@b (Tactician only).} When you take an attack or cast a spell, you may direct one of your companions strike. When you do so, choose a friendly creature who can or hear you. That creature can immediately use its to make one weapon attack.

optionalfeature.name: Castle
entries: {@b (10th Level Required).} Your summoned ally and a willing creature within 15ft. of it instantaneously switch positions. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Carbuncle Bind
entries: {@b (Tactician Only).} When your carbuncle lands a melee attack, as a reaction you may attempt to bind a creature to your carbuncle. The target of your carbuncle's attack must make a dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a binding ethereal chain bursts forth from the carbuncle, shackling the target. The creature may not move more than 5ft away from the carbuncle for 1d4 rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Carbuncle Shine
entries: {@b (Tactician Only).} As a bonus action you cause your carbuncle to shine brightly. All creatures who can see the carbuncle within 10ft. must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is blinded for 1d4 rounds.

optionalfeature.name: Deployment Tactics
entries: {@b (Tactician Only).} As a bonus action, select two friendly creatures who can see and hear you. They may move up to half their movement speed without provoking attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Devotion
entries: {@b (Summoner only, 10th Level Required).} When a creature within 5ft. of your summoned ally attacks another creature with a melee attack successfully, as a reaction you may add your Intelligence modifier and proficiency bonus to the damage roll.

optionalfeature.name: Elemental Attunement
entries: {@b (Summoner only).} As an action, you may grant resistance to fire, cold, lightning, poison or thunder damage to yourself or a creature within 5ft. of you for a number of rounds equal to your Intelligence modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Emergency Tactics
entries: {@b (Scholar only, 10th Level Required).} When a creature you can see takes damage, as a reaction you may cast a spell which heals a target.

optionalfeature.name: Excogitation
entries: {@b (Scholar only).} When you cast a healing spell, you may delay the effect by up to 1 minute. The spell effect activates after the target takes a total amount of damage declared by you when you use this tactic. If the creature reaches 0 hit points or less the healing spell takes effect immediately

optionalfeature.name: False Fear
entries: {@b (Tactician only, 6th Level Required).} When your carbuncle lands an attack, as a reaction you may attempt to attack their mind as well, The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw against yoru spell save DC, on a failed save their mind is infested with an illusion causing them to become frightened of the carbuncle until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Logistics Preparation
entries: As a bonus action, all allied creatures within 10ft. of you gain 10ft. of movement until the start of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Nymian Preparation
entries: {@b (Scholar only, 6th Level Required).} When you cast a spell which heals hit points, instead of healing the target, they gain temporary hit points equal to half the amount of hit points that would have been healed. The healing spell must require the caster to roll dice to decide the amount of hit points recoverd. Either die results in its maximum value, the creature gains temporary hit points equal to the full amount of hit points healed.

optionalfeature.name: Plan of Attack
entries: As a reaction, you may add your proficiency bonus to the attack roll of an allied creature within 10 ft. of you.

optionalfeature.name: Quick Summoning
entries: {@b (14th Level Required).} As an action, you may use your Summoning feature instantly. You may do so once, use of this tactic recovers after a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Rouse
entries: As a bonus action, for a number of rounds equal to Intelligence modifier, add your Intelligence modifier to the damage rolls and the healing effects of your summoned ally.

optionalfeature.name: Spreading Strike
entries: {@b (6th level Required).} When your summoned ally lands an attack, as a reaction you may direct your summoned ally to launch a second attack n oa creature 5ft. from the first target.

optionalfeature.name: Spur
entries: {@b (Summoner only).} As a reaction when your Egi takes an action, they gain advantage on their attack roll. The additional damage from your proficiency bonus is doubled for this attack.

optionalfeature.name: Switching Step
entries: {@b (6th Level Required).} As a bonus action, you may switch places with your summoned ally instantly if they are within 60ft. of your. This does not provoke attacks of opportunity.

optionalfeature.name: Tactical Position
entries: {@b (Tactician Only).} You may use the help action as a bonus action.

optionalfeature.name: Tri-bind
entries: {@b (Summoner only, 6th Level Required).} As an action all creatures within 10ft. of your summoned ally must make a Dexterity saving throw against your spell save DC or become restrained. As an action the creatures may make a Strength saving throw to end the effect.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Anxious
entries: As a bonus action, you magnify the adrenaline in the body of a creature within 30 feet of you, making them susceptible to forceful influence. Until the end of your next turn, all creatures have advantage on Charisma (Intimidation) checks directed at the target creature.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next Wisdom saving throw the target has to make before this curse ends has disadvantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Binding
entries: As a bonus action, you can attempt to bind a creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is no more than one size larger than you. The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have their speed be reduced to 0 and they can't use reactions until the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute and can affect a creature regardless of their size category. At the end of each of its turns, the cursed creature can make another Strength saving throw. On a success, this curse ends.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Bloated Agony
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you to painfully swell until the end of your next turn. For the duration of this curse, the creature has disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks, and suffers 1d8 necrotic damage if it makes more than one melee or ranged attack during its turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: This curse lasts for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the cursed creature can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, this curse ends.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Corrosion
entries: As a bonus action, a creature within 30 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Constitution saving throw. On a success, the curse ends.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature suffers 4d6 necrotic damage, and suffers this damage again every time it fail sits Constitution saving throw to end this curse at the end of its turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Exorcist
entries: As a bonus action, you can choose one creature you can see within 30 feet of you that is charmed, frightened, or possessed. The target creature is no longer charmed, frightened, or possessed.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The creature that charmed, frightened, or possessed the target of your curse suffers 3d6 psychic damage and must make a Wisdom saving throw or be stunned until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of Exposure
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet is hit with an attack or spell, you can use your reaction to temporarily weaken their resilience against it. Until the end of the turn, the target loses their resistance to the damage types of the triggering attack or spell.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The target instead loses invulnerability to the damage types of the triggering attack or spell, having resistance to them until the end of the turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Eyeless
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet of you makes an attack roll, you can use your reaction to roll one hemocraft die and subtract the number rolled from the creature's attack roll. You can choose to use this feature after the creature's roll, but before the DM determines whether the attack roll succeeds. The creature is immune if it is immune to blindness.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You apply this curse to all of the creature's attack rolls until the end of the turn. You roll a new hemocraft die for each affected attack.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Fallen Puppet
entries: When a creature you can see within 30 feet drops to 0 hit points, you can use your reaction to make that creature immediately makes a single weapon attack against a target of your choice within its attack range.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: You can first move the cursed creature up to half their speed, and you grant a bonus to the cursed creature's attack roll equal to your Intelligence modifier (minimum of 1).

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Howl
entries: As an action, you unleash a blood-curdling howl. Each creature within 30 feet of you that can hear you must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. If they fail their saving throw by 5 or more, they are stunned while frightened in this way. A creature that succeeds on this saving throw is immune to this blood curse for the next 24 hours. You can choose any number of creatures you can see to be unaffected by this howl.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The range of this curse increases to 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Marked
entries: As a bonus action, you can mark a creature within 30 feet of you. Until the end of your turn, you roll an additional hemocraft die whenever you deal rite damage to the target.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The next attack roll you make against the target before the end of your turn has advantage.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Muddled Mind
entries: As a bonus action, you curse a creature that you can see within 30 feet of you that is concentrating on a spell. That creature has disadvantage on the next Constitution saving throw it must make to maintain concentration before the end of your next turn.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: The cursed creature has disadvantage on all Constitution saving throws made to maintain concentration of spells until the end of your next turn.

optionalfeature.name: Blood Curse of the Souleater
entries: When a creature that isn't a construct or undead is reduced to 0 hit points within 30 feet of you, you can use your reaction to usher their soul to your patron in exchange for power. Until the end of your next turn, your weapon attacks have advantage.

entries.name: Amplify
entries: In addition, you regain an expended warlock spellslot. Once you've amplified this blood curse, you must finish a long rest before you can amplify it again.

optionalfeature.name: Aether
entries: You gain a flying speed of 20 feet for 1 hour. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength and Dexterity ability checks for 1 hour.

optionalfeature.name: Cruelty
entries: When you use the Attack action, you can make an additional weapon attack as a bonus action. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Precision
entries: Your weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19-20. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Reconstruction
entries: For 1 hour, at the start of each of your turns, you regain hit points equal to your proficiency bonus if you have at least 1 hit point but no more than half of your hit points left. As a side effect, your speed decreases by 10ft for 1hour.

optionalfeature.name: Alluring
entries: Your skin and voice become malleable, allowing you to slightly enhance your appearance and presence. You have advantage on Charisma ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on initiative rolls.

optionalfeature.name: Celerity
entries: Your Dexterity score increases by 3, as does your Dexterity maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Conversant
entries: You gain advantage on Intelligence ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Deftness
entries: You gain advantage on Dexterity ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Embers
entries: You gain resistance to fire damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to cold damage.

optionalfeature.name: Gelid
entries: You gain resistance to cold damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to fire damage.

optionalfeature.name: Impermeable
entries: You gain resistance to piercing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Mobile
entries: You are immune to the grappled and restrained conditions. At 11th level, you also are immune to the paralyzed condition. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Strength ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Nighteye
entries: You gain darkvision for up to 60 feet. If you already have darkvision, this increases its range by 60 additional feet. As a side effect, you gain sunlight sensitivity (detailed in the Dark Elf section on page 24 in the Player's Handbook).

optionalfeature.name: Percipient
entries: You gain advantage on Wisdom ability checks. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Potency
entries: Your Strength score increases by 3, as does your Strength maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Rapidity
entries: Your speed increases by 10feet. At 15th level, your speed increases by 15 feet instead. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Intelligence ability checks.

optionalfeature.name: Sagacity
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 3, as does your Intelligence maximum. This bonus increases by 1 at 11th level (+4) and 18th level (+5). As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on Charisma saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: Shielded
entries: You gain resistance to slashing damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to bludgeoning damage.

optionalfeature.name: Unbreakable
entries: You gain resistance to bludgeoning damage. As a side effect, you gain vulnerability to piercing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Vermillion
entries: You gain an additional use of your Blood Maledict feature. As a side effect, you gain disadvantage on death saving throws.

optionalfeature.name: All Knowing Eyes
entries: You learn the identify spell and can cast it without requiring components or spending a spell slot. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. Instead of having a range of touch, you can identify an object so long as you can see it and is within 30 ft. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components and range to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Claws and Fangs
entries: You have two natural weapons in the form of claws and fangs. These natural weapons use your Strength modifier for its attack and damage rolls, and each deals 1d8 points of piercing or slashing damage.

optionalfeature.name: Dragonsong
entries: You have advantage on performance and acrobatics checks. You gain proficiency in two musical instruments of your choice.

As a bonus action you can evoke the power of your Dragonsong for 1 minute. While active, your Dragonsong gives a +2 bonus to your AC and Dexterity Saving throws. You cannot use your Dragonsong again until you finish a long rest.

optionalfeature.name: Sight of the Land and Seas
entries: You gain a tremorsense of 60 feet.

optionalfeature.name: Terrifying Glare
entries: You gain proficiency in Intimidation and have advantage on Intimidation checks. If you already have proficiency in Intimidation, you add double your proficiency bonus instead.

optionalfeature.name: Minor Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 60 ft of darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Eyes of the Magi Drakes
entries: You learn the detect magic spell and can cast it once without requiring components, regaining the usage of it after a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Sense Treasure
entries: You can detect whether or not gold or magical items are within 30ft of you, but not how much or where specifically. This sense does not properly function if the treasure is worth less than 100 gp in value, or if it is protected by divination magic or if it is wrapped in a thin sheet of lead.

optionalfeature.name: Graceful Fall
entries: You can magically summon forth gales of wind powerful enough to stop your fall. You learn the feather fall spell and can cast it without spending a spell slot or requiring components once. You cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell and if you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature you can cast this spell using those appropriate spell slots, but doing so would require the necessary components.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Heritage
entries: Regardless of your race, you can take any racial feat that requires a dragonborn, half dragon, or other similar races.

optionalfeature.name: Abstrac Origins
entries: Your ancestry was more prominent with dragon-kind than you initially believed, while you do not gain the natural resistances of both worlds, you have multiple dragon-kind in your history. Choose one additional Draconic Origin. You do not gain any additional proficiencies or resistances, but you can now take feats or Draconian Powers with prerequisites requiring that Draconic Origin.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Sigils
entries: You’ve learned how to use special sigils to protect yourself and your belongings. You can carve these sigils into any object big enough to fit them. In order for a sigil to be active, a creature must attune to it as they would a magic item, but this does not count as an attuned magic item nor does it count against your attunement slots. You have three sigils, a creature can only be attuned to one sigil at a time, any attempt to attune to a different sigil ends the attunement on the previous one.

entries.name: Sigil of Storage
entries: This sigil can be stored on any stone or container. Simply tap an item onto the object with the sigil, and it vanishes into an extradimensional space. This space can store up to 100 lbs worth of items. If more than 100 lbs is in use, the object shatters and all the items stored within it drop within 5 ft of the destroyed object. If creatures are occupying that space, they take 2d10 bludgeoning damage. You cannot have an object with an extradimensional storage, such as a bag of holding or similar item inside of an object with the sigil of storage.

entries.name: Sigil of Protection
entries: This sigil can go on any tiny object that can be worn or carried. This object provides a +1 to AC or saving throws (you choose upon attunement). If the attuned creature takes damage, this benefit is subsided until the start of their next turn.

entries.name: Sigil of Warning
entries: If something in your possession is taken without your knowledge, you get an alarm from your head warning you that something is wrong. You do not know what is immediately taken, only that something is missing. In addition, while you are asleep you get a mental ping if a creature comes within 10 ft of you.

optionalfeature.name: Knowledge of the Dragon Kin
entries: You have an astute memory and can recall lore quicker than a scholar. You have advantage on Intelligence ability checks used to recall history, lore, or information on magical creatures.

optionalfeature.name: Fiendish Legacy
entries: Your draconic blood comes from a dragon from either the Abyss or the Nine Hells. You have resistance to damage from fiends and you do not suffer the negative effects of being in the Abyss or the Nine Hells. In addition, regardless of your race you can take any of the racial feats that has a prerequisite for tiefling, or any race with origins from the Abyss or Nine Hells.

In addition, you learn the thaumaturgy cantrip. You also learn the hellish rebuke and darkness spells and can cast them once without requiring material components. Once you cast either spell in this way, you cannot cast that spell again until you complete a long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: Acidic Shield
entries: Your resistance to acid damage becomes improved when traversing through non-magical acid. If you are partially or fully submerged in non-magical acid, you can traverse through it as if you were swimming through water. If you are fully submerged, you take 4d10 acid damage for every minute you spend submerged. If you are partially submerged, you take 2d10 acid damage for every minute you spend submerged.

optionalfeature.name: Gift of the Sea Dragon
entries: You can breathe underwater as you do air. In addition, you gain a swimming speed equal to your walking speed. If you already had a swimming speed, it increases by 30 ft.

otherSummary.entry: Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconic Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Gold, Green, Bronze, White, or Black Draconic Origins

optionalfeature.name: Magma Walk
entries: Your resistance to fire damage becomes improved when traversing through non-magical lava. If you are partially or fully submerged in non-magical lava, you can traverse through it as if you were swimming through water. If you are fully submerged, you take 4d10 fire damage for every minute you spend submerged. If you are partially submerged, you take 2d10 fire damage for every minute you spend submerged.

otherSummary.entry: Gold, Brass, or Red Draconic Origins
otherSummary.entrySummary: Gold, Brass, or Red Draconic Origins

optionalfeature.name: Tundra Walker
entries: You’ve become naturally adept to the frozen climates. You ignore difficult terrain accustomed to frozen wastelands or extremely cold environments, along with any detrimental effects that follows.

In addition, you’ve learned how to use these frozen environments to your advantage. You learn the Armor of Agathys spell and while in one of the aforementioned environments, you can cast it at its lowest level at will, without spending a spell slot or requiring material components. Otherwise, you can cast it once without spending a spell slot and cannot do so again until you finish a short or long rest. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast this spell using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.

optionalfeature.name: You're a Wizard, Dragon
entries: A magical spell book appears into your hands. As a bonus action, you can send this spellbook into an extradimensional space and vice versa. You learn one cantrip from the Wizard spell list. You also learn two first level spells from the Wizard spell list and can cast each of them without requiring material components once, regaining the ability to do so after a long rest. The spells are written into your spellbook, and you can use your spellbook as an arcane focus. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for these spells. If you have the spellcasting or pact magic feature, you can cast these spells using one of those spell slots, but you use the original components to do so.
When you gain a level in any class, you can replace one of the spells in your spellbook with another spell from the Wizard’s spell list.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Breath Weapon
entries: Depending on the Draconian Origin you picked you gain a breath weapon that does 4d6 damage. The number of damage dice increases by 2 at 5th level, and then again at 10th, once more at 15th, and one last time at 20th level. You have a number of uses of this Draconian Power equal to half your Constitution Modifier (rounded down, minimum of 1) and regain all uses of it after a long rest. (Look at the Dragonborn Ancestry to determine the damage type and range). At 5th level the breath weapon increases to a range of a 30 foot cone or line depending on the type of dragon, 60 feet at 11th level, and 90 feet at 17th. The save DC for this power is 8 + Proficiency Bonus + your Constitution modifier.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the “Find Familiar” spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Deadly Veroicity
entries: If you move 20 ft towards a creature and make a melee weapon attack against that creature, you add an additional 1d6 damage of the weapon’s type and they make a strength saving throw DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your strength or dexterity modifier. On a failed save, they are knocked prone.

optionalfeature.name: Draconian Shapechanger
entries: You learn the disguise self and alter self spells, and can cast each of them without requiring components once per short or long rest without spending a spell slot.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Wings
entries: You grow a pair of wings that allows you to fly. While you are wearing medium or light armor, or wearing no armor, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

optionalfeature.name: Moderate Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 10 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Mystical Insight
entries: You have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks, in addition as an action you can make a Wisdom (Insight) check opposed against an opposing creature’s Charisma (Deception) check. On a success, you can determine whether the creature is evil, good, or neutral and their creature type.

optionalfeature.name: Greater Draconian Familiar
entries: You can conjure a tiny dragon to keep you company. You can ritual cast the “Find Familiar” spell without requiring material components, but you can only summon a Pseudodragon or a Faerie Dragon with this feature. The Pseudodragon or Faerie Dragon has the “Familiar” feature when summoned in this way.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon's Fury
entries: You have a special action that you can use to unleash a powerful barrage of attacks. You make four melee weapon attacks, but you do not add your Strength or Dexterity modifier to the damage rolls of the last two attacks. If you use an ability modifier for damage other than Strength or Dexterity, the same restriction applies. When you use this feature, you lose the ability to do so, but you roll a d6 at the start of each of your turns. On a 5-6 you regain the usage of this feature. You also regain the usage of this feature when you roll initiative.

optionalfeature.name: Hyper Draconian Senses
entries: You gain 30 ft of  blindsight and 120 ft of darkvision if you don’t have it already. Magical darkness no longer impedes your darkvision. If you already had darkvision, its range increases by 60 ft. If you already had blindsight, its range increases by 20 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Blessings of the Divine Dragons
entries: You gain proficiency in religion and your proficiency bonus is doubled when you make an ability check using that skill. In addition, you learn the guidance cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this cantrip. If a spell, such as raise dead, has the sole effect of restoring you to life (but not undeath), the caster doesn't need material components to cast the spell on you. However, this blessing can only be used sparingly. Each time after the first usage, the caster must pass a DC 20 ability check using their spellcasting ability, or the spell fails and is wasted.

optionalfeature.name: Improved Flight
entries: Your ability to fly has greatly improved since you started, and now you can rival the speed of most dragons. Your flying speed increases by 30 ft.

optionalfeature.name: Draconic Artifact
entries: A magical artifact with draconic origins appears in your hand. Work with your DM on the specifics of the magical item, but the specific guidelines of the item goes as follows:

items: The item requires attunement, but does not count against your total attunement slots.
If the item is a weapon, it is a magical weapon with a +3 magic bonus to its attack and damage rolls.

It has one minor beneficial artifact property, one major beneficial artifact property, and one minor detrimental artifact property. You can roll these on their respective tables, or the DM can choose the properties of the item.
If it is an arcane focus, it grants a +2 to spell attack bonus and a +2 to spell save dc.
The item is riddled with draconic scales related to the Draconic Origins of its weidler.

optionalfeature.name: Shared Powers
entries: Your manifested dragon shares the Draconian Powers that you possess that do not have the “Summoner Archetype” prerequisite.

optionalfeature.name: Aura of Friendship
entries: When your manifested dragon is within 10 feet of you, it has a bonus to all saving throws equal to your charisma modifier, to a minimum of 1.

optionalfeature.name: Dragon Rider
entries: When you manifest your dragon, it comes equipped with an exoctic saddle. This saddle has holsters for up to two weapons and a large quiver that can hold up to 40 arrows. While you are mounted on a dragon, you have the following benefits:

list: You have advantage on melee attack rolls against any unmounted creature that is smaller than your dragon.
You can force an attack targeted at your dragon to target you instead.

If your dragon is subjected to an effect that allows it to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, it instead takes no damage if it succeeds on the saving throw, and only half damage if it fails.

optionalfeature.name: Trained Body
entries: You’ve trained your manifested dragon to endure the trials of combat. Your manifested dragon has resistance to slashing, piercing, and bludgeoning damage from non-magical attacks.

optionalfeature.name: Manifest Draconian Magen
entries: As a 1 hour ritual you can summon a dragon-like humanoid to be at your service. Use the Demos Magen statblock with the following changes:
